column1: Sergio George, Carlos Vives – Fabricando Fantasías/La Tierra del Olvido (Medley - Premios Juventud 2025) - TBC - Status Fail - On Direct Upload
column30:
Hello!  

For the below ticket I triggered a Direct Upload to AOMA.  

Upload started and then stopped and then started again.  

Registration Job Status is showing as Failed.  

Aspera video file upload completed. 

https://jira.smedigitalapps.com/jira/browse/WPTS-455445

Please advise.

Best,
Mike O’

Could you please get me access to the file?

!image-2025-10-10-16-26-02-400.png!

Thanks,

Keith;;;

10/Oct/25 10:30 PM;obri001;[~kmccar1]

Hi Keith,

Do you need access to the MSA I created and uploaded?

Best,
MIke O';;;

I don't have permissions control on that link.

But can upload the MSA I created/uploaded to AOMA to Ci and send you a link.

Mike O';;;

My MSA is uploading to Ci.  Upload ETA is 17 Mins.

You should have received an email with link/permissions/password.

Let me know!

Best,
Mike O'

column1: Please regenerate AOMA3 previews for G0100033548998, G010002804884M, G010002656797X, G010001821683V
column30:
AOMA has incorrect or missing previews on the product page for the following:

G0100033548998
-G010002817467D-  G010002804884M
G010002656797X

the "generate previews" button is greyed out. can we have these regenerated?

for the two LFV titles; G0100033548998 and G010002804884M, both feature and trailer previews.

thanks.
column444:
13/Aug/25 9:35 PM;woom001;note:

G0100033548998 looks like rhozet-era previews (interlaced, wrong aspect ratio/squeezed with pillarbox)

-G010002817467D-  G010002804884M looks like old FFMPEG-era previews (left channel of 5.1 only instead of stereo 7-8)

G010002656797X is SFV missing with error "Error loading media: File could not be played". i ran MBC program only of the equivalent 2086 and got a conversion, so not source related.;;;
column446:
13/Aug/25 9:53 PM;kmccar1;G010002817467D

I'm not seeing any assets linked to this one, [~woom001]. Looks like it had registered assets back in 2015, but was replaced by product G010002804884M, which is currently active and full published. 

!image-2025-08-13-15-51-46-859.png!

!image-2025-08-13-15-52-15-405.png!

column454: 20/Aug/25 6:46 PM;shar051;[~kmccar1] Regenerated the previews Should be done in sometime;;;
column455:

[~woom001], looks like only G010002804884M is still generating at the moment. How do the others look?

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column457:
20/Aug/25 10:01 PM;woom001;Hi [~kmccar1]

i've checked the 3 remaining products ( G0100033548998, G010002804884M, G010001821683V) and verified the new previews are present.

i think a longer term solution will be to have LFV previews regenerated for all stereo products prior to our switch over to CT 3007 (Nov 2019 per MLIB-475) and all 5.1 products prior to our switch over to CT3008 (May 2024 per XSC-581).

thanks.;;;

column1: Pro Res 4444 UST submission wasn't autocorrected
column30:
Our video engineer Sagar has noted that he submitted a Pro Res 4444 to be registered under G010005641402D and instead of the video file being autocorrected to a Pro Res 422 (HQ) MSA, it registered successfully which may be a bug related to the recent AOMA build.

We're manually creating and re-registering a Pro Res 422 (HQ) now but I thought I should bring this to your attention incase other submissions have been impacted.
column444: 03/Sep/25 11:43 AM;burg036;+Watchers;;;
column446: 03/Sep/25 3:29 PM;hale002;Checking this ;;;
column449:
04/Sep/25 11:50 AM;whit056;Hi Matthew,

Perhaps I missed conversations on this whilst I've been away for paternity leave but my understanding is that the master storage asset for a shortform video registration has to be Pro Res 422 (HQ) even if a higher data rate file such as a Pro Res 4444 is submitted for registration.

Assigning this ticket over to [~alcoc02] for confirmation.

Many Thanks

Ben;;;
column450:
04/Sep/25 9:06 PM;rhayloc;All, not sure what happened here... If a video is converted via Auto Correct it is made to PR 422HQ.. It does not pass the codec... does not work that way. I tested as well in Prod (see attached). I think everything is working as expected.. This may be some confusion on user/ engineer side. I'll review with team separately to see.

Thanks;;;
column451:
12/Sep/25 6:20 PM;hale002;Pro Res 4444 XQ is working as expected but Pro Res 4444 is not working as expected, Please refer to row 275, 276 & 277 on reg. validation sheet.

!image-2025-09-12-12-20-36-289.png!;;;
column452:
24/Sep/25 8:12 PM;spag001;Hi [~whit056] [~alcoc02] ,

We have updated the supported list as last night so 4444 formats will go back to auto-correction workflows.  (One note need to push a small correction to the error message wording this weekend)

Thanks

Matthew;;;

column1: Archive Package Master Number: 27553368 Upload to Archive Submission tool has completed in Aspera but is stuck on web interface
column30:

Thanks, TIm

column1: Un-linking Masters from Published Product G0100056260650
column30:
Hi Team, 

I've been asked by the label to link the masters under G0100056260650 to a new Product Number G010005664303I. 

The linking to G010005664303I is complete but I can't unlink the Masters from the old Product Number because this product is published. 

Is it possible to un-link the Masters: 

27410236
and
27414902

From G0100056260650? But keep the new associations with G010005664303I intact. 

This may require G0100056260650 to be un-published, which I'm not able to do. 

Thanks in advance for your help! 

Cristen
column444:
09/Oct/25 3:33 PM;kmccar1;Hi [~read008].

The label will need to request unpublish via the Order Management team (DPSO Unpublish ticket). "Other Master Reason (AOMA)."

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column445:
09/Oct/25 7:26 PM;read008;Hi Keith, 

Thanks very much, I've passed this info on.

Cristen  

;;;

To: Sony Music-US, AOMA Support <aoma.support@sonymusic.com>

I'm reaching out to get some assistance with this archive. It shows complete ( done ) in Aspera but not in AOMA.
column444:
15/Nov/23 10:13 PM;kmccar1;Hi team,

Could you please check on this one for Shareef from Battery? Doesn't look like the progress indicator is moving past the point it is at now.

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column445:
15/Nov/23 11:57 PM;spag001;Hi [~KUMA039],

Can you take a look at this.

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column446:
16/Nov/23 2:40 PM;kuma039;Hi [~SPAG001] /[~kmccar1] ,

I have analyze this issue and did my initial analysis and after reviewing the logs, found that 250 directories and 488937 files were moved to S3 having total size of 619 GB from efs location and I have not observed any exception or error as per my initial analysis. 

I am reviewing further why the status is not moving.

Regards,

Deepak

 

 ;;;
column447:
20/Nov/23 3:44 PM;kuma039;Hi [~kmccar1] ,

Have reviewed the logs further and found that the file were not copied properly, only 57% file got uploaded and though aspera transfer is showing completed. We are suspecting this is due to any of the file from source is got deleted in between transfer which may cause this issue.

Also, we found that some system variables which needs to be created does not happened due to above mentioned issue and this registration seems to be incomplete and stuck.

Hence we have to request the user to initiate new registration. We can mark this stuck in progress registration to "FAILED" status from backend, please let us know.

As a side note, if the registration package is of big size its better to break it into a small packages into different registrations so that it doesn't get stuck.

Sincere apologies for the inconvenience caused here.;;;
column448:
30/Sep/25 5:46 PM;kuma039;Hi [~kmccar1] ,

Please review this issue and let me know if you have any questions/issue.

Regards,

Deepak ;;;

column1: Bulk Account Settings Updates - UST SFV ENVELOPE Permission
column30:
Hi there db team,

Could you please add the UST SFV ENVELOPE permission to all AOMA user accounts (active and inactive, just in case) that have been previously set with the UNIFIED SUBMISSION TOOL permission? 

Please let me know if you need any further information.

Thanks,

Keith
column444:
08/Oct/25 2:47 PM;burg036;Hey Support, 
 
Can we have the envelope permission added to/applied to the accounts of all label/affiliate SFV UST upload users? 
All should have this permission by default apart from outside studios users.  
 
Thanks, 
 
*Michael Catandella* | VP, Media Production Operations | office (() 212.833.4897 | cell (() 917.816.5010 | (:) +[michael.catandella@sonymusic.com|mailto:michael.catandella@sonymusic.com]+

Sony Music Entertainment | 25 Madison Avenue | New York, NY  10010 | +[http://www.sonymusic.com/|https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.sonymusic.com%2F&data=05%7C02%7Cfiona.burgess.ext%40sonymusic.com%7C04d52296deff4483de8808de0666a49a%7Cf0aff3b791a54aaeaf71c63e1dda2049%7C0%7C0%7C638955235070590994%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=G61Jp1SJivKEkQcOKku9mSMZX7NFPLu8AjRUafNQxyg%3D&reserved=0]+

 ;;;
column446:
08/Oct/25 10:33 PM;poth003;Hi [~kmccar1],

We have added UST SFV ENVELOPE permission to 637 active and inactive users with UNIFIED SUBMISSION TOOL permission that did not have UST SFV ENVELOPE permission before. Also, currently, the roles 'ADMINISTRATOR' and 'GMP_MEDIA_ENGINEER' have the permission 'UNIFIED SUBMISSION TOOL' added to them. The role 'BASIC_USER' has UST SFV ENVELOPE permission added to it. Please confirm if we should be adding UST SFV ENVELOPE permission to 'ADMINISTRATOR' and 'GMP_MEDIA_ENGINEER' roles.

Thanks,

Phani;;;
column447:
08/Oct/25 11:01 PM;kmccar1;Oh I see, that's why our friend Niels was able to send an envelope in the first place. If it's been applied to the basic user role, and every account created is automatically set with said role, we can take no further action here. 

This note appears on the e-card (can I call it that): 
|Please note that the upload invite is only for one time use.| |

I'm going to guess that Niels may have accessed the link previously, causing the ”AccessDeniedAccess Denied” messages. Let me see if I can recreate in stage...

Thank for all the info, Phani. 

Keith;;;
column448: 09/Oct/25 2:41 PM;mcatande;I think we can close this out? Seeme everyone who needs to have access has it already.  ;;;
column449: 09/Oct/25 2:59 PM;burg036;Thanks, all. Will open a new ticket for the initial issue encountered by Niels, if needed.;;;

column444:
18/Sep/25 6:25 PM;kmccar1;Hi there team,

Noting 48 failed SFV exports to the Promo system going back to August 1. What does this error actually mean? How can it be resolved? Why does a resubmit sometimes work and sometimes not? 

This is starting to cause major business noise - way too many failures. 

Please advise.

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column445:
18/Sep/25 6:31 PM;giri004;Hi [~kmccar1] 

There have been some intermittent issues with the S3 upload from Promo that is causing the failures specifically for the larger assets.

I have put in a fix for this and it currently in testing phase. Once the testing is completed, we will push this change along with the AOMA build.

Regards

Soumya;;;
column446:
18/Sep/25 6:32 PM;kmccar1;Sounds great, thanks for the information and update [~giri004].

Keith;;;

column453:
29/Sep/25 3:11 PM;giri004;Hi [~kmccar1]

Please let me know if you see any failures.

Regards

column1: UST Aspera Issue
column30:
Hi team,

We've had a couple of users note issues with UST Aspera in the last two days. They get redirected to the screen below after selecting the file. Today we were able to confirm this from our side.
 !image-2025-05-09-09-41-43-426.png|thumbnail! 

Example product: G010005523759E with 24 Bit WAV MFiT option
Selected Local (Aspera Upload), then selected the file. The system redirected to the screen below.
 !image-2025-05-09-09-45-57-219.png|thumbnail! 

Mac OS - Version 136.0.7103.93 (Official Build) (arm64), Aspera Connect 4.2.14.855
 !image-2025-05-09-09-55-48-210.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2025-05-09-09-58-03-962.png|thumbnail! 

FYI, we were able to successfully register via TusD.

Thanks,

Fiona
column445:
14/May/25 11:29 AM;burg036;Hi [~HALE002] here are other examples of this Aspera issue: G010005523577Q and G010005528412P

_Hi Fiona,
 
Yes, for G010005523577Q and the new product G010005528412P.
The system was a bit slow, but everything went through just fine. 😊
 
Best regards,
Toey
 
From: Burgess, Fiona , EXT <fiona.burgess.ext@sonymusic.com>
Date: Wednesday, 14 May BE 2568 at 15:04
To: Baisri, Panphaka, Sony Music Thailand <panphaka.baisri@sonymusic.com>, Sony Music-US, AOMA Support <aoma.support@sonymusic.com>
Subject: Re: SME TH - UST upload error

Great. Thanks for confirming, Toey,
 
For our records, was the issue with G010005523577Q?
 
Thanks,
 
Fiona
AOMA Support
 
From: Baisri, Panphaka, Sony Music Thailand <panphaka.baisri@sonymusic.com>
Date: Wednesday, 14 May 2025 at 10:01
To: Burgess, Fiona , EXT <fiona.burgess.ext@sonymusic.com>, Sony Music-US, AOMA Support <aoma.support@sonymusic.com>
Subject: Re: SME TH - UST upload error

Hi Fiona,
 
It works perfectly now, thank you so much for your help!
 
Best regards,
Toey
 
 
From: Burgess, Fiona , EXT <fiona.burgess.ext@sonymusic.com>
Date: Wednesday, 14 May BE 2568 at 14:33
To: Baisri, Panphaka, Sony Music Thailand <panphaka.baisri@sonymusic.com>, Sony Music-US, AOMA Support <aoma.support@sonymusic.com>
Subject: Re: SME TH - UST upload error

Hi Toey,
 
Are you using the Aspera uploader for the 24 Bit WAV master upload? If so, please try TusD instead and let us know how it goes.
 
Thanks,
 
Fiona
AOMA Support
 
From: Baisri, Panphaka, Sony Music Thailand <panphaka.baisri@sonymusic.com>
Date: Wednesday, 14 May 2025 at 07:53
To: Sony Music-US, AOMA Support <aoma.support@sonymusic.com>
Subject: SME TH - UST upload error

Hi Team,
 
I’m about to upload the audio masters to UST for both 16-bit and 24-bit formats. The 16-bit file uploads successfully, but I’m currently facing an issue with the 24-bit upload.
 
I’ve tried using both Chrome and Microsoft Edge, but unfortunately, it still doesn’t work on my end. Could you please advise?
 
 
Image
 
Thank you in advance for your support.
 
Best regards,
Toey
 
 _;;;

column445:
21/Jul/25 3:37 PM;mham001;Hi Team,
I have analyzed UST logs. Please find the finding below 

User entered WPTS-447365 in text box.
Product number is missing in ticket https://jira.smedigitalapps.com/jira/browse/WPTS-447365
Whenever user enters ticket no, UST  system expects a product number tied to it for further processing.
Since it was missing in this case, there was exception in backend which prohibited  system from creating ticket.

Kibana log trail


{code:java}
https://vpc-aomap-ameba-logs-vmj33aq25xuqejppmf5clb4qvq.eu-central-1.es.amazonaws.com/_plugin/kibana/app/discover#/context/336b7970-b914-11ee-800b-3d01b1851809/39084687251598868784555144655522159950919347846733234176?_g=(filters:!())&_a=(columns:!(kubernetes.container_name,log),filters:!(('$state':(store:appState),meta:(alias:!n,disabled:!t,index:'336b7970-b914-11ee-800b-3d01b1851809',key:kubernetes.container_name,negate:!f,params:(query:aoma-ust),type:phrase),query:(match_phrase:(kubernetes.container_name:aoma-ust)))),predecessorCount:500,sort:!('@timestamp',desc),successorCount:500)

{code}

;;;
column446:
28/Jul/25 3:16 PM;mcatande;When a user enters a Jira ticket number, in this example: WPTS-447365 

The expected behavior is as follows: 
 * If WPTS-447365 is in an open state (not complete or canceled status), the ticket is updated with a comment and a link to UST noting asset has been uploaded. 
 * If WPTS-447365 is in a closed state (is canceled or complete), a new ticket is created linked to WPTS-447365 labeled as a revision. 

Product Number in the Product Number field is irrelevant in this instance.  

What's the product number validation logic?  I'm curious why we'd need to validate against the product number and why a mismatched product number value would constitute a failed ticket creation.  A product number mismatch should result in a warning message in a Jira comment vs. failing to create or update an existing ticket as entered.  ;;;
column447: 01/Aug/25 6:19 PM;mcatande;In this instance the user entered in a WPTS# for a bulk ticket type. We've linked an enhancement we've been asking for where upon successful submission a subtask is created under the bulk ticket in this use case. ;;;
column448:
01/Aug/25 6:21 PM;hale002;As discussed on 8/1/2025 GMP Video call:

In regards to user entering a wrong WPTS ticket then the system should check and if the ticket number is wrong system should create a new wpts ticket ;;;

column446:
25/Jul/25 10:23 PM;woom001;note, this was an HD revision of the original SD submission via WPTS-443500.

it looks like there was a UST swap, but the original metadata for the SD was not updated for the HD file, (existing crops of 22,22,0,0 with Standard 4:3 PAR should have been updated at the time of the swap with 0,0,100,100 crops and square pixel PAR)

I've gone in and manually updated the crop data.

this probably failed UST submission in pre-flight because the HD file was not to spec; the size is 1080x720. the original SD was scaled up by 1.5x but the PAR was not accounted for; the video should have been compensated for square pixels to 960x720 instead.

ideal video (cropped) should look like this:

 !actual.jpg|thumbnail! 

the video currently (matted to 1280x720) looks like this (stretched):

 !current.jpg|thumbnail! 

this might have been creative and we should confirm, though this request seemed urgent at the time.
 
thanks.;;;

column462:
15/Apr/25 4:19 PM;spag001;Hi all,

I've send [~READ008] a direct download link so we should be all good here. I've also found out the cause for this one and will create a fix ticket for the issue.

There is a bug that is allowing user's to attempt auto-correct in manual qc if they click the error categories. The problem being is that the asset in manual qc because the previous auto-correct conv failed so the asset never copied over. This kinda buries the original asset in these bad auto correct attempts which we dont have an asset for as the original auto-correct failed.

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column463:
15/Apr/25 4:32 PM;spag001;Hi all,

Linked fix ticket for the issue.

Thanks

Matthew;;;

column1: TusD not workign in UST for master Side and Full master registrations
column30:
TusD doesn't seem to be working for full master or master-side audio registrations. It just uploads track a seemingly random track from the folder to track 1 and nothing else. 

Works as expected for single-track registrations 

This seems to be happening for all products and we are getting reports from affiliates using UST have the same issues. 

 

Aspera is workign as expected

*From:* Catandella, Michael, Sony Music
*Sent:* Tuesday, April 15, 2025 10:41
*To:* Sony Music-US, AOMA Support
*Subject:* Trying to delete a file and getting an error
+[https://aoma.smcdp-de.net/aoma-ui/unified-submission-tool?type=Product&pnumber=G010005499404I|https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Faoma.smcdp-de.net%2Faoma-ui%2Funified-submission-tool%3Ftype%3DProduct%26pnumber%3DG010005499404I&data=05%7C02%7Ckeith.mccarthy.ext%40sonymusic.com%7C7f6323ed624040eb889008dd7c2ba52c%7Cf0aff3b791a54aaeaf71c63e1dda2049%7C0%7C0%7C638803249073676128%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=%2B7Lu9dpnPcMK5Vqeu%2FKvcY8uVWhEWzaCH1ano2JR2Tc%3D&reserved=0]+

I am trying to delete the video from this product:

!image-2025-04-15-11-04-07-841.png!

And I get this message:

!image-2025-04-15-11-04-48-099.png!

No idea what this means, but it clearly isn't deleting the video. 
*From:* McCarthy, Keith, EXT
*Sent:* Tuesday, April 15, 2025 10:48
*To:* Catandella, Michael, Sony Music; Sony Music-US, AOMA Support
*Subject:* Re: Trying to delete a file and getting an error
 
SME Poland has the wrong publish status for this one if we're trying to unregister. It's currently "Pending Retirement," which will still keep the assets 'locked' on the AOMA side. 
 
Created DPSA-30913 to have the error message fixed...
 
NOTE: You cannot delete existing associations because this product has publish status requiring the assets to remain protected. You can perform a "Hot Swap" or request the product to be un-published for an "Asset Related Reason".

G010005499404I - Pending Retirement
column444:
15/Apr/25 4:49 PM;kmccar1;Hi team,

Error message should advise of the publish status blocking the Un registration attempt...

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column445: 15/Apr/25 5:06 PM;mcatande;Better yet, if a master is not delete-able or removable from the UST screen due to publish, the black 'X' delete circle shouldn't be active at all.  It should be greyed out and include a hover over noting that it can't be deleted and why (as truncated as possible). ;;;

column1: TusD upload jobs - Successful registrations, tracks skipped in sorting / "Asset Upload in Progress"

column446:
07/Apr/25 3:12 PM;kmccar1;*From:* Herman, Luis, Digital & Studio Operations, Sony Music Argentina <Luis.Herman@sonymusic.com>
*Sent:* Friday, April 4, 2025 5:10 PM
*To:* Sony Music-US, AOMA Support <aoma.support@sonymusic.com>
*Cc:* Montesdeoca, Oscar, Sony Music <oscar.montesdeoca@sonymusic.com>; Belluscio, Romina, Operaciones, Sony Music Argentina <romina.belluscio@sonymusic.com>
*Subject:* Registration issue ended up in a leak.

I let you guys know what happened today involving an unreleased track .

An irregular registration of an album caused a serious leak incident.

On March31st I registered album G0100054995242, jobs 2639982/84.

I did it using UST / Local (TusD Upload) – Full Master Side

This is the folder containing the uploaded files:

! F0AAAAASUVORK5CYII=|width=369,height=330,id=x_Imagen_x0020_6!

An upload of 24/48 files + 16 bit conversion requested.

After a while I went to the “Registration Job Status” page to see if it already registered, which it apparently did .

 

!g4UAAAAASUVORK5CYII=|width=602,height=75,id=x_Imagen_x0020_5!

 

The product was then successfully scheduled (release on april 30{^}th{^}) and +full published+ in GRPS, *with no error alert.*

This album has three tracks that were singles previously published

Today a leak was detected on Instagram .

One of the already released singles, "NO ME IMPORTA” (Track 3 in album), played “TU NOVIA II”(Track 5) one of the unreleased tracks.

After checking what happened, I noticed that despite the “Registration Successful” message, only the first six tracks appeared as registered, the remaining nine tracks didn’t.

But these tracks, except T1, were also messed up: T1 was OK, T2 contained audio from T4, {+}T3 from T5{+}, T4 from T7, T5 from T8 and  T6 from T10.

So the registration process assigned to the first six tracks the six ones that were correctly registered (T1,T4,T5,T7 & T8)

 

!vqdKgxEpCABCQgAQlIQAISkIAEJCABCRwlgf8HjYq1PVyUKyYAAAAASUVORK5CYII=|width=336,height=245,id=x_Imagen_x0020_4!

 

In the rush of our work I didn’t see this, I just acknowledged the successful registration.

But here’s another thing, Track 3 “NO ME IMPORTA” correctly shows duration 2:33 despite containing audio from “TU NOVIA II” that lasts 2:24.

The leak was produced when the scheduling for the album triggered the “new” audio of NO ME IMPORTA to Instagram.

After the leak was discovered, we took quite a while to figure out how it happened.

Fortunately the other two already published singles weren’t involved being track 7 and 11, out of the first six group.

Now apart that I should have seen the grayed-out tracks,I consider that the registration status should have stated “failed” and GRPS which is usually very strict with inconsistencies, should have denied the full publishing.;;;

column1: UST Immersive - TusD not working well for Full Master/Full Master Side
column30: Getting reports from multiple engineers that TusD doesn't really work for Full Master/Full Master Side. Main issue is that files are failing or the registration is hanging up. Seems to be a speed issue. Came up during an audio meeting. Will update with attempts and PN's.

column1: TusD upload issues
column30:
Sophie has been reporting issues with TusD so she has recorded her latest upload.

 

_"Ok apologies for the delay. I started several recordings but kept on calling away from my desk, ending up in hours long recording with nothing happening 😊_

_Recording is here: [https://we.tl/t-O3aDAQLlrn|https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwe.tl%2Ft-O3aDAQLlrn&data=05%7C02%7Ctim.alcock%40sonymusic.com%7C5c01d25c48b445e4391e08dd7db8004f%7Cf0aff3b791a54aaeaf71c63e1dda2049%7C0%7C0%7C638804951479446260%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=V9UkXjffHu%2Ba123%2BY%2BAkUXJrtdW%2BMm5P1fllZPkODqk%3D&reserved=0]_

 

_So, to explain what you see in the recording is me, uploading a master of  47 tracks, via TusD for this product G010005512615C_

 

_I see the upload, and the asset sorting. Which is new actually._

_Past few days, I only see the upload and then nothing – no process update._

_This time I also see a failed message. I’ve attached it in this message. It only uploaded 40 items, while the master map contains 47 tracks._

 

_This recording is not how I;ve experienced the past uploads past days. If I upload via TusD, I upload and than nothing. No update, No AOMA Asset Status email… So this more info then I’ve got before._

 

_Next step, when I try to upload a new master, I receive an error that there’s already a masterupload in process and that I need to wait until this is finished. Perhaps this is normal, but I need to unlink the job ID, before I can upload again._

 

_When I proceed with Aspera. I receive a successful registration within minutes after uploading._

 

_Let me try to recreate my experience with tusD I had the last few days with other uploads, where I get no information regarding the upload I just did._

_Hope this helps a bit, or let me know if you need something else._

 

_Best_

_Sophie"_
column445:
18/Apr/25 9:17 PM;kmccar1;I see a good list of stalled jobs from the last month from vandi03. Sophie's issues seem to be very similar to what I just described in linked ticket DPSA-30851 last night.
 * higher track count (over 20)
- stalling during " Uploading Asset to AMP S3" / Asset Upload In Progress registration phase
- job does not time out (e.g., when the user-side upload doesn't complete after 6 hours, the job will fail)
 * - job does not progress on the UST interface
 * - Aspera-upload completes registration quickly without issue

There are some fixes going in tomorrow per Mohammed earlier today. Hoping these will start to alleviate some of these issues. 

Thanks,

Keith;;;

column449:
29/Apr/25 11:10 PM;kmccar1;Thanks, Kiran. 

Two things on this one, team:
 # AOMA log out during uploads - I've personally rarely been forced logged out throughout the course of the day, and not during UST uploads. I know we sometimes have the rare system restart, but what else would force log out a user during an upload. Is there a time limit?
 # 15GB file - I've noticed that it can take the ui / TusD longer to respond when the video file is bigger. Is it possible that the restart upload button had been activated, but there was a delay in response? 

Thanks,

Keith;;;

column1: Cannot hotswap a master partially registered via UST
column30:
If we register a partial master via UST (e.g. on a mixed sample rate product), and the product is then published, we cannot hotswap the master via Aoma 2 product linking interface with a new master id. This looks to be because the partially registered master completed via UST shows in the system as a "Full Master" association, and Aoma 2 product linking will not allow a Full Master association to a product that does not contain the full track count. The only option is then to asset swap via UST which overwrites the original master, which as discussed last week is not a desirable method of swapping a master with a revised version.

Example is product G010005235364W which has 10 of 11 tracks registered @ 24 48kHz. I was unable to use Aoma 2 product linking to hotswap the 48kHz masters on this product.

Using master modify to view the master ID (24906491) for the 48kHz association shows only a 10 track master. The hotswap attempt via Aoma 2 product linking was like for like 10 track master to 10 track master (11 track product).

For the time being I have used UST to asset swap the tracks on that 48kHz master to be able to complete the job for Vietnam as close to their work hours as possible.

column1: Mobile Product Security Group Issue
column30:
On 12/8/2021 11:06 AM, Tobiason, Dan, Sony Music wrote:
> An issue we are running in to with mobile tones:
>
> Autolinks are generated, however when you search for the product in mobile audio manager, it shows up but is unavailable to be edited. If you go to product linking, break the link and re link, it will then be editable in the mobile audio manager.

Example Products: 
G010004713226U
G0100047132205
G010004713228Q
G0100047132221
G0100047132301
G010004713224Y

Auto-linked from G010004713232Y. Parent product linked:
Virtual Track - DDP/WAV 16 Bit/Video	000021445971 - Virtual Master (Track DDP/WAV 16Bit/Video)	dludl01	11/24/2021 4:58 AM

Mobile audio assets appear to have been auto-linked *without *security group affliation. Parent product virtual master appears to be associated with South Africa security group, but possibly updated after the mobile product metadata imports and subsequent auto-links. 

As a result. the [~TOBI017] and the GMP team are unable to select these products via the Mobile Audio Manager (not-selectable.png). There doesn't appear to be any sort of notification pointing to the cause. After updating the virtual master linked to G0100047132301 and G010004713224Y with South Africa, both were available for selection via the Mobile Audio Manager (screenshot-1). 

The best solution may be to not allow virtual master links to go thru without security group affliation in the first place. That way, any subsequent linking to mobile products will have the proper security group affliation and editable.

Our workaround is to re-register the asset and do a full master association. Please advise when the linking issue may be resolved.

 

Thanks

Digital Video Track Products Registered to AOMA

 * Frame Rate

19/Aug/25 8:53 PM;spag001;Hi [~mcatande],

The value for video_average_data_rate that is returned by conversion should be bits/sec. That value for legacy registrations is directly being stored in the database column. In UST however we are converting it to kbps (diving by 1000). Not sure the reason behind this I assume it was part of an old AC. 

So long story short if the asset was registered legacy its bits/sec, if its UST then its kbps.

Thanks

column450:
19/Aug/25 9:16 PM;spag001;Hi [~mcatande],

That's something that can be added to the report, otherwise there isn't a easy way to determine that based off the current report. [~poth003] can we add if it was a UST registration or not to the report?

Also one additional update I would like to make, legacy might also be in kbps (though a little unclear). So the legacy registered SFV is going through CT to 2063 to create the descriptor file. In that logic we are using a field called {color:#000000}*Video Average Data Rate* {color}to set this value. In UST workflows we are using CT 4101 for the descriptor generation. For this workflow we are using *SME_Video_Bitrate* for this value. I am noticing the values are a little off though from each other so this might be worth a discussion on the video sync up call. (I assume the newer CT is just more accurate)

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column451: 19/Aug/25 9:27 PM;poth003;[~mcatande], I will work on regenerating the report that will include a new column "Registration Type" to indicate if it was a UST or a legacy registration.;;;
column452: 19/Aug/25 9:38 PM;mcatande;Thanks both! ;;;
column453:
19/Aug/25 11:04 PM;poth003;Hi [~mcatande],

I have attached an updated report that has the column "Registration Type" which indicates if the registration is a UST one or Legacy. Please check the report and let me know if you have any questions.

CC:[~spag001] 

Thanks,

Phani;;;

column1: TUSD restore uploads/pausing
column30:
Hey,

Not sure if this is covered in another DPSA but I've been cault out by TUSD uploads pausing. I needed to go into Notifications and click restore uploads. I didn't get auto logged out during that time either or close the tab.

Is this behaviour being worked on to be continuous like Aspera, really even if we are logged out or close the tab I think TUSD should be configured to have continuous uploads without intervention

Thanks, TIm.
column445:
18/Oct/24 6:54 PM;kmccar1;Hi team,

Could you please check this one out? Seems like the job may be stalled as a result of what Tim is describing.

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column446:
18/Oct/24 7:29 PM;spag001;Hi all,

Depending on the browser there are some limitations to continuation. Chrome you can close the tab while I believe firefox you cant. We are working on improving TUS to see what we can do about this.

The job itself has moved to creation so should be wrapping up shortly.


|[25999454|https://aoma.smcdp-de.net/master/25999454]info|[G0100048961756|https://aoma.smcdp-de.net/product/G0100048961756?masterId=25999454]info|[edit|https://aoma.smcdp-de.net/unified-submission-tool?type=Product&pnumber=G0100048961756]|2550063info|Music Video| |Asset Creation in Progressinfo|mart036info|United Kingdom|10/18/2024 10:34:17|-|

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column447:
18/Oct/24 7:38 PM;kmccar1;TUSDnderstood, thanks for the info Matt.


Keith McCarthy
==================
Sony Music AOMA Support Lead
aoma.support@sonymusic.com<mailto:aoma.support@sonymusic.com>

column30:

Could you please provide a report of all productized registrations for wav 16b and 24b for past 3 months. The report should include track/asset level information. 

Product Number

Artist 

Title

Release Date

Parent Rep Owner

Rep Owner

Maintenance Owner

Publish Status

Side Seq

Track Seq

Track Title

ISRC

Master Type

Master ID

AMP Asset Key

Could you please share this by tomorrow.

column465:
12/Sep/24 8:29 PM;zeki001;Please be aware that unfortunately wrong status is displayed now in the UI, and please do not re-submit priority import for this product (that will stop the current process, and run a new one).  

The import process for this product is in progress (it's not waiting to be imported as UI indicates). 

The AOMA part took around 60 minutes, and now it's processing in MI. 

The commit for both databases will happen once MI ingestion is done. 

In general, MI ingestion took a few more times than AOMA. 

Also, I have stopped low-priority processing to reduce resource usage. ;;;
column466: 12/Sep/24 9:33 PM;vleung1;Hi [~coconne] , the metadata import for this product is being processed right now.  The expected processing time from MI/EOM will take ~6 hours.  We have reached out to [~nanj001]  and [~amallip] to monitor and provide updates. [~ZEKI001] and I will be monitoring this as well.;;;
column468:
12/Sep/24 10:17 PM;coconne;While we are waiting on this...can i please ask to understand this process a little better?    Should we expect this same issue any time this product has a change?   

For example, when the label Full Publishes the product? (It's currently open published) would that update require this same effort?

What about if data on one track on the product changes?  Would we expect this same process?

 

I'm just thinking for a product this large, we could expect metadata changes over time.

 

Also, this product coming through and being so large, this shouldn't delay information coming from GRPS to EOM on other products (right?)  Like this product isn't taking up all lanes on the highway....right?;;;
column471:
13/Sep/24 9:22 AM;zeki001;The import process for this product has been completed successfully. 

!image-2024-09-13-09-22-04-276.png!;;;
column472:
13/Sep/24 4:14 PM;leid003;Thanks All!! 

 

I was able to publish this in GRPS now! Just waiting for the new import prompted by the publish;;;
column473: 13/Sep/24 4:59 PM;coconne;Similar question to yesterday...When Legacy adds Partners to their DSP scope, would we also expect that update to take a day and require hand-holding?  just want to get ahead of how to time these updates...;;;
column474:
13/Sep/24 6:24 PM;vleung1;Yes, if I understand the question correctly and [~cmiller] please correct me if I'm wrong, this would mean there could be changes where Partners can have asset title override or adding participant-partner relationships.  In that case, it will trigger another metadata import and take another day.  

As discussed with Craig and [~nanj001], we will look into the long processing time for these large products and try to make improvements.;;;
column475:
13/Sep/24 7:42 PM;cmiller;If there's partner title overrides on any of the tracks, then scheduling additional partners could indeed require the product to be ingested into MI again as Vivien indicates. But if NO such partner title overrides exist, then a scheduling change should NOT require an update via the Metadata Import process because scheduling data travels via a different interface.
;;;

column1: MBC Export - 1 of 8 conversions did not go through
column30:
I submitted a request via media batch converter for the following 8 tracks including ISRC and Product #: 
|G010003602297I|AUAY21200520|
|G010001600916L|USSM10027844|
|G010003031718G|USSM11304764|
|G010001308751P|USSM13700023|
|G010003107902Q|USSM10402389|
|G0100006691032|USSM13700008|
|G0100007040840|USSM10104176|
|G010002766165W|USSM19905342|

Batch ID 2363 

MBC found all assets, Batch was submitted successfully, but one product dropped out. 
 # Why did it drop out?
 # How can we enhance MBC to message or communicate when something like this drops out.  With a request of 8 tracks it's very easy to tell when something drops out, but with larger batches it adds considerable effort to pinpoint any dropouts.
column444:
19/Aug/25 7:06 PM;kmccar1;HI team,

The audio master here was registered in 2016 without security group affiliation. In this case, MBC picks it up, makes it look like it was submitted, but it does not actually do so. Could you please take a look? (I updated with Australia and Legacy in the meantime, to confirm). 

!image-2025-08-19-13-04-59-414.png!
|G010003602297I|AUAY21200520|

!image-2025-08-19-12-59-56-320.png!

 

 

 

Thanks, 

Keith;;;
column445:
19/Aug/25 8:24 PM;kuma011;Hi [~kmccar1],

Looking into this.

Regards,
Kiran.;;;
column446:
19/Aug/25 8:50 PM;kuma011;Hi [~mcatande],

Confirmation & Root Cause:

Keith's assessment is correct — the issue occurred because the product G010003602297I did not have a security group assigned. Without a security group, the user lacked the necessary permissions to export the track associated with this product, which caused the export to fail.

Error Details:
{
"message": "User does not have required permission to perform the action.",
"catalogKey": "G010003602297I",
"status": "FAILED",
"reason": "Export cannot handle product G010003602297I request"
}

This error information is currently not visible in the UI, as it is only stored in the backend. However, we are working on the Batch Details page for the September build, which will display all relevant batch-related data — including export errors — directly in the UI to improve visibility and debugging.

Resolution:
The missing security group has already been updated by Keith. The product G010003602297I should now be good to export.


Regards,
Kiran.;;;
column447:
19/Aug/25 8:52 PM;kmccar1;Great info, thanks again for this Kiran.

Keith;;;
column448: 08/Sep/25 6:16 PM;hale002;[~wang042]  & [~kuma011]  can you please link the work ticket to this DPSA. ;;;
column449:
08/Sep/25 6:23 PM;kuma011;Hi [~hale002],

Linking the user story here https://jira.smedigitalapps.com/jira/browse/UST-2619

Regards,
Kiran.;;;
column450:
02/Oct/25 8:19 PM;wang042;Hi [~mcatande] , with Sep release, we now have the Media Batch Converter Job Status page to view MBC export status. Can we close this DPSA ticket?

!image-2025-10-02-14-18-55-444.png|width=403,height=191!;;;

column1: MBC ISRC search issues
column30:
When using ISRC search via MBC there are a few issues: 
 # When searching there is an error "Undefined" We do not know what this is. using attached sheet select ISRCs and replicate the error to discover root cause for a fix.
 # When searching there is no search modal/load indicator for a user to know the system is still thinking. 
 # The undefined error shows in an orange box which appears but then disappears after some seconds. If a user isn't actively looking at the screen they can miss it and think the search is still in progress because there is no load indicator. 
 # When Product search was first used and was switched to ISRC search the bottom section does not appear to refresh to remove any results from the product search.

column448:
29/Apr/25 11:06 PM;mcatande;Yeah that is a known issue that we didn't find out until later in the request.  Colleen compiled the list and didn't check that the associated products she pulled were published.  In any subsequent requests she sends, she will be only including associated products which are published to guarantee assets are present.

column1: G010005377572E - Asset Swap Issue (SME Italy)
column30:
*From:* Catandella, Michael, Sony Music <michael.catandella@sonymusic.com>
*Sent:* Friday, November 22, 2024 11:24
*To:* Colasuono, Roberto, Sony Music Italy <roberto.colasuono@sonymusic.com>; Jones, Tobin, Sony Music <tobin.jones@sonymusic.com>; Burgess, Fiona , Asbury Media <fiona.burgess.asburymedia@sonymusic.com>; UK Media Production <UKmediaproduction@sonymusic.com>; Sony Music - US, Media Production <GDL20007685@sonymusic.com>; Sony Music-US, AOMA Support <aoma.support@sonymusic.com>
*Cc:* Bucci, Carla, Sony Music Italy <carla.bucci@sonymusic.com>; McCarthy, Keith, Asbury Media <keith.mccarthy.asburymedia@sonymusic.com>
*Subject:* Re: master replacement - album
 
Very weird.  I've attached a zip of all the AOMA notifications I received from today.  There are two asset sorting failures which would cancel the job as a registration failure. I also see multiple asset sorting success notifications and two registration success notifications.  Oddly enough the registration success notifications appear to be under Roberto's user name? 

+[@Colasuono, Roberto, Sony Music Italy|mailto:roberto.colasuono@sonymusic.com]+ - As a note there are additional steps in the registration process now when using Full Master or Full Master Side upload.  There is an additional step called "Asset Sorting" which is an added step after upload for AOMA to sort the files so that they land in the correct track/sequence when registered.  Asset sorting has its own notification, and once this is successful the registration process begins and you should receive a second notification for successful registration. 

 

+[@Sony Music-US, AOMA Support|mailto:aoma.support@sonymusic.com]+ - Can you look at these notifications and find out what happened here? 
 # Were Roberto's submissions actually successful? 
 # I received sorting notifications for Tobin but no registration notifications.  Why would that be

 

*Michael Catandella* | Senior Director, Media Production Operations | office (() 212.833.4897 | cell (() 917.816.5010 | (:) +[michael.catandella@sonymusic.com|mailto:michael.catandella@sonymusic.com]+

Sony Music Entertainment | 25 Madison Avenue | New York, NY  10010 | +[http://www.sonymusic.com/|https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.sonymusic.com%2F&data=05%7C02%7Ckeith.mccarthy.asburymedia%40sonymusic.com%7Cac3ed63014d94bef0d5408dd0b123403%7Cf0aff3b791a54aaeaf71c63e1dda2049%7C0%7C0%7C638678897817853099%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=YX32lGqytl8VoHZHn9TwWKO149ZS0qrMBdpQ7smrJT0%3D&reserved=0]+

 
*From:* Colasuono, Roberto, Sony Music Italy <roberto.colasuono@sonymusic.com>
*Date:* Friday, November 22, 2024 at 10:56 AM
*To:* Jones, Tobin, Sony Music <tobin.jones@sonymusic.com>, Burgess, Fiona , Asbury Media <fiona.burgess.asburymedia@sonymusic.com>, UK Media Production <UKmediaproduction@sonymusic.com>, Sony Music - US, Media Production <GDL20007685@sonymusic.com>

The files uploaded via Aspera (see attached email) but they did not change in AOMA

Thanks!

Roberto

*Inviato:* venerdì 22 novembre 2024 16:55
*A:* Colasuono, Roberto, Sony Music Italy {+}[roberto.colasuono@sonymusic.com|mailto:roberto.colasuono@sonymusic.com]{+}; Burgess, Fiona , Asbury Media {+}[fiona.burgess.asburymedia@sonymusic.com|mailto:fiona.burgess.asburymedia@sonymusic.com]{+}; UK Media Production <UKmediaproduction@sonymusic.com>; Sony Music - US, Media Production <GDL20007685@sonymusic.com>

Thanks

Tobin

Hi Roberto,

You should be able to handle via the UST Asset Swap.Open up the master you'd like to update in UST, and either replace the track(s) one at at ime via the "Asset Swap" button inline with each track, or compile a "Full Master." Clicking that button will display the message below, "Would you like to swap the registered assets?" If you choose Full Master, please ensure that the file-names in the folder are set correctly.

*UST, Full Master track naming convention*

column445:
22/Nov/24 9:24 PM;spag001;Hi all,

Will check this out.

column446:
22/Nov/24 10:17 PM;spag001;Hi [~mcatande],

The notification received was the correct one, it's just the user name was the problem. For the wav 16 full master info notification we normally set the user to who is listed as the registration job. For swaps (for whatever reason in the past) it set up to not update the registrationJobUser. (Also to note for swaps we will re-use the existing registrationJob as its not being cleared just updated.)

This can easily be updated if it leads to more confusion. We can then change the logic to always take the user who registered the last item to the product and update the registrationJob accordingly.

Let me know if you have any questions or if I missed something else in this thread.

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column447: 22/Nov/24 10:50 PM;mcatande;Thanks [~SPAG001] - I think we should change the logic.  The actual users (last updated user) should be in the messaging.;;;

column449:
11/Sep/24 9:17 PM;spag001;Hi all,

It looks to have been a weird intermediate issue but let me check with the teams. Lowering priority since the resubmit went through.

Hi mc team,

The failure for this job we received from amp was due to "Asset input data has been changed after processing started". When we checked with amp team on this failure it was mentioned that this error reported if S3 object's LastModified value is changed after asset processing has started, which means any modification may have happen to the input data. Could you check if any modification to the file/metadata occurred after the conversion was marked as successful?

Request Info
Env - Del 
CT - 2067
RequestId - 219630995

Thanks

Matthew;;;

column1: Vinyl product with audio master not displaying audio master in Release Runway
column30:
the usage message support was initial set up for select digital master types.

Vinyls are physical so they are not part of that list, we don't have a usage mapping set for it so there is no valid message (message is sent but the usage type would be null). 

we need to send these messages now for vinyls (and for any other missing master types):
||Master Type||Usage Type||
|Audio Master WAV 24 Bit Vinyl|16|

column1: UST Registration of Wav validation error issue
column30:
We just had a wav file fail registration via UST. The validation error message was incorrect and confusing for the user. The message thrown was the file is not PCM or RRF64 Please confirm file is PCM or RF64. 

The file is a PCM wav, but the codec ID isn't one. That is what failed it. It is confusing to a user because they can view the file in Media Info and see it is PCM. 

The message for this should be:

 
The codec ID of this asset does not meet compliance, it will be automatically processed by the system to correct this issue.
Compliance guidelines can be found here: [https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/audio/audio-submission-guidelines/]"
 
 File in question is attached.

column1: exports failed
column30:
Hey There, each of my exports failed, please could you tell me what I need to do fierently to prevent getting the same error again?

Batch ID was: 2091

Error:

400 : "Export order for jobId:70829 does not contain conversion for master or products or tracks." 

These are the options I picked:
!image-2025-07-07-18-15-50-341.png!
column244:
AOMA Support
Hours: Monday-Friday, 3:30 am-8:00 pm EST
Emergency After-Hours Support: Send an email to aoma.support@sonymusic.com with the JIRA ticket number and a brief description.
column444:
07/Jul/25 8:56 PM;kuma011;Hi [~mart036],

Looking into this.

Regards,
Kiran;;;
column445:
07/Jul/25 9:15 PM;kuma011;Hi [~mart036],

CT 4202 requires the full video to be selected, as it is intended solely for source (full) video. The clips 'Preview' and 'Program Only' require at least one CT ID other than 4202. Since CT 4202(Copy Conversion) functions only with the full video, it cannot be used to export the 'Preview' or 'Program Only' clips.

To resolve this, you can either export the full video using CT 4202, or use a different CT ID (other than 4202) to export the 'Preview' or 'Program Only' clips.

Regards,
Kiran.;;;
column446: 08/Jul/25 11:16 AM;mart036;great, thanks for explaining - makes perfect sense, will keep this in. mind going forward;;;
column448:
08/Jul/25 3:32 PM;mart036;Trying again with a conversion this time in the hope it will be faster.

Batch process initiated with Id: 2107!;;;
column450: 08/Jul/25 3:43 PM;mart036;giving it a conversinon to do trather then just asking it to export the source masters has been faster with everything now in progress;;;
column451:
08/Jul/25 3:55 PM;kuma011;Hi [~mart036],

Batch job 2107 is in progress, and some of the exports have been completed. The delay is due to another batch job, which is also in progress and contains a larger number of products. Both jobs are set to Low priority.

Regards,
Kiran.;;;

08/Jul/25 5:34 PM;kuma011;Hi [~mart036],

Regards,
Kiran.;;;

Regards,
Kiran.;;;

column1: AOMA STAGE testing - CT12196 via Media Batch Converter
column30: testing CT12196 via MBC using Sony Ci
column444:
10/May/24 12:10 AM;woom001;Jobs submitted to MBC via Sony Ci generate a batch ID number upon submission, but do not show up in the export status,

Batch IDs 470, 472, 474, etc

 !JOB_474.JPG|thumbnail! 

 !exportStatus_missingBatchIDs.JPG|thumbnail! 

submitted CT4100 to test, Batch ID 475 which is converting. CT12196 isn't providing updates;;;
column445:
10/May/24 12:25 AM;woom001;MBC UI does not have "cancel" "unlock", "clear" buttons, unlike MFC:

 !MFC_Clear.JPG|thumbnail! 

when a job is submitted, the UI goes grey, and the page is "dead":

 !MBC_Submitted_JOB_noUpdate.JPG|thumbnail! 

there's no button to clear it, or unlock/reset. however if i click on any of the available icons in MBC i can reset the UI:

 !MBC_UI.jpg|thumbnail! 

"select destinations" remembers the last CT submitted, and the name of the last Batch. sometimes a "ghost" CT will be populated instead of the last CT used (when clicking on "select destinations" as the window pops up, i can see very briefly the name of the CT before it switch to a blank CT):

 !MBC_Ghost_CT.JPG|thumbnail! 

in this example there are two "ghost" CT. i can add CT12196 from the left column. I can send the two "ghost" CTs back to the left column:

 !MBC_Ghost_CT2.JPG|thumbnail! 

submitting a job with a ghost CT present will cause the submission to fail:

 !mbc_batch_offer_fail.jpg|thumbnail! 

I can cause this ghost behavior fairly consistently by clicking one of the other active buttons on the MBC UI to "wake" the page after a submission, but i've also seen the Ghost CT when leaving the page for another page, and returning to the MBC UI and starting fresh.;;;
column446:
10/May/24 12:28 AM;kmccar1;HI [~HALE002],

Could you please check this out?

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column447:
10/May/24 12:30 AM;woom001;clicking on the Job ID on the export status page for a MBC submission that was from a file and no a product number returns an error message, for both "Failed" and "confirmed" jobs:

 !Export_Fail_Error_noProdNo.JPG|thumbnail! ;;;
column448: 10/May/24 12:31 AM;woom001;"failed" MBC job 1773 did not produce an email notification of the fail, i'm recieving "confirmed" emails though.;;;
column450:
10/May/24 12:40 AM;woom001;MBC CT list is not sorted by CT number, or alphabetically, etc.

 !MBC_CT_list.jpg|thumbnail! 

compared to how MFC Ct list is sorted:

 !MFC_CT_list.jpg|thumbnail! ;;;

 !MFC_FrameRate.jpg|thumbnail! ;;;

column1: Product Search in Commercial AOMA not working
column30: Searches by artist in Commercial AOMA are pulling up proxy errors. No search results are available.  This has been ongoing for days, experienced by multiple users on both Mac and PC.
column244:
AOMA Support
Hours: Monday-Friday, 3:30 am-8:00 pm EST
Emergency After-Hours Support: Send an email to aoma.support@sonymusic.com with the JIRA ticket number and a brief description.
column345: Critical need to research and delivery products.
column444:
17/Aug/23 9:03 PM;spag001;Hi [~rlizard],



Could you please provide some example artists you are trying to search by that you are facing the proxy issue for. Also have you been using exact search for this?

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column445:
22/Aug/23 7:17 PM;rlizard;The issue has occurred across multiple catalogs.  Any artist search should display the issue.  

The search has been sorted both by artist and more specifically specific product types by that artist.;;;
column446:
22/Aug/23 7:27 PM;spag001;Hi [~rlizard],

Its easier for us to narrow down the exact issue here with some example artists string search terms you have been using. There are a couple different factors that play into search which we need to replicate in order to make sure we know the exact issue. 

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column447: 22/Aug/23 9:37 PM;rlizard;!Screenshot 2023-08-22 at 3.36.16 PM.png!;;;
column448:
23/Aug/23 7:58 PM;spag001;Thanks [~rlizard] for the information!

We are actively working on some enhancements for the search functionality in order to improve upon this issues. We will update the linked tickets here for those fixes.

In the meanwhile through using the exact search option for some of these cases should help with results showing up. (See below example) Alternatively AMP Search/Search 2.0 are good alternatives.
!image-2023-08-23-13-57-23-035.png!;;;

column1: UST "file select" pop-up comes up twice for Atmos registrations
column30:
For Atmos registrations, when selecting a master in UST the file select pop-up (Local / Import from Sony Ci) comes up twice for Atmos registrations. Once the file has been selected the pop up remains, but the background gets a shade lighter.

Screenshots attached. 

Please remove the duplicate pop-up.

Thanks,
Jamie

I tried recreating in stage and prod with G010001424503U but could only get one pop-up. Could you please take a look when you have a chance? 

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column445:

We are looking into this.

Thanks

Matthew;;;

column445:

Hari;;;
column446:

Thanks,

Keith;;;

column1: VSC / VIC Approval Inconsistencies between Digital Video Compilation product and linked Shortform Video Products
column30:
Team,

The five videos that are linked to Digital Video Compilation product G010004249879B (noted below) all have approved VSC masters, per their invidual Product Status UIs.

G010004249882L 
G010004249880P 
G010004249884H 
G010004249885F 
G010004249886D (screenshot-1 for example) 

When naviagating to the Product Status UI for G010004249879B, instead of approved, "Proceed" Video Screen Capture statuses, all of the associated masters are noted with "Unknown" Video Image Capture statuses (screenshot-2). 

This appears to be blocking publish via GRPS (error message noted in screenshot-3). 

Could you please check into this?

Let us know if you need any further information.

Keith

column1: MBC batch export issue when one product has an unapproved master (QC notes entered but not locked): Batch export fails, does not show up in A3 Export UI, empty Sony Ci folder created
column30:
SME India reached out regarding a MBC export to Ci in PROD that did not make it into Ci. The folder is created in Ci but the batch ID 1146 does not even show up in the A3 export UI. I see batch ID's 1145 and 1147 but no trace of 1146:
 !image-2025-01-31-10-54-40-796.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2025-01-31-10-55-06-769.png|thumbnail! 
 
G010002856686J,
G0100049121316,
G010002805327P,
G010001036400E,
G0100032476560,
G010004265653E


=====================================================

Issue was caused by G0100032476560 having QC notes entered but locked, subsequently audio master not approved which prevented the export since user did not have the required EXPORT_UNAPPROVED_MASTER permission

=====================================================

Can we make MBC system smart enough to display a message accordingly for product that has unapproved master due to QC notes entered/locked?

=====================================================

column1: AOMA2 Master Only Export - Track Sequence numbers are the same
column30:
Hello!

We have had an issue for sometime now, where when exporting audio from a Master ID, upon export, the audio loses the track order, and all tracks are renumbered as the total track count. So if there are 16 tracks, all tracks are numbered as track 16.

This causes further issues with tracks that have the same title but with different supplemental info, ie: a main version and an acoustic version. If you try to export these tracks at the same time, you will only get one of them.

 

Here is a Master ID: 26326554 to check out the issue.

15/Jan/25 4:40 PM;kmccar1;Hey [~TOBI017],

Thanks,

Keith;;;

column1: A3 MBC - ISRC lookup / "Showing __ out of __ products"
column30:
*From:* Vaughan, Kenny, Sony Music <kenny.vaughan@sonymusic.com>
*Sent:* Tuesday, November 5, 2024 10:52
*To:* Sony Music-US, AOMA Support <aoma.support@sonymusic.com>
*Subject:* Media Batch Converter - trial issue

I have recently used the A3 Media Batch Converter option to try and get hold of the below 22 tracks:
 
|+No+|+Label+|+Artist+|+Track+|+ISRC+|+JL Timing+|
| ++ |*+SME:+*| ++ | ++ | ++ | ++ |
|1|SME|1910 Fruitgum Co|Simon Says|USBR16800005|2.14|

|3|SME|Andy Williams|Can't Get Used To Losing You|USSM16201353|2.22|
|4|SME|Bob Dylan|Subterranean Homesick Blues|USSM16500147|2.18|
|5|SME|Bobby Vinton|Roses Are Red|USSM16201323|2.38|
|6|SME|Dave Brubeck Quartet|Take Five|USSM15900108|5.24|
|7|SME|Doris Day|Move Over Darling|USSM16300426|2.34|
|8|SME|Elvis Presley|Return To Sender|USRC16201769|2.08|
|9|SME|Johnny Nash|Hold Me Tight|GBBBN7400008|2.44|
|10|SME|Maurice Williams & The Zodiacs|Stay|USAR10300951|1.35|
|11|SME|Neil Sedaka|Breaking Up Is Hard To Do|USRC19901068|2.17|
|12|SME|Nina Simone|To Love Somebody|USRC19305665|2.38|
|13|SME|Ohio Express|Yummy Yummy Yummy|USBR10300054|2.20|
|14|SME|Roy Orbison|Dream Baby (How Long Must I Dream)|USSM16201067|2.33|
|15|SME|Scott McKenzie|San Francisco|USSM16701024|2.59|
|16|SME|Simon & Garfunkel|The Boxer|USSM16801464|5.08|
|17|SME|The Box Tops|The Letter|USAR17200009|1.53|
|18|SME|The Byrds|Mr Tambourine Man|USSM16501030|2.20|
|19|SME|The Crystals|Then He Kissed Me|USQX91100118|2.39|
|20|SME|The Love Affair|Everlasting Love|GBBBN6700001|3.00|
|21|SME|The Lovin' Spoonful|Summer In The City|USBR10300026|2.39|
|22|SME|The Ronettes|Be My Baby|USQX91100088|2.40|

When I used the Media Batch Converter for two different trials (Export as WAV + and another at WAV 16bit) I was able to access 18 of the above 22 files.

!image-2024-11-05-14-56-55-082.png!

However when I went back to A2 Batch Offering, I was able to access all 22.

!image-2024-11-05-14-57-15-488.png!

May I ask what could be the issue?

 
*From:* McCarthy, Keith, Asbury Media <keith.mccarthy.asburymedia@sonymusic.com>
*Sent:* Tuesday, November 5, 2024 14:50
*To:* Vaughan, Kenny, Sony Music <kenny.vaughan@sonymusic.com>; Sony Music-US, AOMA Support <aoma.support@sonymusic.com>
*Subject:* Re: Media Batch Converter - trial issue
 
All 22 tracks were present in my MBC export to Ci. Looks like the system is grabbing some tracks off of the same 60's compilation products, so only 18 products are being used for the 22 tracks. This is being incorrectly reflected in the UI - will get a ticket together to have it fixed. 
  !image-2024-11-05-14-58-01-852.png!

!image-2024-11-05-14-58-58-375.png!
column444:
05/Nov/24 9:02 PM;kmccar1;Hey [~HALE002],

Could you please review? Looks like the product count data is incorrect in this scenario. It should say something more like, "Displaying 22 of 22 tracks" when we're submitting just ISRCs. Or "Displaying 22 tracks from 18 products," something like that. The current wording gives the incorrect notion that tracks are missing from the group. 

Thanks,

Keith;;;

column1: Hardings fixing now slower than before due to MFC and Sony Ci
column30:
It was brought to my attention in this morning’s UK video meeting that multiple steps required to complete a Hardings fix task are taking significantly longer using MFC and Sony Ci in comparison to our previous AOMA 2 workflow:
 # The first Hardings test AOMA submission takes 10-15 minutes before being visible at AOMA 3 Export Status using CT4100 with Media Batch Converter via Sony CI.
 # Then it takes 10-15 minute to retrieve the first Hardings test certificate which also takes time to find in the Sony Ci ‘Media Production Operations - AOMA Exports’ dropbox so that’s 30 minutes just to get our first certificate, this use to be the time it took to upload the video plus the processing time which matched the playback time of the video file being scanned before a certificate would almost instantly appear in our ‘My AOMA Files’ location.
 # For every new Hardings test it can take between 20-30 minutes for a new certificate to arrive even if the video file submitted is a only few seconds long.

Apparently the result of this is that Hardings fixes are usually taking approximately double the time but I’m pretty sure if there are tricky fixes to do it would be significantly more time based on the information Elliot has provided above.

Is there a way we can improve these timings so there isn't a risk of missing broadcast deadlines?
column445:
21/Oct/24 9:10 PM;kuma011;Hi [~WHIT056],

I have seen there was 2 batch exports from Elliot on 18th Oct, with batch id's 822 and 823. In that 822 started appearing in the A3 export status page immediately since it is productized export. But I can see there was a 10 min delay to appear 823 in the export status page, but the delay is the time it took to upload the file from Sony CI to S3.


The video file used for the 823-batch export is 5.5Gb+ and it took around 10 mins to transfer the file to S3(Which includes Metadata extraction, MD5 creation, transfer time, validation etc..). It started appearing immediately in export status page once after the transfer completed from AMP.

Details on the time taken:
Transfer from SonyCI time: 9 minutes
MD5 Calc: 1:20
Content Copy: 0:04
Total Processing time: 1:40
Total Ingestion time: 10:30  

Regards,
Kiran.;;;

column1: Slow Harding Test results (CT 4100) using the Media Batch converter (MBC) in AOMA
column30:
Hi Team, 

The conversion times for Harding testing (CT 4100) seem considerably longer using the Media Batch Converter (MBC) than the previous system using the Media File Converter (MFC). 

My 2 Harding tests today using the MBC took: 

1. 24mins
2. 17 mins

By contrast, the MFC test used today took 11 mins and previous MFC tests when the certificates were delivered to the Offerings folder in AOMA used to take 6-10mins. 

I have 3 queries about the MBC Harding Test system in an attempt to improve it: 

1. Is there a reason why the MBC takes twice as long as the previous MFC system? 

2. Is there anything that the MBC system can learn from the MFC system to help speed up the process? 

3. Is there any way that the MBC system can be optimised to take around 10 mins maximum for a Harding test? 

Many thanks in advance for investigating this. 

Cristen
column444:
06/Jun/24 1:12 AM;spag001;Hi [~KUMA011],

Can you check this out?

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column445: 03/Oct/24 10:33 PM;kuma011;Could you please address this? ;;;

column1: Video Master 338491 - Invalid search results
column30:
Hi team,

Searching for video master 338491 (Miranda Lambert, "Kerosene" SD version) returns invalid results in Legacy Search, Search 2.0, and AMP. Masters and products by an artist called "CPM22" are showing up in the results. Please see the attached screenshots. 

Thanks,

Keith
column444:
22/Oct/20 6:15 PM;spag001;Hi all,

Looking into this.

Thanks
Matthew;;;
column445:
22/Oct/20 9:35 PM;spag001;Hi all,

So I got some clarification on the AMP/Legacy search checking the jsonObject that AMP returns. I noticed that the master artist participant id that the artist CMP22 has in GRAS, also happens to be the value 338491. That is why those are also showing up here, but we can not change that value. Also this master is not tied to any product it should not show up in the product search. 

Thanks
 Matthew;;;
column446:
22/Oct/20 10:58 PM;kmccar1;Thanks [~SPAG001] - so it's less of a bug and more of an issue with the system returning results for the Participant Number. 

I searched 384591 (Miranda Lambert) with 2.0 and Master, and got pages of Miranda Lambert products. Theoretically, if 384591 was a video master ID registered in the system (it's not), it would be hidden among these pages of results. This would, in turn, cause some confusion for the user searching for a particular master ID via a Master search only to receive various unrelated returns. 

I'm not aware of users searching via GRAS Participant number in AOMA, but this may be worth further discussion. 

[~vcampan] please feel free to add anything that I may have missed.

Thanks everyone,

Keith;;;
column447: 23/Oct/20 12:58 AM;vcampan;No, I agree.  When a user puts in a Master ID and sets the search for "Master", there should only be one result.;;;
column448: 23/Oct/20 3:13 PM;kmccar1;Sounds about right to me...;;;

29/Apr/24 5:31 PM;mbrice1;[~HALE002]  [~HEDG001] no need to pull conversion request ID's. 

User confirmed that she uploaded in Sept 2020 possible via PC not MAC but definitely via local upload [Aspera]  

User confirmed that she re-uploaded the folder with amended file names removing the question marks "?" in filenames, previews generated without issues post-registration.

"The first time I tried to upload this it was in 2020 so I may have been using a PC at that time.  I know I should always delete the special characters so I’m not sure why I forgot to do it at that time.  And the question marks were already there  [in the filenames] when I uploaded."

 
 
The question marks in the filenames were the culprit specifically for not getting the previews generated.
 
The files went through registration but caused a problem for Media Conversion to get previews generated.
 
How can we improve the system to avoid this situation?
The registration of these files [with question marks in the filename] went through registration process without issue, the problem is communication with MC for preview generation.
 ;;;

column1: Digital Archive - "Generate Preview" button functionality ("You have selected one or more items that does not support playback previews.")
column30:
On 4/21/2023 10:55 AM, Catandella, Michael, Sony Music wrote:
> For some reason I am unable to generate a preview on an asset which appears to be .mov (should work). Can you please advise?  I am exporting it instead... but still need to know why it won't work.  This is the second time this has happened to me BTW. 

Archive Package Master Number: 13790618

 

!image-2023-04-21-11-17-44-121.png!
column445:
21/Apr/23 5:23 PM;kmccar1;Hi there team,

The Generate Preview button on the main Details UI is inactive when selecting the .MOV file, but the one that appears after clicking "Play" seems to be functioning as expected. ** Could you please take a look when you get a chance?  **  

Please let us know if you need any further information.

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column446:
24/Apr/23 5:08 PM;mbrice1;[~kmccar1] [~mcatande] 

Yes. The Generate Preview button on the main Details UI is inactive and/or displaying the message "You have selected one or more items that does not support playback previews. Please check your selections again." because the UI auto-selects the parent folder besides the video file selected. The parent folder is not valid for video preview playback selection. This is an old bug. We will review best plan of action to change this, [~HALE002] either by removing the Generate Preview button on the main Details UI bar display or by disabling auto-selection of parent of folder when one ore more files inside the folder are selected.

For now, the work around is to use the Generate Preview button right next to the video or audio file asset.

Thanks,

Manuela

 ;;;

column1: UST Running Extremely Slow with 9 Component 360RA Product
column30:
UST is moving extremely slowly when attempting to load Product G010004958778H, a 9 component, 102 track 360RA product. Tracks fail to load when attempting to access the interface, making it impossible to modify or add QC notes to those tracks. Page sometimes becomes completely unresponsive for up to a full minute.

Please let me know if you have any questions about this issue. Thanks!

-Ethan Fields

In the meanwhile, I would recommend using the product details page to modify the qcNotes tied to this 360 master.

Thanks

Matthew;;;

column1: Export to Promo failing when filename path is too long
column30:
There are multiple DPSAs related to Export to Promo failures (linked to this ticket).

Initially, we thought that these issues were related to Flip Action (XSC-404)

Now, we speculate that the errors are due to filepath lengths. 

As per Matt Woo's comment of DPSA-27545:
{quote}per WPTS-334181, we tried telestream's fix and were still getting the same "failed to start" error.

Seems to be a related issue with regards to the character length/characters in the file name of the source that fails these jobs. Original file name with 126 characters fails but the same file with a truncated filename of 59 characters passes.

MFC will not accept a filename with "&" in the name, so i was not able to directly test those Black Eyed Peas videos that failed (that have & in the filename) with their original filename, but a truncated version of the filename passes.

Re-tested in STAGE where the telestream changes have not been made and with the same results, original file name fails, truncated file name passes.
{quote}
On MC's side, Application limit to filename will be investigated via ACS-2818. 
[~SAMA030] please help us find the promo export file name structure from AOMA. Let's use this ticket instead of XSC-404.
column444:
02/Dec/22 4:55 PM;spag001;Hi all,

Output file is formed by from db data from the product in the following structure:



DjKhaledFeatSkillibengBujuBant_TheseStreetsKnowMyName_G010004884598O_ProgramOnly_44Mp42000.mp4

ArtistTiedToProduct_ProductTITLE_Catalogky_ClipMasterType_PromoType+PromotFormCd

Thanks

Matthew;;;

column30:
Hi team,

I've been noticing an error lately when trying to select the audio master that is linked to a physical product via the AOMA2 Product Linking UI. The icon is non-responsive, and the message in red below appears. 

Example product is 19658739842. 

!image-2022-10-20-10-18-13-142.png!

The workaround is to access via the Search results, or to click on the graphics master icon to get to the Export button. [~jcast01] experienced this issue last night while attempting to get the master out to the plants, so I just wanted to call attention to it now. 

Please let me know if you need any further information.

Thanks,

Keith

It should be pointing to AOMA2 details page, however after speaking with AOMA3 the support for adding this would be very simple now so that might be the better direction then fixing the icon link here.

Hi BA's,

Can you please review my comment and create the appropriate ticket here.

Matthew;;;

column1: AOMA Archive - Generate previews function is 'buggy'
column30:
When using the AOMA Archive and attempting to select files for the system to generate, there appear to be bugs. 

When in the archive details interface initially the "generate previews" button is grayed out.  one can select files and if the files are the correct type, the generate previews button will become active.  

!image-2022-06-06-15-50-58-208.png!

 

AOMA is detecting a "folder" or container as a "file type" and if any folders are selected the generate previews button is grayed out.  This behavior prevents a user from selecting all items in a folder to create previews. The Archive details interface selects the folder level is all files are selected within that folder making the generate previews button inactive. 

!image-2022-06-06-15-55-04-830.png!

!image-2022-06-06-15-55-19-907.png!

!image-2022-06-06-15-55-38-482.png!

Additionally, The lower panel should be a separate pane from the upper panel with separate scrolls so that a user can scroll the files list and see the top lower panel menu items while browsing a long list of files. for 'generate previews' to select a file from a long list of files, a user has to scroll to the file they want to generate previews for, select the file and then scroll all the way back up to the top to click 'generate previews'

Could you please take a look when you get a chance? 

Thanks,

Keith;;;

column444:
12/Aug/25 3:09 PM;gvamsik;Hi [~vdutta]  / [~spanick]  / [~psalvio] 

 
As we moved to Kafka ( event driven ) Architecture ,  its very less likely we will have an messaging issue for any new updates or registrations ..
We have enabled the option to re-send EOM messages via Kafka from the UI for major or emergency cases. However, we are trying to restrict access to this feature.
Currently all AOMA support have access to re-send EOM messages ..   
 
In the last two months, have you encountered any major cases that required EOM messages to be re-sent?  I’m aware of a couple of DPSA incidents due to AOMA data issues, but the AOMA team has mostly resolved these code problems.
 
Given this, do we need to provide access to all users, or should we limit it to a select few?;;;
column445:
13/Aug/25 4:36 PM;vdutta;Hi [~gvamsik]  - 

I spoke with DPS team yesterday and we agree that at this time we should give access to few DPS team members in case they need to push asset messages in case of an emergency.

[~spanick]  - Please provide the list of DPS users that should have access to EOM Asset Sender Service. 

Thanks,

-Vivek;;;
column446:
13/Aug/25 8:51 PM;spanick;Hi Pete, 

Your thoughts based on the above comment. 

Thanks
Suresh P
;;;
column447:
13/Aug/25 10:48 PM;psalvio;Hi all,

In my opinion, if a facility is being offered to a few members of the team it should be offered to all. From a support perspective, It would be extremely lame if one team member was handling an emergency off hours request and needed to contact/wait for another team member who was given the permission.

 

Thanks,
Pete;;;
column448:
14/Aug/25 7:29 PM;gvamsik;As we transition to the new architecture with Kafka for EOM messages, our goal is to eliminate the need for any manual resend activities. Any updates made in AOMA,  events should flow directly to EOM. 
 
This new flow has been live in production for over six to eight months (Phases from - DBKS to AUD-VID and Last phase of LFV  ), with no option to resend messages from users.
 
During this transition, there have been only a few instances requiring the resend option due to internal AOMA code issues, which have now been resolved. These cases were analyzed and handled by the development team. ( No pending code issues ) 
 
The only remaining scenario involves assets registered a few years ago, recently linked, and missing asset information in EOM due to old system issues (e.g., DPSO-92738).
 
I Just came to know that some labels have a workflow that involves performing a metadata import followed by sending an EOM message.  Message from one user  - “ We usually use this function when we have a rush metadata change and we effectively force it to update and go out quicker than the standard timing...Especially for fields that might not update until the weekend for example like artist credits” . 
 
However, technically, there is no reason to resend EOM messages in this Kafka workflow.
 
To ensure a smooth transition, we have enabled the EOM resend option for internal support teams to handle any emergencies. We can extend this option to all EOM support members but want to address scenarios requiring this option first.
 
Action items:
1. Implement an email functionality where the Dev team receives an email when someone uses this option, including user details.
2. Record the usage of this resend option in our history tables to track which products/masters it was used for.
3. Work with the EOM team to identify data discrepancies between AOMA and EOM for older masters.
 
These should help to address the need for manual resend options and provides visibility to resend list so that development team can investigate further . 
 
For now , we will grant re-send option to given users list and let you know. ;;;
column449:
