column1: AOMA Archive Search (AMP search) issues finding assets
column30:
I am getting very inconsistent results from amp search for SME Podcasts. Parent Rep Owner (Sony Music Podcasting) will return all results, when looking for a certain group attempting to use keywords, track titles, Podcast ID numbers, tracks, parts of the archive title, etc, the results are often either null or completely unrelated.

examples to be added to comments.

AOMA Support

Emergency After-Hours Support: Send an email to aoma.support@sonymusic.com with the JIRA ticket number and a brief description.
column444:
04/Aug/25 10:42 PM;jdunca1;Part of a title not returning results (AOMA arhcive 27264134)

!Screenshot 2025-08-04 at 4.33.42 PM.png|width=634,height=224!

Searching for "The Things I Wish I Knew Earlier" or "月曜日文創園" will return this archive:

!Screenshot 2025-08-04 at 4.36.26 PM.png|width=529,height=225!

 

Searching for DoReMischa returns nothing:

!Screenshot 2025-08-04 at 4.37.42 PM.png|width=355,height=290!

In both cases, the search term is listed in the archive title, notes, keywords.

 

 ;;;
column445:
04/Aug/25 10:46 PM;jdunca1;When searching for a podcast ID (Podcast ID: 183)  - noted in Notes and Keywords the returned results is asset  count.

!Screenshot 2025-08-04 at 4.45.33 PM.png|width=501,height=646!;;;
column448:
04/Aug/25 11:12 PM;kmccar1;Hi there team,

Maybe more of an indexing issue? Could you please take a look?

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column449:
06/Aug/25 12:59 PM;poty002;Hi [~kmccar1] [~jdunca1] 

Appreciate your observation. Here’s what we found based on our investigation:
 # *Keyword Field Mapping*

 ** *Issue:* {{masterAttributeValueKy}} was mapped as a {{text}} field using the keyword analyzer, so the entire string (e.g. Asia Podcasts - “DoReMischa") was treated as one token.

 ** *Impact:* Searches for individual words or numbers in that field never matched.

 # *Use of Term-Level Queries*

 ** *Issue:* We were using {{terms}} queries against text fields, which require exact term matches.

 ** *Impact:* Full-text searches (phrases, CamelCase, punctuation) returned no or unrelated results. e.g (Podcast ID: 183 - never match).

 # *Analyzer Tokenization*

 ** *Issue:* The standard analyzer doesn’t split CamelCase or punctuation-based strings in the way we expect.

 ** *Impact:* Queries like “DoReMischa” or “Podcast ID: 183” weren’t broken into searchable tokens.

 # *Query Field List*

 ** *Issue:* Our {{multi_match}} clause included only the {{{}Ctx{}}}/{{{}Tx{}}} variants, not the {{Ky}} field or any n-gram/keyword sub-fields.

 ** *Impact:* Relevant values in {{masterAttributeValueKy}} were never searched.

 
*Next Steps to Resolve*
 * *Remap* {{masterAttributeValueKy}} as a true {{keyword}} or add a {{.text}} sub-field with an edge-ngram analyzer.

 * *Replace* {{terms}} queries with {{{}match{}}}/{{{}match_phrase{}}} for text searches and {{term}} for exact keyword matches.

 * *Enhance* tokenization by introducing an n-gram or whitespace analyzer on a sub-field.

 * *Update* our search queries to include the new {{.keyword}} and/or {{.ngram}} variants in the {{multi_match}} field list.

Once these changes are in place and the data is reindexed, Podcast searches by title, keywords, and ID will return consistent, relevant results. 
We’ve created a ticket for the development, we will pick it up for implementation ASAP. 

Thank you,
Igor
 
 ;;;
column450:
25/Sep/25 9:37 AM;poty002;Hi [~jdunca1] 
The changes were moved to prod yesterday. The search issue has to be fixed. 
Could you please check. 

Thank you,
Igor;;;

column1: UST Video Registrations Stalled: G010005653568G 'Auto Correction In Progress'
column30:
Hi team,

SME Turkey user: encountered an issue with their UST video registration on Sep. 19th. It stalled at the 'Auto Correction In Progress' stage of the registration process. Job ID: 2742585.

!image-2025-09-23-13-19-28-334.png!

Cemre, uploaded again today but it appears this registration may have stalled at the same stage of the process.
|[27503003|https://aoma.smcdp-de.net/master/27503003]|[G010005653568G|https://aoma.smcdp-de.net/product/G010005653568G?masterId=27503003]| |[2744347|https://aoma.smcdp-de.net/asset-upload-job-status?jobId=2744347]|Music Video| |Auto Correction In Progress|yild005|Turkey|09/23/2025 07:10:42| |

 

In the interim, Cemre has uploaded the video file to the Turkey Dropbox of CI. We have looped in GMP to check and register from their side. We'll add their findings here.

Thanks,

Fiona
column444:
23/Sep/25 3:55 PM;kmccar1;*From:* White, Ben, Sony Music <ben.white@sonymusic.com>
*Date:* Tuesday, September 23, 2025 at 9:42 AM
*To:* Burgess, Fiona , EXT <fiona.burgess.ext@sonymusic.com>, Yildiz, Cemre <cemre.yildiz@sonymusic.com>, Sony Music-US, AOMA Support <aoma.support@sonymusic.com>, UK Media Production <UKmediaproduction@sonymusic.com>, Sony Music - US, Media Production <GDL20007685@sonymusic.com>
*Cc:* Poryali, Esra, Sony Music Turkey <esra.poryali@sonymusic.com>
*Subject:* Re: G010005653568G / Video upload issue.

Looking at the source file supplied, I can see that the video and audio codecs do not meet our submission guidelines:

!image-2025-09-23-09-56-48-832.png!

In addition to this, the pixel aspect ratio of the video is HD Anamorphic 1.33:1 (which is why the resolution is 1440x1080) when require a HD video to have square pixels.

On a side note, the audio level peaks at -10.1dB which is very quiets so I would also consider raising the audio levels to peak between 0dB and -3dB.

!image-2025-09-23-09-56-59-814.png!;;;
column445: 23/Sep/25 3:58 PM;mcatande;Just commenting here.  It's great we have the source file and have identified it wasn't compliant, however, the system should have still been able to receive, assess, and auto-correct the asset without stalling.  Can anyone advise where in the workflow this got stuck?  What step? Was it vantage?  Can we get any error log from Vantage?  please retain the source so we can trouble shoot this. ;;;
column446:
23/Sep/25 4:15 PM;spag001;Hi  [~mediaconvdev],

Env - Del
CT - 12194
RequestId - 231790246

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column447:
23/Sep/25 5:10 PM;tang002;Hi Matt,

This job actually failed in Vantage with this error.
!image-2025-09-23-11-07-08-650.png!

But for some reason, MC Vantage Wrapper app after sending the retry signal, didn't update the status or didn't receive the status from Vantage server. I'll create a bug ticket for investigation and will share the ticket number here.

For now, let me reset it from MC.;;;
column449:
23/Sep/25 5:47 PM;spag001;Gotcha, thanks Charlie its now correctly updated.

Hi all,

The job has now failed out and is now in ManualQc. I think in addition to what Keith was mentioning the it looks like the wrong aspect ratio might have been selected.

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column452: 23/Sep/25 7:15 PM;mcatande;We should keep it open until this is fixed.  Also... if two Jira tickets were created, this would appear to be a bug as well no?  Is there a fix for that being implemented as well? ;;;

I've updated the RCA in ACS-3651. In short, this is the edge case caused by incomplete workflow, which shows failed in Workflow Designer, but in progress in the API call.

column450:
29/Aug/25 1:56 AM;venu001;Just transplanting what I read in the Teams chats to the comments:

It looks like the user/Rebecca was looking to send a large sized SFV in multiple formats (2 of which were Vantage). Large sized assets are expected to take longer than most to complete.

However, this SFV was in HD format, and the 2 Vantages she selected were also converting to HD format as well....this was unnecessary as the format was already the same. Instead, it was better to use source copy CT 4202, OR download straight from the details pages. Unfortunately, I was in transit/traveling while I was asked later this evening, but it looks like Rohit was able to communicate this with her. I think this should be good now, and there are new job submissions per below screenshot by Justin. We will monitor.

{*}EDIT{*}: In addition to Vitaliy's above duplicate Export fix, I will be making a ticket to warn a user when the format of the source asset is the same as a selected CT; this warning modal will also display the size of the asset (should only warn when its above 50G);;;
column453: 24/Sep/25 3:25 AM;venu001;Vitaliy's duplicate Export fix is now in PROD; will close this once we put the Vantage checks in;;;

column1: Cover Art registration - Preflight and secondary analysis issues and observations
column30:
Today I registered a cover art asset ([HERE|[https://sonymusicentertainment-my.sharepoint.com/:f:/g/personal/michael_catandella_sonymusic_com/EvYOy98IjRhAjesUZoNrygUBb7EAvj0BgpIx19JJEhecuQ?e=qMlSjv] ]) 

File name: BKGR_Source.tif

Prelight indicated no issues with the file. 

I submitted the file and the interface looked like this: 

!image-2025-02-04-15-17-59-076.png|width=1070,height=361!

Can we have the above corrected? 

Secondary Validation then Failed with the interface only showing the following: 

!image-2025-02-04-15-19-40-356.png|width=1073,height=388!

Can the above be addressed?  I was unable to see why it failed in the interface. 

I then checked my e-mails and saw the following: 

!image-2025-02-04-15-23-00-640.png!

A more clear version is available in the folder linked earlier. 

Can we fix the messaging here? Maybe have a breakout on these? Additionally, the source file was a layered Tif image.  We need to look into why Preflight didn't detect any issues.  We need to look into why secondary validation threw the disparate errors of missing header information when the real issue is that the file is layered. 

In summary: 
 # There are interface updates required in UST
 # There are messaging updates required in the e-mail notification 
 # We need to look into why the source file wasn't flagged as expected in Preflight and secondary analyses
column444:
05/Feb/25 3:49 PM;hale002;Hi [~mcatande],

Can we have the asset which was used for this issue ?;;;
column448:
05/Feb/25 8:13 PM;mcatande;Data we expect to be returned: 
 * Preflight
 ** DPI/PPI ("Resolution")
 ** Wrapper/extension
 ** Bits per channel / Bit depth
 ** Colorspace
 ** Aspect Ratio
 ** Resolution/Dimensions (height/width)
 * Secondary
 ** DPI/PPI ("Resolution")
 ** Wrapper/extension
 ** Bits per channel / Bit depth
 ** Alpha Channel/layer Check
 ** Colorspace
 ** Pixel order 
 ** Compression
 ** Aspect Ratio
 ** Resolution/Dimensions (height/width)

The Example Mohammed shows in his comment [https://jira.smedigitalapps.com/jira/browse/DPSA-30680?focusedCommentId=5401136&focusedId=5401136&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-5401136] 

Is a file run through what I think is AOMA Preflight (could be secondary, I don't know)? The results returned show there is no readable header data, but using a desktop app and "get info" there is clearly data. 

If I had more information on the tools being used and the output data, I may be able to advise fields specific to the tool on the contingency I could run it against sample assets.  Or... Maybe we should have a breakout meeting to run a bunch of assets, look at the fields and match them to our file data nomenclature.  

Also... I was under the impression we're using both MediaInfo and ImageMagick for analysis.  The screenshot Mohammed shared looks like it's just MediaInfo? 

Also from that screenshot, I see "COVER_VALIDATION_MAPPING:WARNING:Current Media Type not supported" It was a TIFF file right?  Why would it return "not supported"? ;;;
column449:
06/Feb/25 7:48 PM;hale002;Hi [~SIYA001]

As discussed on teams , UST - preflight is using imagemagik version 7.0.8-45 & AMP is using 7.1.1-23, Preflight is detecting the values which AMP is not, In this case i guess there needs to be an analysis on which version of imagemagik we need to be using ?



Below is the screenshot on why preflight did not flag the source file, the hilighted files were returning as not detected from AMP

!image-2025-02-06-13-48-15-335.png!;;;

18/Feb/25 6:22 PM;mcatande;March 25th - preview overlays will be addressed/fixed 

April build - addressing the 'pass with warning' messaging in e-mail and yellow alert icon clickable for message. 

TBD - the Error button being displayed without refreshing the screen. 

 ;;;

column1: Digital Archive: Quarterly Usage Report
column30:
Hi [~aomadatadevs] 

The current monthly DA report should include the following:
 - Storage Tier the master was archived to (S3, Glacier Or Glacier Deep)

In addition, I would need another Quarterly Reports (sent on July 1st, Oct 1st, Jan1st, Apr 1st and so on) with consolidated information:

1) Parent Rep Owner

2) Total Data Archived (Size) to S3 (during the quarter e.g Apr 1st - Jun 30th)

3) Total Data Archived (Size) to Glacier (during the quarter e.g Apr 1st - Jun 30th)

4) Total Data Archived (Size) to Glacier Deep (during the quarter e.g Apr 1st - Jun 30th)

5) Total Data Archived Prior (Size) (prior to this current quarter since inception e.g starting until March 31st for the quarterly report of Apr 1st - Jun 30th)

6) Total Data Exported (Size) (during the quarter e.g Apr 1st - Jun 30th)

7) Country

8) Contact for Chargeback

column446:
08/Oct/24 11:25 PM;roraj01;Thanks [~sira001] 

For the next Quarterly Report, I request a few more changes:

1) Add a column for cost center (attached the sheet which has mapping)

2) Add a column for company code (attached the sheet which has mapping)

3) Add a column to calculate Total Upload Cost (CQ) using the formula below:

=([@[last_quarter_file_size_standard_gb]]+[@[last_quarter_file_size_glacier_gb]]+[@[last_quarter_file_size_glacier_deep_archive_gb]])*$140/1000

4) Add a column to calculate Total Download Cost (CQ) using the formula below:

=[@[export_size_gb]]*$140/1000

5) Add a column to calculate Total Storage Cost (CQ Uploads)

=([@[last_quarter_file_size_standard_gb]]*$24*3+[@[llast_quarter_file_size_glacier_gb]]*$5*3+[@[last_quarter_file_size_glacier_deep_archive_gb]]*$2*3)/1000

6) Add a column to calculate Total Storage Cost (Prior Uploads)

[@[prior_to_last_quarter_file_size_gb]]*$5*3/1000

7) Add a column to calculate the Total Cost (sum of #3, #4, #5 and #6

Thank you,

Rohit ;;;
column447:
10/Dec/24 8:44 PM;roraj01;[~sira001] ,

I want to have the upload cost broken by the method of upload/transfer.

Total Data Transferred from Ci to DA

Total Data Transferred from S3 to DA

Total Data Uploaded from Local to DA via TUSD

Total Data Uploaded from Local to DA via Aspera.. 

The Upload cost should only consider total data uploaded via Aspera (option 4) X $140/TB

Happy to discuss with you if you have any questions. Currently TUSD is in progress so production doesn't have anything specific to TUSD. anything coming from Local is all Aspera traffic.

In addition, any current and past storage cost should also be calculated based on the storage option selected by a user for those upload:

New Uploads

1) If S3 was selected (default) -> $25/TB/Month (*3 Months)

2) If Glacier was selected -> $5/TB/Month (*3 Months)

OR 3) If Glacier Deep was selected -> $2/TB/Month (*3 Months)

Past Uploads

1) If S3 was selected (default) -> $5/TB/Month (*3 Months)

2) If Glacier was selected -> $5/TB/Month (*3 Months)

OR 3) If Glacier Deep was selected -> $2/TB/Month (*3 Months);;;

as discussed, here are the changes we would like to make on this quarterly report

These three columns must be calculated with last three months of data 
local_da_aspera_size_gb    ci_to_da_size_gb    s3_to_da_size_gb


total_upload_cost_cq should be local_da_aspera_size_gb/1000 x $140/TB

 

prior_to_last_quarter_file_size_gb should be broken down in three categories
prior_to_last_quarter_file_size_standard_gb    
prior_to_last_quarter_file_size_glacier_gb    
prior_to_last_quarter_file_size_glacier_deep_archive_gb

Calculation for the past storage cost.. 

(prior_to_last_quarter_file_size_standard_gb + prior_to_last_quarter_file_size_glacier_gb)/1000 * $5/TB/Month (*3 Months)

(prior_to_last_quarter_file_size_glacier_deep_archive_gb) / 1000 * $2/TB/Month (*3 Months)

Total Cost
UPload Cost + Download cost + Stroage cost (for this quarter) + Storage cost (for previous to this quarter)

 

I will provide the cover sheet template later but please work on the main report with the changes outlined here ^

Thanks

Rohit ;;;

column453:
09/Apr/25 8:36 PM;roraj01;Hi [~sira001] 

Here're the changes that I want to request for next quarter:

Column A - Territory

Column B - Cost Center

Column C - Company Code (please use the first 4 digits of Cost Center to populate this column)

Column D - User Email (hard code the values to "NA (usage based chargeback)")

Column E - Service Type (this should be "AOMA Digital Archive and in bracket the parent rep owner name e.g. AOMA Digital Archive (Columbia Records Group)"

Column F - Service Period (the year . the last month of the report e.g. 2025.03, 2025.06, etc)

Column G - Service Period Description (hard code value to say "Quarterly")

Column H - Amount (leave the values blank)

Column I - Leave this completely blank with no header (reserved for the accounting purpose)

Column J - Credit To (Hardcode this to "2000-2000306A-8165000000"

After Column J, please retain all the columns in existing report... so Column H should be last_quarter_file_size_standard_gb and so on from there till the end..

Minor adjustments to new storage calculation

1) If S3 was selected (default) -> $26/TB/Month (*3 Months)

2) If Glacier was selected -> $6/TB/Month (*3 Months)

OR 3) If Glacier Deep was selected -> $3/TB/Month (*3 Months)

Minor adjustment the past storage cost.. 

(prior_to_last_quarter_file_size_standard_gb + prior_to_last_quarter_file_size_glacier_gb)/1000 * $6/TB/Month (*3 Months)

(prior_to_last_quarter_file_size_glacier_deep_archive_gb) / 1000 * $3/TB/Month (*3 Months)

Thanks,

Rohit ;;;

column1: TESTING - Live testing of downloads using HTTP with Rick
16/48 K files are incorrectly tagged with 16/44.1 in filename from details
column30: The AOMA master details download is exporting 16 bit 48kHz files with the incorrect name. They are tagged as 44.1 in both the short and the long name. To note, the file is the correct rate, but the naming is wrong. G010005645848Z is the example. Please see pic in comments.
column444: 16/Sep/25 4:49 PM;jdunca1;!Details export.png|width=885,height=409!;;;
column445:
16/Sep/25 5:47 PM;kmccar1;I didn't think we were accepting 16b48k - the standard's been 16b44.1k. Could you please take a look, team? 

*2.1 WAV File Specifications*

All individual files sent to Sony Music for assembly should be created with the following specifications:
 * *44.1kHz / 16 bit [WAV|https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/audio/glossary/#WAV] files (WAVs are preferred)*
 * 44.1kHz, 48kHz, 88.2kHz, 96kHz, 176kHz, 192kHz / 24 bit WAV
 * Files should be delivered as discrete audio tracks
 * Files should contain fully mastered audio
 * [Files must be either stereo or dual-channel Mono|https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/audio/commonly-reported-issues/#WAV2]

Thanks

Keith;;;
column446: 16/Sep/25 5:52 PM;jdunca1;Hey Keith. For 16, we take both 44 and 48. To note, 44 is more common and preferred for that reason, but 48 is allowed.;;;

column1: G010005649697Z - TusD / 24b48k source file issue
column30:
Hi team,

Just putting this on your radar in case it is a new TusD issue. We were unable to register this 24 Bit 48kHz WAV file via TusD in Prod and Stage: PUSO AT ISIP 24BIT.wav.

This file is available for testing at this Media Mailbox: [https://sonymusic.cimediacloud.com/r/LE7WAMT1IEDz]

Note, we were able to register this file without issue via Import from Sony CI in Prod and via Aspera in Stage.

*PROD*

Product: G010005649697Z

Clicked Select File/TusD uploader/Automatically down convert 24bit to 16bit.

Clicked Submit

Result: Upload appears to complete, then the upload disapears from the File Transfer section of the Notifications panel. Failed error message displays in the upper right: "Failed to upload..."

!image-2025-09-12-10-32-14-940.png!

*!image-2025-09-12-10-58-22-184.png!*

 

*File is successfully registered via Import from Sony Ci*

*__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________*

*STAGE*

Product: AIXX00362B00Z

Clicked Select File/TusD uploader/Automatically down convert 24bit to 16bit.

Clicked Submit

Result: Upload appears to complete, then the upload disapears from the File Transfer section of the Notifications panel. FYI, after a refresh the upload shows as Failed in the Notifications panel.

Failed error message displays in the upper right: "Failed to upload..."

!image-2025-09-12-10-50-26-148.png!

 

*!image-2025-09-12-10-56-49-130.png!*

*File is successfully registered via Aspera*

 

Thanks,

Fiona

column1: G0100056134676 - Mapping Error (SME Legacy)
column30:
G0100056134676
|AOMA|MAPPING|ERROR|Error Generated by Aoma: AudioEncodingFormat is missing in AOMA:47|
column444:
11/Sep/25 10:21 PM;kmccar1;Hi db team,

Could you please check this error out? 

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column445:
11/Sep/25 10:28 PM;woom001;[~kmccar1]

assuming this is label copy related; the "is_play_time_relevant" and "audio_src_encoding" flags per WPTS-449833 and WPTS-450464.

a very common issue we used to see a lot but haven't seen in the past 5 years.

5.1 tracks are flagged properly and are skipped on import, but not the atmos tracks. the last atmos track was removed from label copy, thus 22 tracks instead of 23 importing incorrectly.

thanks.;;;
column446:
11/Sep/25 10:46 PM;sira001;Hi [~kmccar1] ,

Audio encoding 'Dolby Atmos Video' (id:47) is a new entry created in GRPS yesterday. I have synced the data in AOMA. MI is successful now. Please verify.

Regards,

Vinodhan;;;
column447:
11/Sep/25 10:49 PM;woom001;This still imports with 45 tracks instead of 23.

skip tracks are set to 0, so are the atmos tracks flagged "is_play_time_relevant" as no, and does the new audio encoding "Dolby Atmos Video" have the same logic in place as 5.1 src encoding to ignore on import?;;;
column448:
11/Sep/25 10:50 PM;kmccar1;Serious stuff, many thanks for the quick turnaround [~sira001] !

Should be good to proceed now, [~woom001]. Let us know otherwise...

Thanks all,

Keith;;;
column449:
11/Sep/25 10:52 PM;kmccar1;I see - that would be a question for the db team.

Keith;;;
column450:
11/Sep/25 11:12 PM;sira001;[~zeki001] [~vleung1] ,

Could you please check [~woom001] 's question?

These are still coming up as tracks from RDX. !image-2025-09-11-17-12-31-581.png!



Regards,

Vinodhan;;;
column451:
12/Sep/25 7:50 AM;zeki001;Hi [~sira001],

I'm going to take a look. 

Thanks,
Alem;;;
column452:
12/Sep/25 11:20 AM;zeki001;Hi [~sira001] and [~woom001], 

It does not meet any exclusion criteria in the reprocessing layer. 
I have also checked legacy logic (GRAS Export), and it exports 45 tracks.  

Exclusion rules: 

!image-2025-09-12-11-17-14-049.png|width=742,height=235!

Wiki page with full description: 

[https://wiki.smedigitalapps.com/wiki/spaces/MI/pages/261456179/Data+reprocessing+rules+Product+document#Datareprocessingrules:Productdocument-Producttracksselection] 

Legacy document (generated locally, since the old system is decommissioned): 

[^product_G0100056134676_legacy_xml.xml]

Thanks,
Alem;;;
column453:
12/Sep/25 7:06 PM;dewi013;Hi [~zeki001] 

Using two tracks from this product, are you able to tell us what is the difference?

GBLTP2500094 is the 5.1 encoding version and is being successfully excluded in line with the 'exclude' criteria above.
GBLTP2500117 is the Dolby Atmos version that is set up exactly the same apart from the Audio Encoding value but is *not* being excluded in line with the 'exclude' criteria above.

Victor and I are confused about how one is meeting the exclude criteria and the other is not when they are the same.

 

Trudi;;;
column454:
12/Sep/25 7:25 PM;zeki001;Hi [~dewi013], 

There are a few relevant extracts from the JSON response. 

Product configuration:

 
{code:java}
    "configuration": {
        "configKey": "C9",
        "name": "Digital Video Longform",
        "shortName": "DDVDV",
        "isDVD": false,
        "isDMD": true,
        "isMISupported": true,
        "sideCnt": 1,
        "isSingleTrack": false,
        "mediaType": {
            "key": "3",
            "title": "Multimedia"
        }
    } {code}
 

Track GBLTP2500094:
{code:java}
            "skipNo": 0,
            "isTrkDurationRelevant": false,
            "srcAudioEncode": {
                "key": "29",
                "title": "5.1 channel"
            }
            "trackMediaKey": {
                "key": "2",
                "title": "Video"
            } {code}
Track GBLTP2500117;
{code:java}
            "skipNo": 0,
            "isTrkDurationRelevant": false,
            "srcAudioEncode": {
                "key": "47",
                "title": "Dolby Atmos Video"
            }
            "trackMediaKey": {
                "key": "2",
                "title": "Video"
            } {code}
And, I think, this is a rule that you are targeting :
 * Skip number is equal to 0
 * and media type key is 2
 * and source encoding key is 29
 * and play time relevant flag is false
 * and config key is C9. 

There is no OR operator. All operators are AND - all subconditions must be met.

Track GBLTP2500094 meets all conditions: 
 * skip number is 0
 * media type key is 2 - Video 
 * audio source encoding key is 29 - 5.1 channel
 * play time relevant flag is false 
 * product configuration is C9 Digital Video Longform

Track GBLTP2500117 meets the following conditions: 
 * skip number is 0
 * media type key is 2 - Video 
 * play time relevant flag is false 
 * product configuration is C9 Digital Video Longform

But, it doesn't meet this one: 
 * audio source encoding key is 29 - 5.1 channel. 

For this one track, the audio source encoding key is 47 - Dolby Atmos Video. 

If you want to exclude 47 - Dolby Atmos Video in a combination with the rest of the subconditions, we need to update our reprocessing logic.

The current logic is legacy from GRAS Export and doesn't consider 47 - Dolby Atmos Video. Actually, it considers only the 29 - 5.1 channel. 

Or, if you don't want to consider the audio source encoding key in general, but want to consider the rest of the subconditions, we also need to update reprocessing logic. 

Thanks,
Alem

 ;;;
column455: 12/Sep/25 7:34 PM;vcampan;Sounds like all we need to do is add "audio source encoding key is 47 - Dolby Atmos Video" to the exclusion criteria and we'll be good.;;;
column458:
12/Sep/25 7:48 PM;zeki001;Hi [~dewi013], 

We have implemented a reprocessing layer as a lambda function. Since we don't need to make any updates to the RDX query, we will update it. 
I'll let you know once we are done. 

This is a ticket for fixing this: 
https://jira.smedigitalapps.com/jira/browse/MI-85 

Thanks,
Alem;;;
column460:
12/Sep/25 8:20 PM;zeki001;We updated the lambda function and executed priority import. 

!image-2025-09-12-20-20-20-396.png!

It should be fine now. 

Please double-check from your end. 

Thanks,
Alem;;;
column461:
12/Sep/25 8:52 PM;woom001;Hi [~zeki001]

confirmed this is showing up as 23 tracks now.

i can't view the fix ticket; when do we expect a permanent fix to be in place?

G0100056311556 is another upcoming product with atmos tracks that will require the same; should we add that to this DPSA or wait for the fix?

thanks.;;;
column462:
12/Sep/25 9:00 PM;dewi013;Thanks very much Alem.

I know it's late for you so we appreciate this.;;;
column463:
12/Sep/25 9:50 PM;zeki001;Hi [~woom001], 

This is a general fix for all tracks with skip no 0, media type key 2 - Video, product configuration C9 - Digital Video Longform, play time relevant flag set to false, and audio source encoding key 47 - Dolby Atmos Video. It's not only a workaround for the G0100056311556 product. 

We changed rule to: 

"Skip number is equal to 0, and media type key is 2, and source encoding key is {*}in (29, 47){*}, and play time relevant flag is false, and config key is C9". 

Thanks,
Alem;;;
column464: 13/Sep/25 12:01 AM;vcampan;Thank you so much Alem, for sorting out the problem and fixing it so quickly.  I just imported another Digital Video Longform that also has Dolby Atmos tracks, and it worked for that one too (G0100056311556).;;;

column1: AOMA Archive - Import from S3 folder structure issue
column30:
We are noticing an issue with the way that folders from S3 import into the archive. The AOMA archive seems to always want to add the parent folder to the folder hierarchy. I'll show two examples where the parent folder gets repeating when importing via S3.

When the whole archive is pulled it doubles the parent folder. (Archive Package Master Number: 27227598) - The RCA folder at the top is double on ingest.. the S3 only has this folder once.

!Screenshot 2025-08-07 at 11.48.48 AM.png|width=572,height=129!

When folders are added from within the parent folder, it duplicates the parent folder and subfolder for every subfolder: Archive Package Master Number: 27280292

!Screenshot 2025-08-07 at 11.52.31 AM.png|width=757,height=143!
column444:
07/Aug/25 7:14 PM;kmccar1;Hi there Rebecca,

Could you please check this one out with the team?

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column445: 07/Aug/25 7:38 PM;wang042;Hi [~kuma039] , could you please take a look into this folder structure issue, thanks!;;;
column446:
08/Aug/25 7:24 AM;kuma039;Hi [~jdunca1] ,

I am reviewing this issue and shall keep you posted.

Regards,

Deepak;;;
column447:
08/Aug/25 1:27 PM;kuma039;Hi [~jdunca1] ,

Could you please confirm, if you are seeing this issue more often or this only happened with mentioned folders?

Regards,

Deepak;;;
column448:
08/Aug/25 4:35 PM;mcatande;As. far as we can tell this is repeat behavior in the system.  It could be isolated to S3 imports. 

Looks like possibly, if the folder you select is nested in another folder (or deeper in many folders), the archive will create folder with the name you selected, then it will start at the top level folder and create the same nested structure on the origin S3.  

For Example:
 * I have a folder on S3 I want to select and archive called "ArchiveProject1" 
 * "ArchiveProject1" is on S3 nested within two other folders, path: s3://Backup/AprilForBackup/ArchiveProject1/
 * The archive will register and create a path with the top level folder name as desired/intended but then it replicates the nested files looking like Archive://ArchiveProject1/Backup/AprilForBackup/ArchiveProject1/ 
 * Nesting the desired folder and assets in a series of unwanted and empty folders. 

 ;;;
column449:
08/Aug/25 6:50 PM;hale002;[~wang042] 

Please discuss with Rohit. ;;;
column450:
12/Sep/25 3:35 PM;mbrice1;[~jdunca1] [~mcatande] the fix for this issue is now in production.

Please let us know of any further issues.

Thanks,

Manuela;;;

column444:
10/Sep/25 4:52 PM;kmccar1;Hi there team,

Could you please check on these two jobs? Gail's was submitted last evening around 17:00, but I'm also seeing one from Panphaka that's been in auto-correct since last Thursday morning. 

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column445:
10/Sep/25 5:21 PM;spag001;Hi all,

Looking into this.

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column446:
10/Sep/25 6:01 PM;spag001;Hi all,

The G010005645494K file failed last week due to a vantage issue. I'll reach out with MC team to review this one but I would probably also confirm there isnt any issues with the file.

!image-2025-09-10-11-57-05-048.png!

 

As for G010005637761E job it looks like yesterday a pod restart caused an issue with the job in question. Still looking into the full cause of the restart but in the meanwhile gonna fail this one so we can trigger a new upload with the auto-corrected asset.

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column447:
10/Sep/25 8:48 PM;spag001;Hi all,

Figured out the issue that caused the restart that impacted G010005637761E and will push a fix with the upcoming release.

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column449:
10/Sep/25 9:19 PM;tang002;Hi [~spag001], -I'm looking at the asset resolver URL, it's the smecde.com domain which we do not support, can you try the correct smecloudops,com domain and see if that works for the resubmit?-

[https://assetresolver.smecde.com/assetresolver/resolve/71d58faf-0195-46b9-b4e2-4e66cf39549f.mov]
This URL return 403 from asset resolver. (71d58faf-0195-46b9-b4e2-4e66cf39549f)
!image-2025-09-11-14-02-59-881.png!

Thanks!
Charlie;;;
column450:
10/Sep/25 10:01 PM;kmccar1;New video registration job of auto-corrected master has completed successfully. 
|[27459107|https://aoma.smcdp-de.net/master/27459107]|[G010005637761E|https://aoma.smcdp-de.net/product/G010005637761E?masterId=27459107]| |[2737682|https://aoma.smcdp-de.net/asset-upload-job-status?jobId=2737682]|Music Video|MVD_000027453249_000.mov
 |Registration Successful|kmccar1|Provident|09/10/2025 15:25:59|09/10/2025 15:53:14
Duration: 00:27:15| |

REF: WPTS-453063;;;
column451:
11/Sep/25 8:11 PM;spag001;Hi [~tang002],

Ah apologies I misread one of the logs for this one. Looks like the original file here had an issue on upload which caused the file to be invalid. The auto-correct option should not have been provided to the user so that's a bug will check on our side.

!image-2025-09-11-14-10-44-511.png!



In the meanwhile, support they user should be good to re-upload for that one.

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column452:
11/Sep/25 8:31 PM;kmccar1;Thanks everyone - looks like the label is aware via WPTS-452402. Will close this one out!

Keith;;;

column244:
AOMA Support
Hours: Monday-Friday, 3:30 am-8:00 pm EST
Emergency After-Hours Support: Send an email to aoma.support@sonymusic.com with the JIRA ticket number and a brief description.
column444:
15/Sep/20 8:16 PM;kmccar1;Hi team,

Could you please check into these failures?

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column445:
15/Sep/20 8:33 PM;spag001;Hi Keith,

I'll check this out.

Thanks
Matthew;;;
column446:
15/Sep/20 9:01 PM;spag001;Hi conversion team,

Can you check this job out, (this issue might be related to DPSA-24755). I have the files, let me know where to upload them to.

requestCode=US_REGISTRATION_PACKAGE_GRAPHIC_1714155
 Returning request_id=213014128
 JobId = 1714155

Thanks
 Matthew;;;
column447:
15/Sep/20 9:37 PM;kamt001;Hi Matt,

When the issue was raised in DPSA-24755, I just did some analysis as in why the error was occurring. Please get in touch with [~CABE004] for uploading the files.

Thanks and Regards,

Shreyas Kamthe;;;
column448:
15/Sep/20 10:11 PM;spag001;Hi Cabello, Jaklyn

Can you review these files. I have uploaded the files under your migration folder under the name DPSA-25303.

Thanks
Matthew;;;
column450:
16/Sep/20 4:09 PM;kmccar1;On 9/16/2020 10:05 AM, Dominic Gonzales wrote:
{quote}Good Morning.      I want to follow up on this ingestion issue.  Can you please provide an update.
 
Thank you!
Dominic{quote};;;
column451:
16/Sep/20 4:23 PM;spag001;Hi all,

This type of job can not be registered in the back end. Let me talk to conversion about the issue.

Thanks
Matthew;;;
column452:
16/Sep/20 7:58 PM;spag001;Hi all, 

As a workaround to this problem, adding all the files to the zip bundle and registering should allow the registration to go through. We will need to have a discussion on the long term solution to this issue.

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column453:
16/Sep/20 8:36 PM;rbarry1;Hi Matthew,

Please see [~GONZ004]'s concerns below:

"Client wants previews of the pdfs.  When we zip the pdfs, they ask where's the preview
so we don't do that anymore."
 
Thanks,
Rick

| |;;;
column455:
16/Sep/20 11:33 PM;spag001;Hi all,

So an alternative solution is that if we are provided a revised version of the pdfs (black and white should suffice) we can register those pdfs with the master. Then post registration we can replace those pdfs/md5 files in the back-end with the actual pdf files. 

Though I will note that the previews will not be created in the backend when we do this swap.

Thanks
Matthew;;;
column456:
17/Sep/20 1:52 PM;kmccar1;Hi Dominic,

Please see [~SPAG001]'s comment above and let us know how you'd like to proceed here.

Thanks,

Keith;;;

Would someone be able to check it out and make sure it is processing?

Thank you!

column356: Asset was stuck in registration due to an internal AOMA error
column444:
22/Feb/22 9:53 PM;kmccar1;Hi team,

Could you please check on this job?

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column445: 22/Feb/22 11:24 PM;gcrawf1;Can someone please provide an update on this?;;;
column446: 22/Feb/22 11:28 PM;kmccar1;+watchers;;;
column447: 22/Feb/22 11:29 PM;kmccar1;[~aoma-as], checking in on this...;;;
column448: 22/Feb/22 11:32 PM;gcrawf1;Also, please note this is time sensitive ;;;
column449:
22/Feb/22 11:33 PM;spag001;Hello,

Checking this out.

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column450:
22/Feb/22 11:37 PM;spag001;Hi all,

Looking like this is still in conversion.

Hi conversion team,

Can you check on this request, its been processing for a while.

"requestId":"219981125","requestCd":"US_REGISTRATION_WAV_2018310_1","statusString":"InProgress"

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column452:
22/Feb/22 11:44 PM;spag001;Hi all,

There an issue arvato VM at the moment which is causing issues with the conversions. MC team has reached out to support to get this resolved as soon as possible. 

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column454:
23/Feb/22 12:44 AM;rbarry1;[~jdunca1] [~TOBI017] ,

 

FYI, we were able to create and register a new 16 bit WAV master, 000021736078 - Audio Master WAV 16 Bit and link to G010004756888Z.  Will still need to be QC'd, etc.

 

Please note that we had to do a duration override in the process.

 
||Sequence||Failure Type||Failure Severity||Message||
|1|Validation|WARNING|The duration 00:03:01:00 for Track 1 entitled "MURDAMAN!" on component 1 is not within 10s of the actual duration of the audio track master you are attempting to link it to (Master Title "MURDAMAN!" with duration 00:02:36:54) (difference=25s).|

 

Let us know if there are any issues.

Thanks,

Rick;;;
column455:
23/Feb/22 12:45 AM;jdunca1;Hey all. Label noted to put this (and another version of the song) on hold until tomorrow. Not sure if we are getting new assets. This can hold until tomorrow.
;;;
column456:
23/Feb/22 5:13 PM;tobi017;Asset has been Post Reg QCed, all is good with the audio.

Thank you all for your help. have a great day!;;;

13/Mar/20 5:52 PM;kamt001;Hi Team,

I got the package folder for which the error is being thrown. But the package has a lot of files in it. Also I am seeing that three of the four errors posted above are for a jpeg file and there is no jpeg file in the folder provided to me. The last error has the pdf file 000014348746_SL_PS_01_01_01_001001.pdf. I tried running the conversion and it created the descriptor file on my local environment as well as prod environment. It works fine and the conversion is successful creating the descriptor.xml file.

It would be helpful If I get the actual files for which the error are being thrown so that I can get to the root cause of the issue.

Apart from this I tried to look through the issue on the web and found something noteworthy. The above error contains the following lines
"Failed to initialise downsample filter, downsampling aborted Subsample filter does not support non-integer downsample factor (1.993028)"

The following link explains the reason of the error :-

https://stackoverflow.com/questions/39937028/ghostscript-downsampling-of-pdf-images-downsample-factor-error

Thanks and Regards,
Shreyas Kamthe

column455:
16/Mar/20 11:04 PM;kamt001;Hi Team,

This is a file and the tool issue. I did some analysis and research regarding this ticket. This issue is regarding the downsampling of the pdf image to reduce it size. There is some intermediate conversion type being called which uses the GhostScript to down sample the PDF.

The PDF has a monochrome image which, according to the GhostScript, can only be down sampled using some internal tool called Subsample. But Subsample does not work in case the sampling factor is not an integer. It is also not rounding off the value to nearest integer, neither will it let the user do it. Hence we get the following error :-
"The only Downsample filter for monochrome images is Subsample, ignoring request.
Subsample filter does not support non-integer downsample factor (1.999991)
Failed to initialise downsample filter, downsampling aborted".

I have also tried using the latest version of GhostScript which uses something called Bicubic for sampling of the image. Unfortunately monochrome images can be sampled using Subsample only. So the tool throws the following error :-
"The only Downsample filter for monochrome images is Subsample, ignoring request."

I have captured the command used by Media Conversion application which is as follows :-

C:\Program Files\gs\gs9.20\bin\gswin64c.exe -dSAFER -dNOPAUSE -dNOPAGEPROMPT -dSHORTERRORS -dBATCH -dUseCropBox -sDEVICE#pdfwrite -sOutputFile#C:\Users\kamt001\Documents\Projects\dockerized-media-conversion\base-maven\sme-mc-system-test-svc\testsources\DPSA_24755-gs.pdf -sOwnerPassword#smepreview -dEncryptionR#3 -dKeyLength#128 -dPermissions#-3900 -c .setpdfwrite "[/Title (Death Stranding (Original Score)) /Author (Ludvig Forssell) /Subject (Digital PDF Booklet) /Keywords (Sony Music Entertainment Inc.)  /DOCINFO pdfmark " -f C:\Users\kamt001\Documents\Projects\dockerized-media-conversion\base-maven\sme-mc-wip\.\profiles\prod\arvato\Ghostscript\DistillerSettings\000002.joboptions C:\Users\kamt001\Documents\Projects\dockerized-media-conversion\base-maven\sme-mc-system-test-svc\testsources\DPSA_24755.pdf

So I guess this will only fail when the image is a monochrome and the sampling rate is not an integer.

Also I am attaching the following links that I referred to get this Information :-

http://git.ghostscript.com/?p=ghostpdl.git;h=b880332b899e0e59d17c7e48033e5cc816e5a831

https://www.ghostscript.com/doc/9.20/VectorDevices.htm#PDFWRITE

https://ghostscript.com/pipermail/gs-bugs/2016-November/046418.html

https://bugs.ghostscript.com/show_bug.cgi?id=697351

Thanks and Regards,
Shreyas Kamthe;;;
column456:
17/Mar/20 4:27 PM;cabe004;Hi Shreyas,

I tired to re-export the PDF of sleeve page 1 and the overlay of the red circle on the image is showing pink instead of the red. That overlay is a spot pearlescent which is for a metallic overlay for printing. 

Is there any way to add a line of code to treat monochrome images as a black & white image and see if that works? 

Otherwise, I recommend adding the sleeve page 1 file to the zip bundle and registering it that way. I'm unsure if the label can do anything to change their export that won't fail for a monochrome image again.

-Jackie ;;;
column457:
17/Mar/20 6:04 PM;kamt001;Hey Jackie,

Media Conversion as an application does not access the source file. All the conversion changes to the source file are being done only by the tool (in this case GhostScript). So any code change won't help in this case.

I have captured the following command I am trying to play with it a little bit to figure out how to either ignore the monochrome image or treat it like a black and white image.

C:\Program Files\gs\gs9.20\bin\gswin64c.exe -dSAFER -dNOPAUSE -dNOPAGEPROMPT -dSHORTERRORS -dBATCH -dUseCropBox -sDEVICE#pdfwrite -sOutputFile#C:\Users\kamt001\Documents\Projects\dockerized-media-conversion\base-maven\sme-mc-system-test-svc\testsources\DPSA_24755-gs.pdf -sOwnerPassword#smepreview -dEncryptionR#3 -dKeyLength#128 -dPermissions#-3900 -c .setpdfwrite "[/Title (Death Stranding (Original Score)) /Author (Ludvig Forssell) /Subject (Digital PDF Booklet) /Keywords (Sony Music Entertainment Inc.)  /DOCINFO pdfmark " -f C:\Users\kamt001\Documents\Projects\dockerized-media-conversion\base-maven\sme-mc-wip\.\profiles\prod\arvato\Ghostscript\DistillerSettings\000002.joboptions C:\Users\kamt001\Documents\Projects\dockerized-media-conversion\base-maven\sme-mc-system-test-svc\testsources\DPSA_24755.pdf

This command works perfectly fine (i.e. it throws the exact error that is being thrown by media conversion) and only needs the modification of the paths mentioned (as these paths are specific to my local machine).

Please let me know if you find out any parameter to be set in this command which may solve the issue.

Thanks and Regards,
Shreyas Kamthe;;;

18/Mar/20 3:57 PM;cabe004;Hi Jaklyn.

they can close the ticket.

Thanks,

column1: LFV: G0100042516329 AOMA preview for feature contains 1 channel of audio
column30:
The CT 3007 preview video Media Library created for the feature displayed on the Long form Details page contains 1 channel of audio (left).

This is a bug for products with 5.1 audio that was supposedly fixed with the last ffmpeg upgrade that was done.

Can you have this preview file pulled down for us to review? (and note the "date created" info on the file). Just the feature preview, as the trailer preview that contains stereo audio is fine.

Once pulled down, can you have the AOMA previews regenerated for the feature? (to see if this issue persists).

thanks.

15/Oct/21 12:04 AM;roraj01;Attaching the GRPS/DX list received from Chris S.

Here's the logic we shall use to retrieve the VSC master ids:

-> Get the full published product

    --> if only one found -> get the VSC master id

    --> If more than one found -> get the one with most recent video registration

    --> If none found -> Check rest of the product for VSC and take the VSC from the product that has most recent video registration

 

I am setting up a call with Vamsi and Manaswini to discuss this

 

 ;;;

column446:
07/Jan/22 6:40 PM;tang002;The last successful CT12196 conversion was Jan 04, 2021, and there is no app change or workflow change since the last deployment which is Dec 15, 2020. This is most likely either invalid request payload or Telestream cloud flip API issue.

I've restarted the service in the Vantage server and restarted the job after that, but it failed with the same error message. We will submit a test conversion in the stage environment to check if Telestream cloud flip API is down or not.;;;
column447:
07/Jan/22 7:58 PM;tang002;Just had one successful conversion in the stage environment, looks like Telestream API is up.

!image-2022-01-07-13-52-46-277.png!

[~sgur001] 
Hi Suha, can you try a new request with a different output path? The Vantage service is running fine and there's no app change recently, and we just verified that the Telestream API is up running. 
If you still have the same error, then I'll open a support ticket to Telestream since the error message is from their application.

Thanks!;;;
column449: 10/Jan/22 5:21 PM;mcatande;Is there a status update on this? ;;;
column450:
10/Jan/22 6:04 PM;tang002;There no change for the workflow and application, and this is not reproduceable in Stage environment. I've sent email to ask Telestream to open a support ticket for this.

 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

*From:* Tang, Charlie, Itopia <charlie.tang.itopia@sonymusic.com> 
 *Sent:* Monday, January 10, 2022 12:01 PM
 *To:* Mike McCoy <mikem@telestream.net>
 *Cc:* Media Conversion Developers <media.conversion.developers@sonymusic.com>; Catandella, Michael, Sony Music <michael.catandella@sonymusic.com>; Gur, Suha, Sony Music <suha.gur@sonymusic.com>
 *Subject:* Workflow failed at Deploy action after Cloud flip

 

Hi Mike,

 

We recently received a production alert for our cloud flip workflow. It looks like the cloud flip itself completed with no error, but the subsequent deploy action failed with this message: 
 10.01.2022 16:37:33        Transport            GTSMEWVE07805            Info

Transport Session: Unable to transport media: System.Net.WebException: The request was aborted: Could not create SSL/TLS secure channel.

  !image-2022-01-10-12-03-54-677.png!

This workflow worked until Jan 04, 2022, and suddenly started to fail on Jan 07, 2022. There’s been no workflow change from our side since Aug 26, 2021. I’ve checked the request, and it looks ok to me, also, the target folder for the deploy action is accessible with no issue.

  !image-2022-01-10-12-04-00-919.png!

The trace log for the Transport service says the same error message, so I restarted the Transport service and then restarted the failed job, still the same error.

  !image-2022-01-10-12-04-05-972.png!

!image-2022-01-10-12-04-13-912.png!

The job was successfully converted from the Vantage Cloud port page, so by compiling all the information that I have, I think it failed at downloading stage from the Telestream cloud to the local machine.

However, the error message doesn’t provide any helpful information to resolve this. Can you help us troubleshoot or show us how to extract the actual error?

Also, can you open a support ticket for this?

 

Thanks!

Charlie

 

 ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

 

 ;;;
column451:
10/Jan/22 7:59 PM;tang002; 

*From:* Tang, Charlie, Itopia 
 *Sent:* Monday, January 10, 2022 1:59 PM
 *To:* 'Mike McCoy' <mikem@telestream.net>
 *Cc:* Media Conversion Developers <media.conversion.developers@sonymusic.com>; Catandella, Michael, Sony Music <michael.catandella@sonymusic.com>; Gur, Suha, Sony Music <suha.gur@sonymusic.com>
 *Subject:* RE: Workflow failed at Deploy action after Cloud flip

 

Hi Mike,

 

There have been some windows updates since Jan 04, and our infrastructure vendor maintains them. And based on the name, they are all security patches for Microsoft Endpoint, which means they should have nothing to do with the system settings. Please see the below screenshot.

  !image-2022-01-10-13-59-45-667.png!

 

Also, there is no UseExternalTransportProcess  key under HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Wow6432Node\Telestream\Soa

  !image-2022-01-10-13-59-51-181.png!

Let me know if you need anything else from my side to help determine the issue.

Thanks!

 

Charlie

 

*From:* Mike McCoy <[mikem@telestream.net|mailto:mikem@telestream.net]> 
 *Sent:* Monday, January 10, 2022 1:13 PM
 *To:* Tang, Charlie, Itopia <[charlie.tang.itopia@sonymusic.com|mailto:charlie.tang.itopia@sonymusic.com]>
 *Cc:* Media Conversion Developers <[media.conversion.developers@sonymusic.com|mailto:media.conversion.developers@sonymusic.com]>; Catandella, Michael, Sony Music <[michael.catandella@sonymusic.com|mailto:michael.catandella@sonymusic.com]>; Gur, Suha, Sony Music <[suha.gur@sonymusic.com|mailto:suha.gur@sonymusic.com]>
 *Subject:* RE: Workflow failed at Deploy action after Cloud flip

 

*EXTERNAL SENDER*

Charlie,

  I just ran a similar job on my end the Deploy action was successful. Were there are Windows Updates installed recently or any changes that you can think of around that timeframe?

 

Can you let me know if the following registry key ‘UseExternalTransportProcess ‘ is present in the following path?

 

HKLM\Software\Wow6432Node\Telestream\Soa

 

Thanks,

 

Mike

 

 

Mike McCoy | Principal Support Engineer | US 877-257-6245 | International 530-470-2036

 ;;;
column452:
10/Jan/22 8:55 PM;tang002;*From:* Tang, Charlie, Itopia 
 *Sent:* Monday, January 10, 2022 2:55 PM
 *To:* 'Mike McCoy' <mikem@telestream.net>
 *Cc:* Media Conversion Developers <media.conversion.developers@sonymusic.com>; Catandella, Michael, Sony Music <michael.catandella@sonymusic.com>; Gur, Suha, Sony Music <suha.gur@sonymusic.com>
 *Subject:* RE: Workflow failed at Deploy action after Cloud flip

 

Hi Mike,

 

It works with this key added to the registry.

Thank you so much for the solution!

 

Charlie.

 

*From:* Mike McCoy <[mikem@telestream.net|mailto:mikem@telestream.net]> 
 *Sent:* Monday, January 10, 2022 2:16 PM
 *To:* Tang, Charlie, Itopia <[charlie.tang.itopia@sonymusic.com|mailto:charlie.tang.itopia@sonymusic.com]>
 *Cc:* Media Conversion Developers <[media.conversion.developers@sonymusic.com|mailto:media.conversion.developers@sonymusic.com]>; Catandella, Michael, Sony Music <[michael.catandella@sonymusic.com|mailto:michael.catandella@sonymusic.com]>; Gur, Suha, Sony Music <[suha.gur@sonymusic.com|mailto:suha.gur@sonymusic.com]>
 *Subject:* RE: Workflow failed at Deploy action after Cloud flip

 

*EXTERNAL SENDER*

Charlie,

  Can you add the registry key and let me know if it resolves the problem.

 

Navigate to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Wow6432Node\Telestream\Soa

 

Add a new String Value named ‘UseExternalTransportProcess’ and set the value data to ‘false’

 

Restart the Vantage Transport Service

 

Thanks,

 

Mike

 

 ;;;
column453:
10/Jan/22 8:57 PM;tang002;Following Telestream's solution (provided by Mike McCoy), a key UseExternalTransportProcess is added to HKEY_LOCAL_MACHINE\Software\Wow6432Node\Telestream\Soa
This resolves the workflow issue.;;;

Line Music gets conversion 22097 and is fine, but these were sent in January.  Did something change between January and now that would make these videos no longer OK?

Similarly MTS gets 22098 and they received these fine back in December - what changed?

column448:
21/Jul/21 6:20 PM;gule001;Pulling analysis from DPSO-79850:

We looked into why AOMA is sending 298000 for the clipEndMsec (past end of video).

Looks like this value originates from CT 2063 "FFMpeg Descriptor - Vegas Format (xml)"

This CT is slated to be deprecated (see MCSE-145) and replaced with the Media Info CT 2600 "Generic (MediaInfo) - Descriptor (xml)" or Vantage CT 4101 "Analysis CSV"

[^CT2600_MVD_000014665858_001.xml]

[^CT2063_MVD_000014665858_001.xml]

[^CT4101_MVD_000014665858_001.csv]

 

*Bad Value:*

CT 2063 "FFMpeg Descriptor - Vegas Format (xml)":
{code:xml}
  <void property="averageDataRate">
   <long>208715</long>
  </void>
  <void property="duration">
   <double>298000.0</double>
  </void>
  <void property="fieldOrder">
   <string>progressive</string>
  </void>
{code}
 

*Good Values:*

CT 2600 "Generic (MediaInfo) - Descriptor (xml)":
{code:xml}
<FileSize>7774594508</FileSize>
<Duration>297.998</Duration>
<OverallBitRate_Mode>VBR</OverallBitRate_Mode>
{code}
CT 4101 "Vantage Analysis CSV" :
|titleTextBox|textBox2|textBox1|
|Variable Report|SME_Content_Duration_Seconds|297|
|Variable Report|SME_Content_Duration_Milliseconds|2,979,977|
|Variable Report|SME_Content_Duration_Timecode_Milliseconds|00:04:57:21@29,97|

Without this switch, or some other alternate solution, these videos currently cannot be delivered to partners. ;;;
column449:
21/Jul/21 6:22 PM;gule001;Looking to see why clip points used to be good but now are not good.  

If I am lucky enough to find it in our history tables. ;;;
column451: 21/Jul/21 6:35 PM;gule001;Oops - not sure how I misread that - it is 22097 that is failing.  Give me a few more minutes to look into it. ;;;
column452:
21/Jul/21 6:47 PM;gule001;For ISRC INS171703135 the only successful delivery with CT 22097 was to Line Music Video, which happened yesterday. It could be that the registration was recently corrected in AOMA.
{code:sql}
select conversion_asset_id, request_id, dspid, date_inserted
from eomextracts.requests_v 
where  
	isrc = 'INS171703135' and 
	conversion_type_id = 22097 and 
	status_level_nm = 'COMPLETE'
{code}
||conversion_asset_id||request_id||dspid||date_inserted||
|177616195|177559779|LIV|7/20/2021  6:03:38 AM|

Looking at potential request parameter list differences between failed versus successful conversion requests. ;;;
column453:

{code:sql}

select parameter_value 
from conversion_archive.parameters 
where conversion_id in (
	select conversion_id 
	from conversion_archive.conversions c 
	where c.conversion_asset_id = 177616195
) and 
(
	parameter_value like ('StandardTranscoderClipStartSeconds%') or
 	parameter_value like ('StandardTranscoderClipEndSeconds%')
)
{code}
 |parameter_value|
|StandardTranscoderClipStartSeconds=21.76|
|StandardTranscoderClipEndSeconds=104.4|
{code:sql}
-- Bad request ID 174172159 - ca: 174228575  (Saaven Video : SAB)

select parameter_value 
from conversion_archive.parameters 
where conversion_id in (
	select conversion_id 
	from conversion_archive.conversions c 
	where c.conversion_asset_id = 174228575
) and 
(
	parameter_value like ('StandardTranscoderClipStartSeconds%') or
 	parameter_value like ('StandardTranscoderClipEndSeconds%')
)
{code}
|parameter_value|
|StandardTranscoderClipStartSeconds=21.4|
|StandardTranscoderClipEndSeconds=283.4|;;;

25/Oct/21 7:29 PM;mpadsal;[~FERN009]  [~SAMA030]  [~bsahoo1]

It looks like when AOMA jumped from 2.9.0 to 2.14.0/1  following code is changed and causing the issue 

 !screenshot-1.png|thumbnail! 

In order to fix this issue MC team need coordinated debug session of AOMA code which is responsible to create package 

Package has "customCropSettings": null, which is causing this issue.  Need to know which data should be used or how AOMA or MC can pick up default data for Vantage conversions.

 !image-2021-10-25-13-38-23-090.png|thumbnail! 


;;;

column448:
08/Nov/21 9:49 PM;tang002;*From:* Tang, Charlie, Itopia <charlie.tang.itopia@sonymusic.com> 
 *Sent:* Monday, November 8, 2021 3:28 PM
 *To:* Bob Barnshaw <bobb@telestream.net>; David Rosprim <davidr@telestream.net>; Daniel Elven <daniele@telestream.net>; Reinstatler, Vanessa, Arvato Systems North America <vanessa.reinstatler@arvatosystems.com>
 *Cc:* Padsalgikar, Mandar, Sony Music <Mandar.Padsalgikar@sonymusic.com>; Media Conversion Developers <media.conversion.developers@sonymusic.com>
 *Subject:* RE: Cloud flip start to fail

 

++ Vanessa

 

Hi Vanessa,

Can you also check if there is any firewall change or infrastructure change regarding the TLS/SSL for this server: gtsmewve07805.server.arvato-systems.de?

This morning we suddenly can’t reach Telestream’s cloud service from Vantage software.

 

Thanks!

Charlie

 

 

*From:* Tang, Charlie, Itopia 
 *Sent:* Monday, November 8, 2021 3:21 PM
 *To:* Bob Barnshaw <[bobb@telestream.net|mailto:bobb@telestream.net]>; David Rosprim <[davidr@telestream.net|mailto:davidr@telestream.net]>; Daniel Elven <[daniele@telestream.net|mailto:daniele@telestream.net]>
 *Cc:* Padsalgikar, Mandar, Sony Music <[Mandar.Padsalgikar@sonymusic.com|mailto:Mandar.Padsalgikar@sonymusic.com]>; Media Conversion Developers <[media.conversion.developers@sonymusic.com|mailto:media.conversion.developers@sonymusic.com]>
 *Subject:* Cloud flip start to fail

 

Hi Telestream,

 

We received a production alert today regarding our cloud flip workflow. It appears that the cloud flip in Flip64 action started to fail today morning at 9 AM EST.


 Error message: An error occurred calling FinishUpload : Error calling FinishUpload: The request was aborted: Could not create SSL/TLS secure channel.

  !image-2021-11-08-15-48-42-945.png!

When I log in to the Telestream cloud dashboard, a warning message says TLS1.0/TLS1.1 is no longer supported. However, everything was fine until today, and the first error started at 9:44 AM EST from our side.

*Is this error related to the depreciation of TLS1.0/TLS1.1?*

  !image-2021-11-08-15-48-48-601.png!

Here are some security protocol related settings from our vantage server, please let us know if we need to change anything to resolve this error.

  !image-2021-11-08-15-48-56-786.png!

!image-2021-11-08-15-49-07-109.png!;;;
column449: 08/Nov/21 9:50 PM;tang002;Cloud flip started to fail today morning. Nothing changed from media conversion side. I've raised questions to Telestream and Arvato to check if there's any change from vendor side. ;;;

09/Nov/21 2:26 AM;tang002; 

*From:* Tang, Charlie, Itopia <charlie.tang.itopia@sonymusic.com> 
 *Sent:* Monday, November 8, 2021 8:25 PM
 *To:* Mike McCoy <mikem@telestream.net>; Padsalgikar, Mandar, Sony Music <Mandar.Padsalgikar@sonymusic.com>; Bob Barnshaw <bobb@telestream.net>; David Rosprim <davidr@telestream.net>; Daniel Elven <daniele@telestream.net>; Reinstatler, Vanessa, Arvato Systems North America <vanessa.reinstatler@arvatosystems.com>

 *Subject:* RE: Cloud flip start to fail

 

Hi Mike,

 

I set the TLS 1.2 Enabled value to 1, then restarted the service from both Windows Services and Vantage console. The error is still there when I’m trying to restart the job. So It looks like the registry value isn’t the key factor here. Again, everything was working fine until this morning. Our records indicate that the last successful cloud flip conversion was today at 06:32 AM EST. Is the cutover for TLS 1.2 today from the Telestream side? And is there any method to check the connectivity from the server to cloud-flip’s service endpoint?

 

Thanks!

Charlie

  !image-2021-11-08-20-26-27-338.png!

!image-2021-11-08-20-26-38-749.png!

 *To:* Padsalgikar, Mandar, Sony Music <[Mandar.Padsalgikar@sonymusic.com|mailto:Mandar.Padsalgikar@sonymusic.com]>; Tang, Charlie, Itopia <[charlie.tang.itopia@sonymusic.com|mailto:charlie.tang.itopia@sonymusic.com]>; Bob Barnshaw <[bobb@telestream.net|mailto:bobb@telestream.net]>; David Rosprim <[davidr@telestream.net|mailto:davidr@telestream.net]>; Daniel Elven <[daniele@telestream.net|mailto:daniele@telestream.net]>; Reinstatler, Vanessa, Arvato Systems North America <[vanessa.reinstatler@arvatosystems.com|mailto:vanessa.reinstatler@arvatosystems.com]>

Thanks,

 *To:* Mike McCoy <[mikem@telestream.net|mailto:mikem@telestream.net]>; Tang, Charlie, Itopia <[charlie.tang.itopia@sonymusic.com|mailto:charlie.tang.itopia@sonymusic.com]>; Bob Barnshaw <[bobb@telestream.net|mailto:bobb@telestream.net]>; David Rosprim <[davidr@telestream.net|mailto:davidr@telestream.net]>; Daniel Elven <[daniele@telestream.net|mailto:daniele@telestream.net]>; Reinstatler, Vanessa, Arvato Systems North America <[vanessa.reinstatler@arvatosystems.com|mailto:vanessa.reinstatler@arvatosystems.com]>

 *Subject:* [External Sender] RE: Cloud flip start to fail
 *Importance:* High

 

Hi Mike,

 

Do you want us to change setting on Windows level or there any setting on Vantage App level and force vantage flip action to use TLS 1.2 version?

 

I will prefer option 2; Setting on Vantage App level and force vantage flip action to use TLS 1.2 version over Windows level setting

 

Please enlighten us if such setting exist.

 

Windows OS Level Setting.

  !image-2021-11-08-20-26-54-827.png!

 

Regards,

Mandar

 

 

*From:* Mike McCoy <[mikem@telestream.net|mailto:mikem@telestream.net]> 
 *Sent:* Monday, November 8, 2021 6:08 PM
 *To:* Tang, Charlie, Itopia <[charlie.tang.itopia@sonymusic.com|mailto:charlie.tang.itopia@sonymusic.com]>; Bob Barnshaw <[bobb@telestream.net|mailto:bobb@telestream.net]>; David Rosprim <[davidr@telestream.net|mailto:davidr@telestream.net]>; Daniel Elven <[daniele@telestream.net|mailto:daniele@telestream.net]>; Reinstatler, Vanessa, Arvato Systems North America <[vanessa.reinstatler@arvatosystems.com|mailto:vanessa.reinstatler@arvatosystems.com]>
 *Cc:* Padsalgikar, Mandar, Sony Music <[Mandar.Padsalgikar@sonymusic.com|mailto:Mandar.Padsalgikar@sonymusic.com]>; Media Conversion Developers <[media.conversion.developers@sonymusic.com|mailto:media.conversion.developers@sonymusic.com]>; Catandella, Michael, Sony Music <[michael.catandella@sonymusic.com|mailto:michael.catandella@sonymusic.com]>; O'Connell, Colleen, Sony Music <[Colleen.OConnell@sonymusic.com|mailto:Colleen.OConnell@sonymusic.com]>; Nancy Schwartz <[nschwartz@telestream.net|mailto:nschwartz@telestream.net]>; Bill Fosbenner <[billf@telestream.net|mailto:billf@telestream.net]>; Reuben Cohn <[reubenc@telestream.net|mailto:reubenc@telestream.net]>; Ryan Iorns <[ryani@telestream.net|mailto:ryani@telestream.net]>
 *Subject:* RE: Cloud flip start to fail

 

*EXTERNAL SENDER*

Charlie,

  The value of the TLS 1.2 registry setting looks suspect. I believe supported values for the “Enabled” key are 0 (disabled) and 1 (enabled). In this case the TLS 1.2 Client key should have the Enabled value data set to 1.

 

Thanks,

 

Mike

 

 

Mike McCoy | Principal Support Engineer | US 877-257-6245 | International 530-470-2036

 *Subject:* RE: Cloud flip start to fail

 

Hi Mike,

 

Thank you for providing the diagnostic tool!

 

I don’t think it’s the TLS version issue because, in both Prod and Dev servers, we have changed the TLS registry value to what was suggested by Telestream and restarted both services and server. And still the following retry of the failed job wasn’t successful.

 

However, I’ve run the diagnostic utility in our Dev environment and collected the output.

Please find the attached txt file. And let me know if you need anything else from my side.

 

Thanks!

Charlie

 *Subject:* RE: Cloud flip start to fail

 

*EXTERNAL SENDER*

Charlie,

  I’m following up regarding the diagnostic utility that I mentioned. The following Aspera link contains the utility. It is a small executable that will report back available TLS protocol and related info in a cmd window. Running the utility now would give us a compare point in the event the problem ever returned in the future.

 

To use it, you would:

 
 # Copy the zip to the machine where the Vantage Cloud Service is running
 # Extract the zip file (this will create a folder named:     Test_TLS_Connection
 # Go into this folder and double-click on the ConsoleApp15.exe   program

 

After clicking on the .exe program, you will see a CMD window popup and information will be dumped into the window. Copy the data returned to a txt file. Please send me a copy and also store for possible comparison in the future.

 *Cc:* Media Conversion Developers <[media.conversion.developers@sonymusic.com|mailto:media.conversion.developers@sonymusic.com]>; O'Connell, Colleen, Sony Music <[Colleen.OConnell@sonymusic.com|mailto:Colleen.OConnell@sonymusic.com]>; Chinn, Jonathan, Sony Music <[jonathan.chinn@sonymusic.com|mailto:jonathan.chinn@sonymusic.com]>; Encizo, Jeanine, Sony Music <[jeanine.encizo@sonymusic.com|mailto:jeanine.encizo@sonymusic.com]>; Alcock, Tim, Sony Music <[tim.alcock@sonymusic.com|mailto:tim.alcock@sonymusic.com]>; Catandella, Michael, Sony Music <[michael.catandella@sonymusic.com|mailto:michael.catandella@sonymusic.com]>; David Rosprim <[davidr@telestream.net|mailto:davidr@telestream.net]>; Daniel Elven <[daniele@telestream.net|mailto:daniele@telestream.net]>; Nancy Schwartz <[nschwartz@telestream.net|mailto:nschwartz@telestream.net]>; Spagnoli, Matthew, A&H Infotech <[matthew.spagnoli.ahi@sonymusic.com|mailto:matthew.spagnoli.ahi@sonymusic.com]>; Bill Fosbenner <[billf@telestream.net|mailto:billf@telestream.net]>; Reuben Cohn <[reubenc@telestream.net|mailto:reubenc@telestream.net]>; Ryan Iorns <[ryani@telestream.net|mailto:ryani@telestream.net]>; Reinstatler, Vanessa, Arvato Systems North America <[vanessa.reinstatler@arvatosystems.com|mailto:vanessa.reinstatler@arvatosystems.com]>; Padsalgikar, Mandar, Sony Music <[Mandar.Padsalgikar@sonymusic.com|mailto:Mandar.Padsalgikar@sonymusic.com]>; Raj, Rohit, Sony Music <[Rohit.Raj@sonymusic.com|mailto:Rohit.Raj@sonymusic.com]>; Sahoo, Brajesh, Infotech Limited <[brajesh.sahoo.infotechlimited@sonymusic.com|mailto:brajesh.sahoo.infotechlimited@sonymusic.com]>
 *Subject:* RE: Cloud flip start to fail

 

Hi Charlie,

  Great news the system is up and running again. I’m not aware of any changes on our end. Engineering created a utility to help diagnose the problem which would have been the next step in troubleshooting. I’m going to familiarize myself with the utility now. This may be worth running on your operational system as well to collect more info. I will follow after I explore the utility.

 

Thanks,

 

Mike

 

 

Mike McCoy | Principal Support Engineer | US 877-257-6245 | International 530-470-2036

 

*From:* Tang, Charlie, Itopia <[charlie.tang.itopia@sonymusic.com|mailto:charlie.tang.itopia@sonymusic.com]> 
 *Sent:* Wednesday, November 10, 2021 7:30 AM
 *To:* Mike McCoy <[mikem@telestream.net|mailto:mikem@telestream.net]>; Bob Barnshaw <[bobb@telestream.net|mailto:bobb@telestream.net]>

 *Subject:* [Outside Sender] RE: Cloud flip start to fail

 

Hi Mike,

 

Did anything change from your engineering team? Can you provide us with the root cause analysis? 

There’s nothing changed from Sony Music side, and this morning cloud-flip started working.

 

Thanks for your time!

Charlie

 ;;;

column1: AOMA Advisory: Delayed registrations, preview generation, quick converts, converted exports due to a Media Conversion system outage
column30:
Hi AOMA User,

Please be advised that due to an outage of Media Conversion system, you will experience delays with AOMA registrations, preview generation, converted export, quick convert and any other processes that involve asset conversion.

Media Conversion team is aggressively working to bring the system back online. There is no ETA as yet.

We will keep you up to date.

Sorry for the inconvenience.

Your sincerely,

Core AOMA Team

column1: Please investigate Pseudo Video Failures and resubmit if possible (victor.campanile@sonymusic.com)
column30:
Hello, Asset Support Team

Can you please assist with the list of registration failures for Pseudo Videos as reported by Victor Campanile?

 

In the attached spreadsheet, all the pseudo video registration failures displayed a similar error message/reason for failure (see below)

Victor's message follows, and below that is the reason for failure of the example Job ID 192365 for Master ID 000020945303:

Victor Writes:

"Hi.  I recently created a large batch of Bob Dylan pseudos, but ~ 40 failed, and then failed again when I tried to re-create them.  Can you help me make these pseudos?  I made a spreadsheet that contains the pseudo video Product ID, the audio ISRC that is the basis for the pseudo video and the album Product ID that has that audio and cover image that should be used."

---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Description of Registration failure:


RegistrationTask Completion Check Failed: Conversion requests failed. [AssetRegistrationJob:1924179, RegistrationTask: 673079]. column448:
01/Aug/21 6:42 PM;roraj01;Hi Ted,

It may not be as relevant but just to ensure the source cover asset (master [000007505741|https://aoma.smcdp-de.net/servlet/com.sonymusic.aoma.AOMADispatcherServlet?chain=MasterSearchDetailDisplayAction&masterID=7505741]) is okay from asset standpoint, I tried quick converting it to jpeg and png format (the request went through Arvato instance of MC) and received the output in both jpeg and png format.

So seems like an issue with processing Pseudo Videos.. Shreyas can coordinate with Brajesh to get any info he needs to investigate further.

Thanks,

Rohit 

 

 ;;;
column449:
02/Aug/21 3:42 PM;bsahoo1;No [~GULE001], Videos are still getting registered via jar.

[~KAMT001], I have copied the requested files to your My AOMA Files > migration.;;;
column450:
05/Aug/21 5:50 PM;kamt001;Hi Team,

 

[~bsahoo1] provided me with the assets used in the above conversion. I tried locally the conversion for the above error.

Request Id : 217704263

The conversion fails when ImageMagick tries to create the resized-image from the provided TIFF file. The next step of the conversion fails as the application is not able to find the resized-image.png. The is probably because the TIFF file is multi-layered and hence ImageMagick creates a different png file for each layer image. Hence I can see multiple images being created after the intermedia conversion step.

 

!image-2021-08-05-21-17-26-033.png|width=483,height=133!

Please let me know if we can assign this to Jackie in the GMP team to take a look into this. Also attached the tiff file used.

 

Thanks and Regards,

Shreyas Kamthe;;;
column451: 05/Aug/21 8:25 PM;mcatande;It's a layered image file. We need to swap it.  ;;;
column452: 05/Aug/21 8:28 PM;mcatande;see linked WPTS ticket for progress on the swap.  After swap we recommend re-attempting the pseudo creation. ;;;
column453: 05/Aug/21 8:37 PM;cabe004;The cover has been flattened and hot swapped in AOMA. Should be good to go.;;;
column454: 05/Aug/21 9:03 PM;vcampan;All of these failed pseudos come from three albums...Dylan (1973), Biograph & The Bootleg Series Volumes 1-3 (Rare And Unreleased) 1961-1991.  Which cover did Jackie just fix?;;;
column455: 05/Aug/21 9:13 PM;vcampan;Looks like Dylan (1973) is the answer to me question from 3:03...I'll try to make those five again.;;;
column457:
05/Aug/21 10:18 PM;mcatande;Dylan 1973 was the answer to your question... this ticket was really clear on which other assets were problematic.  

Can you provide Product IDs for the other Audio products with cover which is failing the pseudo video process? ;;;
column458: 05/Aug/21 10:33 PM;mcatande;Never mind I see: G010000912071T & G010000670163G ;;;
column459: 05/Aug/21 11:00 PM;vcampan;Hi Mike.  There's an attachment "Failed Dylan Pseudos" on this ticket.  That has all the products that failed and also includes the source info...the album, track and cover art that was used for each.  You can forget about the first five...the ones that come from Dylan (1973)...I was able to make those after Jackie fixed the cover.  Of the remaining videos, one is from Biograph and the rest are from The Bootleg Series, Vol. 1-3;;;
column460: 05/Aug/21 11:02 PM;vcampan;I'm happy to make the remaining videos myself, as I did with the five from Dylan (1973).  Just let me know when the issue that's making them fail is resolved.  Any chance the rest were also failing because of bad cover art?  ;;;
column461: 06/Aug/21 4:29 PM;cabe004;Of those two product numbers you advise to check Mike, one of the image wasn't flattened. That has been fixed.;;;
column462: 06/Aug/21 4:34 PM;mcatande;[~CABE004] Which one?  Any reason you think the other one would be failing with a similar error? ;;;
column463:
06/Aug/21 4:50 PM;cabe004;G010000912071T was fixed, the ticket is attached.

G010000670163G there's nothing wrong with it, it's currently at 1500px by 1500px. I don't think that's a reason for failing.;;;
column464: 06/Aug/21 7:19 PM;vcampan;All the pseudos associated with The Bootleg Series Volumes 1-3 (Rare And Unreleased) 1961-1991 (G010000912071T) are going through now.  We're down to a single product now...the one on my spreadsheet that's coming from the album Biograph (G010000670163G).;;;
column465: 06/Aug/21 9:12 PM;vcampan;OK, I just tried the one remaining product (I wanted to add the error message to this ticket), but it went through.  We're done.  Thanks everyone..  -VC;;;

column448:
19/May/21 1:41 AM;kamt001;Hi [~bsahoo1],

 

The issue is with the end parameter passed which is 265.232. And the total duration of the file is 265.231633. Hence the end seconds clipping point is out of the bounds of the total file duration. That is why Media Conversion application is throwing this error. Please correct the end seconds parameter to be passed as 265.231 which will result in successful conversion.

Please refer DPSA-26038

 

Thanks and Regards,

Shreyas Kamthe;;;
column449:
19/May/21 3:00 PM;bsahoo1;Thanks [~KAMT001].

Please suggest user per Shreyas's input.

Thanks.;;;

Many thanks,

Keith;;;

column447:
12/May/21 7:10 PM;kamt001;Hi [~bsahoo1],

 

The end seconds parameter passed in this case is 256.76. The start seconds is 2.88. The total file duration is 256.56. The clip end seconds is going beyond the total duration of the file. Hence the application has a validation and throwing an error for the same. 

 

Thanks and Regards,

Shreyas Kamthe;;;

column446:
21/Apr/21 3:50 PM;redd001;Hi All,

looking into it.

 

Regards,

Ajay Akiti;;;
column447:
21/Apr/21 5:10 PM;kamt001;Hi Team,

 

I got the source asset and did some analysis. It seems like the file is not an actual wav file. Following is the media info of the file : -

!image-2021-04-21-11-04-50-239.png|width=592,height=398!

The actual info for a WAV file should be like below : -

!image-2021-04-21-11-06-00-723.png|width=579,height=291!

The format of the file should be a WAV file whereas it is MPEG Audio for the original file.

Media Conversion uses Java's AudioSystem package for removing the headers from the Wav files. As the format of the file is incorrect the error message is been thrown as "File of unsupported format"

 

Thanks and Regards,

Shreyas Kamthe;;;

21/Apr/21 5:23 PM;bsahoo1;Thanks [~KAMT001] for the update.

column1: Please provide a report of prores assets with specific dimensions
column30:

column1: MFC Conversion Profile 4100 not working
column30:
Hi Team,

I'm trying to perform VidChecker PSE / Harding tests using the MFC in AOMA. 

I tried using the conversion profile CT 4100. 

I've tried two conversions and the results are one empty folder and one folder with only a Unix Executable file (CT4100_NOG842102020null) in it. I've attached a screenshot of the folder with the null file in it. 

Is it possible to look into the MFC conversion in AOMA? It doesn't seem to be working at all. 

That would be great. 

Thanks in advance for your help! 

Cristen
column444:
18/Feb/21 3:12 PM;kmccar1;Hi team,

Could you please take a look?

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column445:
18/Feb/21 3:56 PM;bsahoo1;[~READ008], [~kmccar1],

Found a bug in the code for getting this null file extension. Created a fix ticket and linked it here.

For now workaround would be :

download the file to local machine from My AOMA Files > offerings and change the extension from *null* to *pdf*

Thanks.;;;
column446:
18/Feb/21 4:11 PM;read008;Hi Brajesh, 

Thanks, changing the extension to .pdf seems to work, which is great. 

However, my other conversion just has an empty folder. I've attached a screenshot to this ticket. Any idea why that one would be empty? 

Thanks! 

Cristen 

;;;
column448:
18/Feb/21 6:09 PM;read008;Hi Brajesh, 

It was from a file in my Migration folder. 

Filename: GB1102100070.mov

Do you have access to that? Or shall I send it somewhere else? 

Cristen 



;;;

Cristen
