column450:
12/Feb/21 6:03 PM;gule001;All conversions are showing completed on our side for request id 214978286.  Please confirm you have the correct request id. 

{code:sql}
select
    regexp_replace(po.parameter_value , 's3://[^/]*/[^/]*/[^/]*/([^/]*)/.*','\1') dsrv_package_id,
    r.request_id,
    r.request_cd,
    ca.conversion_asset_id,
    ca.conversion_type_id,
    sl.status_level_nm, 
    ctl.conversion_type_descr,
    pi.parameter_value input_file,
    po.parameter_value output_file,
    m.metadata_value isrc,
    ca.date_inserted
from
    conversion_archive.conversion_assets ca
    left join conversion_archive.conversions ci on ci.conversion_asset_id = ca.conversion_asset_id
    left join conversion_archive.conversions co on co.conversion_asset_id = ca.conversion_asset_id
    join conversion_archive.parameters pi on pi.conversion_id = ci.conversion_id and pi.parameter_type_id = 1 and
    (
        pi.parameter_value like ('s3://%') or
        pi.parameter_value like ('s3://%') or 
        lower(pi.parameter_value) like ('https://%')  or 
        lower(pi.parameter_value) like ('http://%') or 
        pi.parameter_value like ('/%') or
        pi.parameter_value like ('\\%')
    )
    join conversion_archive.parameters po on po.conversion_id = co.conversion_id and po.parameter_type_id = 2 and
    (
        po.parameter_value like ('s3://%') or
        po.parameter_value like ('s3://%') or 
        po.parameter_value like ('/%') or
        po.parameter_value like ('\\%')
    )
    join conversion_type_list ctl on ctl.conversion_type_id = ca.conversion_type_id
    join conversion_archive.requests r on r.request_id = ca.request_id
    join status_levels sl on ca.status_level_id = sl.status_level_id
    join conversion_archive.metadata m on ca.conversion_asset_id = m.conversion_asset_id and m.metadata_label_id = 4  
where
    ca.request_id = 214978286 --and
	--ca.conversion_asset_id = 168777520 and 
    --ca.conversion_asset_id in (select max(conversion_asset_id) from conversion_archive.conversion_assets) and
    --regexp_replace(po.parameter_value , 's3://[^/]*/[^/]*/[^/]*/([^/]*)/.*','\1') = '4390363' --and 
    --ca.date_inserted > '2021-02-12 00:00:00'
group by 
    regexp_replace(po.parameter_value , 's3://[^/]*/[^/]*/[^/]*/([^/]*)/.*','\1'),
    r.request_id,
    r.request_cd,
    ca.conversion_asset_id,

db time is 6 hours behind from server time.

The times MC might have touched this file:
{code:sql}
select * from (
	select c.conversion_asset_id, c.conversion_id, pi.parameter_value pi, po.parameter_value po, c.date_inserted
	from conversion_archive.conversions c 
		join conversion_archive.parameters po on po.conversion_id = c.conversion_id and po.parameter_type_id = 2 
		join conversion_archive.parameters pi on pi.conversion_id = c.conversion_id and pi.parameter_type_id = 1  
	--where 
	--c.conversion_Asset_id = 252029840 
)  a
where po = '/SDA/aoma-ifs-nas-prod-int-01/prod-aoma/master/audio_wav/0004/WAV_000015838665_16BIT/000015838665_16BIT_001_005.wav'
order by conversion_id
{code}
|conversion_asset_id|conversion_id|pi|po|date_inserted|
|251829052|913686391|/SDA/aoma-ifs-nas-prod-int-01/prod-aoma/master/audio_wav/0004/WAV_000015838665_16BIT/000015838665_16BIT_001_005.wav|/SDA/aoma-ifs-nas-prod-int-01/prod-aoma/master/audio_wav/0004/WAV_000015838665_16BIT/000015838665_16BIT_001_005.wav|2021-01-20 10:54:47|

File was uploaded to AOMA at 4:12pm, and according to the unix stat command, it was not modified after it was uploads, and MC did not touch this file (read from it) until 4:54pm.  

As far as we can tell, this 40 byte issue, does not stem from media conversion. ;;;
column460:

column448:
16/Feb/21 9:31 PM;pcharle;Hi Shreyas, 

 

No request id is available, as the error message is that an exception was encountered while creating the conversion request. 

 

Per the error messages noted in the description of this ticket... 

G010004550179L
Exception while creating conversion request for packageId=209648737. System unable to find asset source. [deliveryOfferId=2284922226, conversionTypeId=10270, mediaType=MEDIA_TYPE_COVER, masterId=16093706, reason=Asset Lookup failed for request: MasterRequest(20098761,10477295,G010004550179L,MEDIA_TYPE_COVER,4,Some(16093706),37193481,0,None,false)].

G0100045501624
Exception while creating conversion request for packageId=209645052. System unable to find asset source. [deliveryOfferId=2284903719, conversionTypeId=2037, mediaType=MEDIA_TYPE_COVER, masterId=16093705, reason=Asset Lookup failed for request: MasterRequest(20098337,10477321,G0100045501624,MEDIA_TYPE_COVER,1,Some(16093705),37193476,0,None,false)].

 

... which describe that the system couldn't find the asset source. 

 

AOMA Delivery - Are you able to find information based on these error messages that can be used between your team and the Media Conversion team to diagnose the issue?

 

Please advise.

 

Thanks,

Phil C.;;;

column447:
08/Jan/21 6:08 PM;kamt001;Hi [~REDD001],

I got the input files and tried the conversion on my local machine. The issue seems to be with the image that is a multi layered. 

Because of this Image Magick is creating multiple images and appending -0, -1 ... -n to the generated images and hence the application is not able to find the actual image.

!image-2021-01-08-12-06-11-595.png|width=566,height=143!

I found following links that give us idea about the issue.

[https://stackoverflow.com/questions/14556984/imagemagick-creating-multiple-files]
[https://stackoverflow.com/questions/16179838/imagemagick-convert-tiff-warnings-multiple-output-files-created]

For the conversion to be successful the image should be single layered.

 

Thanks and Regards,

Shreyas Kamthe;;;

Can you provide me the mov file that is being used in this conversion ?

aoma-ifs-nas-wip-prod-int-01.smcdp-de.net\prod-aoma\master\video\0016\MVD_000016033528_FILE_DGTL\MVD_000016033528_001.mov

 ;;;
column448:
22/Jan/21 8:08 PM;kamt001;Hi [~SPAG001],

 

The issue is with the parameter that is being passed in the request. Below is the command that was run to generate the target file.

 

c:\Program Files\ffmpeg-20170312-58f0bbc-win64-static\bin\ffmpeg.exe -i MVD_000016033528_001.mov -vframes 1 -q:v 0 -vf yadif,crop=(iw-0-0):(ih-0-0):0:0,scale=1920:1080,setsar=1/1 *-ss 252.2* -t 1.0 -metadata title=Neujahrsgruß / New Year's Address / Allocution du Nouvel An -metadata author=Wiener Philharmoniker, Riccardo Muti, Riccardo Muti & Wiener Philharmoniker temp0.jpg

If you look in the command there is a start seconds (ss) which is being passed as 252 seconds. But the total length of the file is 229 seconds (3 mins and 49 seonds). So either the whole file is not uploaded correctly or else the input parameter to get the VIC image from the video is being passed wrong.

I tried the above conversion with -ss 200 and it worked fine for me.

 

Thanks and Regards,

Shreyas Kamthe;;;
column449:
22/Jan/21 9:00 PM;spag001;Thanks Shreyas.

Hi all,

Looks like the wrong timecode is being used for this video as the timecode is longer then the video's length. Updating the timecode to the appropriate value will allow the registration to go through. (Current timecode - 252199 milliseconds  => 4.20 minutes)



Thanks
Matthew;;;

column450:
11/Oct/20 2:11 PM;gule001;Issue has 2 root causes.
 # Divide by zero error being thrown by Vantage MPEG-2 workflow 
\\ \\
RCA provided in this ticket by Matthew Woo:  WPTS-259378 - Vantage - CT12193 - Export Jobs Stuck in "Packaging In Process"
\\ \\
Same conclusion drawn by analysis here:  WPTS-259385 - Vantage - DEV - CT12192 and CT12193 failure errors
\\ \\
They both point to a product defect with Vantage 8 update pack 2, we have upgraded Vantage to update pack 3 and "touching" the Constuct action tile in the workflow designer. 
\\ \\
 # Export should not just get stuck, it should properly fail.  AOMA need to pull a more recent MC jar file for this fix (targeted for 10/26 AOMA release). The fix was rolled out as a part of ACS-1438 - Vantage conversions are failing in production with "Export Stuck". ;;;

column446:
06/Oct/20 5:53 PM;gule001;Sharada, Shreyas and myself looked at this issue extensively this morning. 

Shreyas will be creating a unit test to reproduce this locally. 

There  were 121 successful conversions of this type completed since 4/28 but 9 recently failed. 

{code:sql}
select count(*), sl.status_level_nm , 
min(ca.date_inserted), max(ca.date_inserted) 
from conversion_archive.conversions c
join conversion_archive.conversion_assets ca on ca.conversion_asset_id = c.conversion_asset_id
join status_levels sl on sl.status_level_id = ca.status_level_id
where c.conversion_type_id = 12 
group by sl.status_level_nm
{code}

It seems to indicate an issue with this conversion working properly with this specific asset. 

To rule out the issue being a transient one, can you please retry the conversion. 

Until Shreyas completes the unit test, there is no further analysis that can be provided.  ;;;

column1: Live conversion type #2085 has errors on output
column30:
CT# 2085 is outputting the wrong sizes/ using the wrong size type table. Please check code changes and remit error.  CT#2084 is same but adds a matte to standard size, 2085 remans clean cropped.  CT#2084 does not show any error.

example: file returns 720x478 .. it should be 640x478
column445:
31/Jul/20 7:48 PM;sdonipu;Hi [~bsahoo1],

Looking into this. Will get back.

Thanks,
Sharada;;;
column446:
03/Aug/20 5:57 PM;sdonipu;Hi [~rhayloc],

This is a known problem with 2085 (inclusive of 22085/32085) and 2084 (inclusive of 22084/32084) because these 2 conversion profiles are the first set of FFMPeg CT batch which are currently using the old scaling logic. We have not updated them to the revised scaling logic as there was a decision pending from GMP side which of the below option(s) to go forward with:

1. Upgrade these 2 profiles to the newer version of computing output dimensions like others.
2. Replace them with the 3006 YT profile. If I remember correctly, we discussed in one of our conversion meetings, using 3006 instead of 2085 for bucketing logic.

Please advise and confirm how to proceed. We will have these 2 profiles fixed based on your feedback and suggestion.

Thanks,
Sharada;;;
column447:
03/Aug/20 7:06 PM;rhayloc;Hi Sharada,

Yes, I recall some of the history here.. I thought that while we did not high prioritize the fixes to preserve 2085/ 2084, they were approved to get fixed at some point.. That is my recollection from a conversion meeting long ago.  3006 already replaces these for YT, but we did not retire these because there is no other CTs that do exactly that these do- preserve 2k, 4k at either matted sizes or clean cropped in-place.  So we wanted to keep these, just wasn't priority to fix since neither are assigned to partner.

I did not see any issue with 2084 when I compared and I see this ticket that seems to show where things left off- 2084 was checked but 2085 never got followed up on:  https://jira.smedigitalapps.com/jira/browse/ACS-1061    I also see other tickets opened to update ffmpeg ver related to 2085... So yes, please proceed with updating any ffmpeg CTs that are in need so they all using the approved, up to date logics and tables (option 1 above).  Thank you.

 ;;;
column448:
03/Aug/20 7:54 PM;sdonipu;Hi Rick, 

Thanks for confirming. We will add an ACS story in our backlog and prioritize the fixes for 2085/2084.  I will let you know once both the conversion profiles are ready for testing and review in STAGE.

Thanks,
Sharada;;;
column449:
20/Oct/20 5:20 PM;sdonipu;Hi [~rhayloc],

FFMpeg CTs 2084 and 2085 along with its shelf (22084/22085) and non-shelf (32084/32085) counterparts are now set up with revised scaling logic in all of the STAGE environments. Please test it and let us know if the MP4 outputs look as expected or not. Thank you for your help with the review.

Regards,
Sharada;;;
column450: 20/Oct/20 7:58 PM;sdonipu;Please hold off on the testing. Found some issue. Looking into it. ;;;
column451: 22/Oct/20 3:35 PM;sdonipu;[~rhayloc] - Please resume testing and let us know how it goes. ;;;
column452:
27/Oct/20 7:51 PM;sdonipu;Hi [~rhayloc]  - 

Attached the size profile used for CT2084 and CT2085 for your review as discussed.  If you see any issues with the size table please provide corrections, we will fix the size tables on our end. Please let me know if you need a size table for any other approved FFMpeg Conversions for comparison or reference. 

Thanks,
Sharada;;;
column453:
21/Feb/22 4:15 PM;rhayloc;Low Priority action item- clone 2097 allowing all size types (2k, 4k supported) and replace 2085. Update in Dev first.

Please let GMP know when this is ready for testing. Thanks.;;;
column454: 23/Feb/22 8:24 PM;sdonipu;Understood [~rhayloc]. I will put this as a story in our ACS backlog and link it here. Sure as soon as it is done, I will let you know. ;;;
column455: 24/Mar/22 7:21 PM;sdonipu;Hi [~WOOM001] - Assigning to you as discussed with Rick in the 2:00 pm meeting today. Please run tests in DEV and let us know. ACS-2408 changes are made in DEV MC.;;;
column456: 06/May/22 3:00 PM;mpadsal;Assigned to Rick as per 5/5 2 PM ;;;
column457: 06/Oct/22 7:10 PM;mpadsal;[~rhayloc]  From your old comment I found that you want to clone CT 2097.  Just curious to know why can't you use CT 2097 itself.  How new CT is going to be different from CT 2097.;;;
column458:
07/Oct/22 12:10 AM;rhayloc;Mandar, the CTs are not the same- 2097 is scaled down to HD size, so any 2K or 4K is scaled. 2085 is native, so it supports all sizes. The only aspect we were copying is the crop and scale logic. It should work the same but with different target output sizes.

Thanks.;;;
column460: 28/Oct/22 5:29 PM;rhayloc;(attached full PDFs too.. Using Acrobat you can do a text compare easily.);;;
column461: 03/Nov/22 5:39 PM;mpadsal;Please get this Change Request in MCSE.  Lets have breakout session for story writing.  ;;;
column462: 29/Nov/22 1:38 AM;rhayloc;[~sdonipu] and team, please promote the Dev code for this to Stage. After some testing I think it is working ok.;;;

column465:
08/Dec/22 8:05 PM;park007;ACS-2845 is created and linked to this DPSA. 

[~rhayloc], I noticed that CT 2085 in AOMA DEV and Delivery DEV have slight difference. 
Can you confirm which is the correct one we need promote and sync in all AOMA/Delivery DEV/STAGE environments?

AOMA DEV CT 2085: https://mcapi-dev.smecloudops.com/api/conversion/metadata/2085
Delivery DEV CT 2085: https://mcapi-del-dev.smecloudops.com/api/conversion/metadata/2085

column1: Display Error PKGX: 19439758982
column30:
On 9/3/20 9:57 AM, Gersting, Mike David, Sony Music Germany (Extern) wrote:

Hi Support-Team,

 

I hope you are all well?

I do have an issue with the preview function in AOMA.

As you may know we do check Artwork before we are forwarding it to the plant for manufacturing.

The following number is causing issues I do not have a plan how to avoid it. 19439758982

 

As you can see, the overview page is showing all artwork as a thumbnail.

You can see that some of them got text like the lower left thumbnail of the onsert:

If I do klick on document I can only see this:

You might know a solution for this as it might have something to do with the set-up of the PDF and the overprint function.

I have tested that with different browser versions like IE, Firefox and Chrome.

 

Thanks for looking into that and letting me know what the issue is.

 

Thanks in advance

 

Mike
column444:
03/Sep/20 11:37 AM;burg036;Hi team,

Can you please check on this display issue. Mike is on a PC and we check from our end on a Mac with Chrome Version 84.0.4147.135 (Official Build) (64-bit) and Firefox 78.0.2. On the PC the text is missing and the image is up-side-down. On a Mac the image is missing the text but right-side-up. See attached screenshots and the actual PDF.

 

Thanks,

Fiona ;;;
column445:
14/Sep/20 10:42 PM;spag001;Hi all,

Not seeing the upside down issue, but the document preview is having the text blank for me as well. Default image and image(link) is fine, and I have checked actual assets and the image there is correct as well, so seems to just be the document preview is messed up. I will run some tests and get back to you on the cause.

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column446:
02/Oct/20 6:06 AM;spag001;Hi all,

Was running some tests on this in stage env and could reproduce with the file. It looks like the issue lies with the ghostscript command used for the copy conversion which creates the preview specifically used for this previews generation. Thanks Shreyas for the huge help in looking into this!

Hi Media Conversion team,

Can you analyze the attached ghostscript command to see what could be causing the text being cleared out in the previews? (I have attached the command, along with the json for the conversion request) Here is the information associated with the stage job I reproduced the issue with.


dbid=2322767
US_REGISTRATION_PACKAGE_GRAPHIC_372810
File With the Issue - 
/SDA/aoma-ifs-nas-stage-int-01/stage-aoma/proxy/pkgf/0001/GFX_000005075410/PREVIEW_000005075410_ON_PS_01_01_01_001002.pdf

Thanks
Matthew;;;
column447:
02/Oct/20 5:48 PM;kamt001;HI Team,

 

I got the source file from [~SPAG001] and tried the conversion on my local machine. The output file was generated but it did not have the text that was present in the source asset. Also I got some error logs in the console.

column450:
06/Oct/20 7:50 PM;kamt001;Hi [~WOOM001],

 

The issue seems to be with one of the steps in the workflow. For One of the jobs I checked, I got this error message in the Vantage server :-

 

!image-2020-10-06-13-35-24-159.png|width=526,height=256!

 

Thanks and Regards,

Shreyas Kamthe;;;
column451:
11/Oct/20 2:12 PM;gule001;Issue has 2 root causes.
 # Divide by zero error being thrown by Vantage MPEG-2 workflow 
\\ \\
RCA provided in this ticket by Matthew Woo:  WPTS-259378 - Vantage - CT12193 - Export Jobs Stuck in "Packaging In Process"
\\ \\
Same conclusion drawn by analysis here:  WPTS-259385 - Vantage - DEV - CT12192 and CT12193 failure errors
\\ \\
They both point to a product defect with Vantage 8 update pack 2, we have upgraded Vantage to update pack 3 and "touching" the Constuct action tile in the workflow designer. 
\\ \\
 # Export should not just get stuck, it should properly fail.  AOMA need to pull a more recent MC jar file for this fix (targeted for 10/26 AOMA release). The fix was rolled out as a part of ACS-1438 - Vantage conversions are failing in production with "Export Stuck". ;;;

column453:
28/Oct/20 10:37 PM;kamt001;Hi [~eyam], [~kmccar1]

I checked the logs for this conversion. The error is thrown while generating the .mov file using the conversion type 2067. But the issue most probably lies in the conversion done to convert the .trk file to .wav file. During this conversion, there are two parameters being passed as :-

00:00:00:00

00:00:01:10

These variants decide the start of the silence wav to be appended to the wav file. I changed the parameters a little bit from 00:00:01:10 to 00:00:01:11 and 00:00:01:09 and in both the cases the conversion was successful generating the final .mov file. 

My best guess is that because of this particular time duration, the framerate gets distorted while padding the given input source.

Is this something that can be changed from your side ?

 

Thanks and Regards,

Shreyas Kamthe;;;

Please advise asap

 *Subject:* RE: Russia Watermarking files

 

Hi all,

I spoke to Jamie.

 

If any of the below CTs are copy conversions, they will deliver flac file via digital supply chain feed (since delivery stores audio sources in flac format). However, when used on AOMA MFC tool, the same copy conversion will output Wav as the source is a wav.

 

Ted, Shreyas

If you can let me know what each of these CTs are, I can suggest which CT Jamie should be using via MFC tool. E.g. for all copy conversions, Jamie should use CT 30016 in MFC which will output flac file

 
 # iTunes (ITN)  // CT 11023
 # Spotify (SPO) // CT 11023
 # UMA (UMA) // CT 20122
 # Amazon Music (AM3) // CT 11023
 # Deezer (DZR) // CT 11023
 # YouTube Music (YTC) // CT 11023
 # Yandex (YAN) // CT 21023
 # Tidal (ASP) // CT 21023
 # TikTok (TIK) // CT 21023

Happy to jump on a call.

 

Thanks,

Rohit;;;

21023 : Conversion SHELF Full Length - Flac, 16Bit, Interleave Stereo, Linear PCM

11023 : File Copy (16Bit Audio FLAC)

20122 : Conversion Shelf Full Length - MP3, 320kbps, 44.1KHz, Stereo, CBR, 1 Pass

Thanks and Regards,

Shreyas Kamthe;;;

column469: 08/Oct/20 5:11 PM;gule001;Matthew, this is the same as other issues we have shown you with MPEG (SD) workflow.(divide by zero error). ;;;
column470:
11/Oct/20 2:06 PM;gule001;Issue has 2 root causes.
 # Divide by zero error being thrown by Vantage MPEG-2 workflow 
\\ \\
RCA provided in this ticket by Matthew Woo:  WPTS-259378 - Vantage - CT12193 - Export Jobs Stuck in "Packaging In Process"
\\ \\
Same conclusion drawn by analysis here:  WPTS-259385 - Vantage - DEV - CT12192 and CT12193 failure errors
\\ \\
They both point to a product defect with Vantage 8 update pack 2, we have upgraded Vantage to update pack 3 and "touching" the Constuct action tile in the workflow designer. 
\\ \\
 # Export should not just get stuck, it should properly fail.  AOMA need to pull a more recent MC jar file for this fix (targeted for 10/26 AOMA release). The fix was rolled out as a part of ACS-1438 - Vantage conversions are failing in production with "Export Stuck". ;;;

column463:
07/Aug/20 3:32 PM;gule001;[~bsahoo1] - Media Conversion team worked with [~SAMA030] to get to the bottom of this issue and had to put 2 fixes in. 

# Vantage wrapper fix to pass 0s for clip start and end point to Vantage workflows when full video extract is requested. 
# Workflow fix to make sure two simultaneously requested extracts of the same video do not result in 2 vantage jobs stepping on each other by using the same temp filename. 

Both fixes need to be promoted to production, but we are waiting for a green light from AOMA testers that it's a go. 

Thanks, 
Ted;;;

29/Oct/20 1:12 AM;kamt001;Hey Matt,

 

I tried the conversion on my local machine using the ffmpeg tool directly. That is, without Media Conversion. Still I am getting the cracking sound in the background that you mentioned. Also I tried using a newer version of ffmpeg and still the sound exists.

The sound most probably exists in the source asset also, but because of the high quality of source and a different format (.mov), the sound may not be that clear in the source asset. Media Conversion is using the following command for CT3006 :-

 

ffmpeg.exe -i <input_file.mov> -pix_fmt yuv420p -c:v libx264 -b:v 40M -profile:v high422 -level 5.2 -ar 48000 -ab 384k -vf yadif=0:-1:1,crop=(iw-0-0):(ih-0-0):0:0,scale=1920:1080,setsar=1/1 <output_file.MP4>

column459:
02/Nov/20 4:34 PM;mcatande;We can attempt to replace the audio with a master in AOMA if this is how the rep owner wants to proceed.  We suspect the distortion could be a result of the audio being near peak. The conversion to aac in the encoding process could be what's leading to the click/distortion sounds.  

Please advise if this audio is available in AOMA.  Provided there is no difference in the edit, we should be able to do this.  ;;;
column460:

thanks!
Penny

column448:
11/Oct/20 2:11 PM;gule001;Issue has 2 root causes.
 # Divide by zero error being thrown by Vantage MPEG-2 workflow 
\\ \\
RCA provided in this ticket by Matthew Woo:  WPTS-259378 - Vantage - CT12193 - Export Jobs Stuck in "Packaging In Process"
\\ \\
Same conclusion drawn by analysis here:  WPTS-259385 - Vantage - DEV - CT12192 and CT12193 failure errors
\\ \\
They both point to a product defect with Vantage 8 update pack 2, we have upgraded Vantage to update pack 3 and "touching" the Constuct action tile in the workflow designer. 
\\ \\
 # Export should not just get stuck, it should properly fail.  AOMA need to pull a more recent MC jar file for this fix (targeted for 10/26 AOMA release). The fix was rolled out as a part of ACS-1438 - Vantage conversions are failing in production with "Export Stuck". ;;;

column1: Video Batch request not finding conversion list
column30:
When attempting a batch request I got the following error message:

Unable to find entry in conversiontypelist matching typeListID=32001
column444:
23/Jun/20 2:47 PM;kmccar1;Hi Suha,

Could you please attach your XLS sheet and selections that were made on the UI to this ticket?

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column445: 23/Jun/20 2:56 PM;sgur001;Attached spreadsheet.  I'm looking to output program only CT2098 files.;;;
column446: 23/Jun/20 2:59 PM;kmccar1;Thanks Suha, we'll take a look. ;;;
column447:
23/Jun/20 3:14 PM;kmccar1;Hi team,

This error appears upon selecting the "Conversion Type Id : " option, after the UI reloads. Please see attached screenshot. 

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column448:
23/Jun/20 4:14 PM;spag001;Hi all,

Looking into this.

Thanks
Matthew;;;
column449:
23/Jun/20 6:12 PM;spag001;Hi conversion team,

Can you check this out. Logs suggest an issue grabbing value from a conversion db:


2020-06-23 08:18:06,979 ERROR [com.sonymusic.media.conversion.dao.ConversionTypeListDAO] (default task-16) getConv
ersionTypeList: Unexpected SQLException getting type list for id=32001: java.sql.SQLException: Unable to find entry in conversiontypelist matching typeListID=32001
 at com.sonymusic.media.conversion.dao.ConversionTypeListDAO.getConversionTypeList(ConversinTypeListDAO.java:49) 
at com.sonymusic.media.conversion.dao.ConversionTypeListDAO.getAllConversionTypeListsByMediaTypes(ConversionTypeListDAO.java:149)at com.sonymusic.aoma.offering.video.actions.VideoBatchRequestAction.getAllConversionTypeListsByMediaTypes
(VideoBatchRequestAction.java:711)

Thanks
Matthew;;;
column450:
23/Jun/20 6:38 PM;kamt001;Hi Team,

I checked the database for the details of CT32001. The record is present in the Conversion_type_list table. But the metadata details are not present for this conversion_type in the metadata table. The query that tries to get the information of the CT also tries to look in the metadata table and is not getting anything. Hence the exception is being thrown.

I will put in the required details in the metadata table for this conversion type.

Thanks and Regards,

Shreyas Kamthe;;;
column451: 23/Jun/20 7:16 PM;sdonipu;linked ACS-1191 to this ticket. ACS-1191 is a user story for CT32001 set up. ;;;
column452:
24/Jun/20 9:06 PM;kamt001;Hi [~SPAG001], [~kmccar1],

 

[~MISH008] has inserted the required data in the required table.

Can you please try the batch request again and let us know if the issue is resolved ?

 

Thanks and Regards,

Shreyas Kamthe;;;
column453:
25/Jun/20 7:11 PM;kamt001;Hey Matt,

The DB Changes have been completed by the DB Developer. 

Can you ask the user to check if the Conversion Type is available ?

 

Thanks and Regards,

Shreyas Kamthe;;;
column454:
25/Jun/20 7:31 PM;spag001;Hi Suha,



Can you try again now.

Thanks
Matthew;;;
column455: 25/Jun/20 7:35 PM;sgur001;Hi Matthew, I just submitted a batch request and it went through normally.  Thanks for your help! Closing ticket.;;;

column451:
27/May/20 11:26 PM;kamt001;Hi Team,

The conversions were not failed at the Media Conversion side. The conversions were shown as they were still in the queue or sent to some WIP. But after that there was no trace of the further process of the conversion. Also the logs of the WIPs where these conversions were sent had not trace of the Asset_Id tagged to these conversions. 

I coordinated with Kundan to reset the requests and they have gone through successfully this time. 

 

Thanks and Regards,

Shreyas Kamthe;;;

column447:
07/Jul/20 1:23 AM;kamt001;Hi,

I tried one of the conversions from the list using CT11079 in the Prod Environment using the MFC tool. I was able to do the conversion successfully but the file that I got downloaded was a corrupt and somewhat related to DPSA-25092 and DPSA-25095. 

Also I tried the CT11079 conversion using a different file and the conversion was successful. Also the file was not corrrupt in this case.

For the above conversions I checked the Rhozet logs and the logs say that the conversion was successful as in there were not errors in the logs.

 

Thanks and Regards,

Shreyas Kamthe;;;
column448:
23/Jul/20 9:42 PM;sama030;Hi Keith,

Could you please inform the user that CT11079 was using an old software that was causing many issues during its end of life. A new CT (CT12192) is in progress to be rolled out in 1 week that should resolve any issues.

 

In the meantime, the user can use the source export (Full clip rather than program only) or reach out to GMP if the program only is needed prior to next week.

 

Thanks,

Ralph;;;
column449:
23/Jul/20 10:34 PM;kmccar1;Thanks [~SAMA030].

Hi [~KESH003],

Apologies for the delay on this one - please see [~SAMA030] Ralph's comments above. Please let us know if you need anything in the meantime. 

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column450: 30/Jul/20 6:10 PM;gule001;For the record, the RCA on this is there is a historical product defect with the Rhozet platform which periodically due to unknown causes makes Rhozet unstable.  While we don't have a long term fix, or a further RCA on it, the short term fix is to restart the Rhozet servers.  As Rhozet is going to be turned off within the month, we will not be investigating this further. ;;;

column1: SFV Subtitle Master List Request
column30:
Requesting a report of *all* registered short form video *subtitle* masters, on a file-level basis:

Label

Maintenance Owner

Product Number

Artist

Title

File Name

Master ID

Language of Subtitle file

Subtitle Type (ex. Full, Forced, SDH)

Lyrics Indicator

File Format (.itt, .srt, etc)

Date of Registration

User name of the registration

 

Please let me know if you have any questions. Thanks
column444:
02/Sep/25 11:19 PM;poth003;Hi [~chin023],

I have attached the data you requested to the Jira. Please check it and let me know if you have any questions.

Thanks,

Phani;;;
column445: 03/Sep/25 5:18 PM;chin023;Thank you! Starting at line 614, there are a number of assets that appear to be longform product related, however there is missing data in columns A-E. They also don't look quite right - For example, the language is in the fie name, yet the "Language of Subtitle file" column (L) has different, likely incorrect, languages. We will review on our end, but just flagging here.;;;
column446:
03/Sep/25 8:51 PM;woom001;Hi [~poth003]

can you please add to the report search:

Maintenance Owner
the user name of the registration
the "subtitle type" (full, forced, sdh)
the "lyrics" indicator (yes/no) 

can you also make the columns sortable?

thanks.;;;
column447:
03/Sep/25 9:01 PM;woom001;note, lines 614 down are master only tracks, looks to be from UAT testing in PROD and not an issue.

the blank language cells for some masters looks to be a bug from DPSA-31318 due to UST hot-swap deleting the incoming language in the db.;;;
column448:
03/Sep/25 10:49 PM;poth003;Hi [~woom001],

I have attached an updated report with the new columns you requested. Please check it and let me know if you have any questions.

Thanks,

Phani;;;
column449: 10/Sep/25 8:12 PM;chin023;[~woom001] All good to close this out?;;;

column1: track count mismatch
column30: Track count does not match between Label copy for product number, 5119842 and it's previously linked master, 51198420200
column444:
21/Sep/09 12:11 PM;stomek;Hello,
Can you assign an ISRC to the video (track # 21) on this product?
There is an ISRC and a  timing discrepancy between 5119842 and 51198420200
Thanks!
Sarah;;;
column445:
22/Sep/09 3:25 AM;lue38;Hello Luis; Hello Sarah,

The Enhanced Track 2000000866171/01 "Institutional Video" have Third Party as repertoire owner. We need no ISRC for Third Party tracks.

The product 51198420200 is linked as local number on the product 5119842. France and the Netherlands use the number 51198420200. Both products/track listings are indentically.   

Maybe Luis can check the master for the product 5119842. If the master 51198420200 makes trouble then France or the Netherlands should send a master or check there track listing.  

Best regards
Michael

 ;;;

column1: MBC: Missing Batch 2517 and Batch No. 2519 in Ci and on Export Status UI
column30:
*Subject:* RE: Issue with Media Batch Converter

Hi Fiona,

 

I’d like to highlight another issue we’re facing with MBC downloads. After the recent update to my account and others (as requested earlier) to enable downloading of pre-release and post-release content, we initiated a couple of new batches to download certain files.

 

While the folders are being successfully created on Sony Ci, the videos themselves are not appearing even after waiting for more than half a day. Can you please look into this and check what might still be restricting the downloads?

 

Attaching a screenshot of Ci for reference:

 

 

 

Sharing the details below of the batched:

 

 ** 

*Batch 2517* :
|*Sr.No.*|*Project #*|*Project Title*|*Product #*|*Title*|*Digital Suppl. Title*|*Suppl. Title*|

|5|1521248|Shubh Mangal Saavdhan|G010005077476I|Rocket Saiyyan|From "Shubh Mangal Saavdhan"|Full Song|

 

 

*Batch No. 2519:*

|1|1521098|Badlapur|G010005078260Y|Badlapur Mashup| |Full Song|

column445:
10/Sep/25 2:16 PM;burg036;Hi team,

Manuela has noted that this is an existing issue. Reference: DPSA-30670  "MBC batch export issue when one product has an unapproved master (QC notes entered but not locked): Batch export fails, does not show up in A3 Export UI, empty Sony Ci folder created"

column1: Sub-task AOMA Link Issue
AOMA Link Issue
column30: When clicking AOMA links from Jira tickets AOMA is opening the last page opened instead of the direct url link you clicked.
column444:
12/Aug/25 6:20 PM;kmccar1;Hi there [~enci005],

Could you please send me over an example or two? These are WPTS tickets? 

Mac and Safari browser?

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column445:
12/Aug/25 7:55 PM;enci005;Hi [~kmccar1] ,

Yes I am using a Mac and Firefox. Others have experienced the same issue. If you have logged out a of AOMA and click a UST link in a Jira ticket it will open UST with the most recent product information you had opened instead of opening to the product UST url you click on. I can try and do a screen record to show you, if that helps?;;;
column446:
12/Aug/25 8:13 PM;kmccar1;Hi team,

I was able to recreate this once, but didn't manage to record. I think it has more to do with AOMA going back to the same UI / page that was open at the time of log-out. For example, I'll leave the Registration Job Status UI as my AOMA "open tab," and close down the browser for the day. When I restart my browser and login the next day, Registration Job Status will load instead of the home page. I imagine something similar is happening here. 

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column450: 19/Aug/25 4:10 PM;kori002;Hello [~enci005]  and [~mcatande]  The fix is in stage. Please let me know if you have can see the fix in stage;;;
column451: 27/Aug/25 3:15 AM;kori002;hello [~enci005] The fix is in AOMA prod. Let us know if you have any question and close the ticket if it looks good.;;;

column1: AOMA Maintenance: Core Release 2.113.0 Build scheduled for Tuesday, August 26th from 8:00pm to 10:30pm EST
column30:
Hello AOMA Users, 

AOMA will be down on Tuesday, August 26th from from 8:00pm to 10:30pm EST, due to system maintenance and testing for new features. AOMA services will be non-functional and unavailable during this time. 

We appreciate your patience and understanding. 

Regards, 
Core AOMA team

column450:
29/Aug/25 7:01 PM;zeki001;Hi [~prag008], 

Over the last two days, all imports were successful for the mentioned products. 
There was one unsuccessful attempt from VRXX00583B00Z, but it succeeded 30 minutes later. 

!image-2025-08-29-19-01-15-702.png|width=1032,height=543!

 
{code:java}
select lia.labelcopy_import_attempt_id, lia.catalog_ky, lis.labelcopy_import_status_nm , ldt.labelcopy_document_type_nm, lia.attempt_initiation_dt, lia.aoma_load_complete_dt 
from metadata_publisher.labelcopy_import_attempts lia , metadata_publisher.labelcopy_import_statuses lis , metadata_publisher.labelcopy_document_types ldt 
where lia.attempt_initiation_dt > '2025-08-28 00:00:00.000'
and lia.labelcopy_import_status_id = lis.labelcopy_import_status_id 
and lia.labelcopy_document_type_id = ldt.labelcopy_document_type_id 
and lia.catalog_ky in 
(
'SICX10025B00Z', 'EJXX00235B00Z', 'SEXX03051B00Z', 'BVXX02032B00Z', 'SMXX00778B00Z', 'SMXX00777B00Z', 'ANXX01360B00Z', 'SEXX03053B00Z', 'SMXX00779B00Z', 'VRXX00584B00Z', 'VRXX00583B00Z'
)
order by lia.labelcopy_import_attempt_id desc {code}
Thanks,
Alem;;;
column451:
29/Aug/25 8:31 PM;prag008;Hi [~zeki001] ,

As discussed, the issue is not related to the product import itself, but rather to specific import attempts linked to registration. These attempts are currently in a "Waiting for RAAS" status, which is causing the registration process to stall. We will coordinate with the relevant team to review and update the status of these imports to either "Success" or "Failure" accordingly.

!image-2025-08-29-14-31-01-351.png|width=905,height=393!

Thanks,

Ganesh;;;

column1: Pseudo Video Submissions w Upload Image Failing
column30:
Identifier: G010005641393K
Source: G010005596588S 1, 26

column1: Error registering product Pink Floyd at Pompeii - MCMLXXII   PN  19802937839
column30:
There is an issue registering the Ultra HD Blu-ray files. This package has 3 additional files compared to a normal Blu-ray package that Direct upload will not allow to be loaded:

    PACL2.DAT
    UHDBD.CMF
    UHDBD.SHA

Can you advise if these files can be registered in the back-end or if there is a larger system issue that prevents these additional files from getting registered?

If needed, the Blu-ray files are here: [https://sonymusic-cmg.cimediacloud.com/r/5hxBYDEWHkLd]

---------------------------------------------

({_}Original Issue{_})

We are having an issue creating the master for this blueray registration Pink Floyd at Pompeii - MCMLXXII   PN  19802937839

The metadata has been imported correctly but when making master via direct upload or master creation no tracks or components are imported/created. 

We get the following error 

"error: MasterRetrievalException thrown while retrieving master data: Blu-ray Disc Master cannot be created as product component # 1 with configuration Ultra HD Blu-ray Video Longplay does not support this master type. "

Registration ticket WPTS-451782

Would you be able to take a look at this an see what the issue is. 

Thanks

column1: A3 linking and link editing  for Atmos returning incorrect results
column30:
Aoma support email:

 

"Re: AOMA LINKING ATMOS - G010005643316E    196873573328    Francesca Michielin    Cani Sciolti"

 

When performing "fetch masters" via A3 product linking / link edit for the Atmos master associated to {color:#000000}G010005643316E{color} the system is returning many results that do not have the correct ISRC . 

In this instance the user did not check the default result and the wrong track ended up being linked. I have since gone in and edited to be correct however, the linking interface seems to not be working correctly. 

Could you please advise the issue and whether it can be fixed?

Screenshot shows all results returned for track 3 on G010005643316E, the second result on the list should be the only one that the system returns as valid.

Carrie

column445:
29/Aug/25 5:32 PM;lemo022;Ok here is the problem, the master it is trying to link to has been populated with lots of duplicate ISRCs (screenshot attached)
This master 23406523 is an old master that was once associated to G010005643316E. The link was broken and the tracks were pulled, and re-registered in a different order to reflect a label copy change. This master should have been purged at the time. I still can't see why the same ISRC would be duplicated across all the tracks though.;;;

column1: HOTFIX BUILD: Transaction Manager Build - SMEJ Import Issue Fix 9/4 10AM (NO DOWNTIME)
column30:
Dear Users,

Please be advised that the Transaction Manager system will be performing a hotfix build today 9/4 at 10AM EDT to fix an issue noticed tracked in DPSO-92155 with SMEJ asset imports going to AOMA.

There will be no downtime experienced for this hotfix, and should be a seamless production push. This notice is to inform the group of the change in case any issues are experienced and for tracking purposes. Please see the linked ticket for more information on this change.

Thank you,
Metadata Import Team
Sony Music - US, Metadata Import Support <metadata.import.support@sonymusic.com>

column1: UST Cover and WAV Registration Error "Failed to upload..." via TusD - G010005557477M: cover, G010005586594X: WAV
column30:
Hi team,

Apologies if there is already a ticket for this specific TusD issue. We've had two users encounter this Failed to Upload error. We can confirm we encountered the same error when we tried from our side in Prod. In both instances, we were able to register without error via Aspera.

Note, we also tried to replicate in Stage: TusD worked correctly for the WAV but failed with the same error on the cover. The files are attached in the ZIP.

column1: Cover preview issue on Details UI: VVXX01873B00Z SRXX05391B00Z ESXX03097B00Z
column30:
Hi team,

The newly registered cover master previews are not updating on the Product/Master Details UI for the following products: VVXX01873B00Z, SRXX05391B00Z, ESXX03097B00Z. We tried to regenerate several times without luck.

VVXX01873B00Z
|[27419506|https://aoma.smcdp-de.net/master/27419506]|[VVXX01873B00Z|https://aoma.smcdp-de.net/product/VVXX01873B00Z?masterId=27419506]| |[2732100|https://aoma.smcdp-de.net/asset-upload-job-status?jobId=2732100]|Cover|resize_VVXX01873B00Z_B_A_1_000.jpg
 |Registration Successful|baba002|Japan|09/02/2025 05:58:00|09/02/2025 05:59:10
Duration: 00:01:10| |

!image-2025-09-02-14-01-37-659.png!

 

SRXX05391B00Z
|[27418622|https://aoma.smcdp-de.net/master/27418622]|[SRXX05391B00Z|https://aoma.smcdp-de.net/product/SRXX05391B00Z?masterId=27418622]| |[2731956|https://aoma.smcdp-de.net/asset-upload-job-status?jobId=2731956]|Cover|SRXX05391B00Z_B_A_1_000.jpg

!image-2025-09-02-14-03-15-356.png!

 

ESXX03097B00Z
|[27419492|https://aoma.smcdp-de.net/master/27419492]|[ESXX03097B00Z|https://aoma.smcdp-de.net/product/ESXX03097B00Z?masterId=27419492]| |[2732097|https://aoma.smcdp-de.net/asset-upload-job-status?jobId=2732097]|Cover|resize_ESXX03097B00Z_B_A_1_000.jpg

Duration: 00:00:54| |

!image-2025-09-02-14-04-44-439.png!

Thanks,

Fiona
column444:
02/Sep/25 2:11 PM;burg036;FYI, there was also an issue with these two Japan KSCL03619B00Z & KSXX02794B00Z products, which we resolved by re-registering. In this case, the users used the UST Asset Swap option. The system completed the registration of the new cover master but the preview on the Details UI did not update and instead retained the old cover master image. 

We removed the old cover master and then linked the new cover (registered master only) AOMA3/Linked via Full Master.;;;
column445:
02/Sep/25 3:07 PM;burg036;UST shows each stuck at 'Preview generation is in progress'.

!image-2025-09-02-15-06-11-628.png!

!image-2025-09-02-15-04-45-167.png!

!image-2025-09-02-15-04-38-283.png!;;;
column446:
02/Sep/25 4:06 PM;kuma011;Hi [~kori002],

Could you please take a look on this?

Regards,
Kiran.;;;
column447:
02/Sep/25 4:27 PM;kori002;Hi 
Checking this out.;;;
column448:
02/Sep/25 6:16 PM;kuma011;Hi [~burg036],

Since the file names contain "_B", the MLIB is interpreting them as Back Covers and is not generating previews. As the Back Cover concept is no longer applicable, we’ll raise a ticket to have their code updated accordingly.

In the meantime, could you please rename the files to remove the "_B" segment and resubmit them? A simple rename and swap should work.

For example:
SRXX05391B00Z_B_A_1_000.jpg → SRXX05391B00Z_A_1_000.jpg
resize_ESXX03097B00Z_B_A_1_000.jpg → resize_ESXX03097B00Z_A_1_000.jpg
resize_VVXX01873B00Z_B_A_1_000.jpg → resize_VVXX01873B00Z_A_1_000.jpg

Let me know once the files have been updated, or if you still face any issues.

Regards,
Kiran.;;;
column450: 03/Sep/25 10:21 AM;burg036;Thank you. Users notified.;;;

Thanks;;;

column1: SFV Master - No options via A3 Export (SME 5020 / US Latin)
column30:
Hi there team,

There's nothing available to select under "Export Assets" via AOMA3 Export for this master only (ID: 26977210) video. Could you please take a look? We downloaded the source via the inline button and shared via Ci in the meantime. 

[https://aoma.smcdp-de.net/aoma-ui/master/26977210/information/tracks]

!image-2025-07-21-16-58-48-557.png!

Thanks,

Keith
column444: 21/Jul/25 11:33 PM;venu001;Checking this;;;
column445:
24/Jul/25 7:26 AM;venu001;Legacy registered (DU/SU) masters are not allowing certain entries in DB tables to be created and populated; we pull information from these tables to display assets in the A3 Export modal.

Fix ticket linked to address this situation;;;
column446:
02/Sep/25 5:22 PM;kmccar1;Looks great now, thanks [~venu001] !

Keith;;;

column1: G010005593684A Tracks stuck as AssetRegistrationInProgress
column30:
Hi all, hope you're well :) 

I am trying to register a 16bit album but Track 3, 8, 12 and 14 have been stuck as AssetRegistrationInProgress for more than one hour... would you be able to help register these tracks? 

Many thanks!
deb
column244:
AOMA Support
Hours: Monday-Friday, 3:30 am-8:00 pm EST
Emergency After-Hours Support: Send an email to aoma.support@sonymusic.com with the JIRA ticket number and a brief description.
column444:

Thanks,

Keith;;;

Thanks

column456:
08/Jul/25 7:52 PM;spag001;Hi all,

So this is actually a two-parter. The initial issue was due to a issue we are fixing in the linked ticket. There is a rare race condition with the downconvert logic on fresh uploads when jobs finish at the exact millisecond (shared db resource causing the issue).

The reason the status didn't change was actually a bug in the failure logic that I will be working on a fix for asap. Sorry for the inconvenience and let me know if you have any questions.

Thanks

Matthew ;;;

Keith;;;
column458:
02/Sep/25 8:14 PM;spag001;Hi all,

The last part of the bug fix for this was released so closing this one out.

Thanks

Matthew;;;

column1: UST / TusD - Re-uploading previously uploaded file
column30:
Hi there team,

We came across this issue with [~tier012] and [~norm007] during the week. It seems that if one uploads a file under one product number via UST / TusD, and then navigates to another product and tries to upload the same file, the upload stalls out ("Asset Upload In Progress" / "Uploading Asset to AMP S3"). Or, if a user registers an audio master, unlinks (say, for a metadata import update) and tries to register the same files, the upload stalls out. 

To recreate: 

Register an asset via TusD / UST (seems to occur with both audio and cover assets - check STAGE Registration Job Status for multiple examples from this afternoon 8/15/2025 kmccar1)
||Master #
 
 
 
 ||Product #
 
 
 
 ||UST||Job #
 
 
 
 ||Job Type
 
 
 
 ||Original File Name||Status/Description
 
 
 
 ||Username
 
 
 
 ||Security Groups
 
 
 
 ||Reg. Start Date
 
 
 
 ||Reg. End Date
 
 
 
 || ||
|[5718130|https://aoma-stage.smcdp-de.net/master/5718130]|[G010000669925R|https://aoma-stage.smcdp-de.net/product/G010000669925R?masterId=5718130]| |[408261|https://aoma-stage.smcdp-de.net/asset-upload-job-status?jobId=408261]|Cover|BlizzardOfOzz_G010004450291D_Cover_F.jpg
 |Registration Successful|kmccar1|Epic|08/15/2025 15:47:06|08/15/2025 15:47:32
Duration: 00:00:26| |

Remove the asset, either by unlinking, unregistering, or Asset Swap

!image-2025-08-15-15-52-22-814.png!

Re-submit the same asset

Notifications tab will open, instantaneously display the previously displayed file(s) as "Complete," upload status on the UI is "Pending" and status via Registration Job Status is "Asset Upload In Progress" / "Uploading Asset to AMP S3." 

!image-2025-08-15-15-53-08-835.png!
|[5718130|https://aoma-stage.smcdp-de.net/master/5718130]|[G010000669925R|https://aoma-stage.smcdp-de.net/product/G010000669925R?masterId=5718130]| |[408262|https://aoma-stage.smcdp-de.net/asset-upload-job-status?jobId=408262]|Cover| |Asset Upload In Progress|kmccar1|Epic|08/15/2025 15:52:51|-| |
|[5718130|https://aoma-stage.smcdp-de.net/master/5718130]|[G010000669925R|https://aoma-stage.smcdp-de.net/product/G010000669925R?masterId=5718130]| |[408261|https://aoma-stage.smcdp-de.net/asset-upload-job-status?jobId=408261]|Cover| |Purged|kmccar1|Epic|08/15/2025 15:47:06|08/15/2025 15:47:32
Duration: 00:00:26| |

Users will experience this issue and send the assets to Support to check. As we are submitting for the first time from our end, the TusD upload(s) and registration job(s) will complete without issue. Similarly, users will also pass on the files to someone else in their department to try uploading - the job will complete successfully as it was their first upload attempt with those assets. A run through PROD Registration Job status ("Asset Upload In Progress" status) will display a good amount of these, which we had chalked up to user side connection issues for quite some time. Seems like it is something system related. Could you please check this out next week, team? 

Please let me know if you need any further information.

Thanks,

Keith
column445: 18/Aug/25 6:09 PM;hale002;This ticket is being fixed and pushed in the Aug build.;;;
column447: 26/Aug/25 1:00 PM;tier012;[~hale002]  when is this next build? Because this is a daily occurrence now - causing a bit of havoc having to workshop this round the teams to see who can upload without this error... ;;;

column1: Aoma display issue G010004877386W master ID 22293994 DDP master is has a diffrent ISRC for 2 tracks but no mismatch shown in aoma.
column30:
Hi Aoma Team

For DDP product G010004877386W master ID 22293994  

The aoma display for both the product and master info pages shows the ISRC for tracks 3 and 4 as USQX92203777 and USQX92203778

But the ISRCs embedded in the DDP files are USQX92202263 and USQX92202264 (screenshots below) 

No isrc mismatch is displayed in aoma as the ISRCs on the master info page display differently to the DDP but match the product ID. 

It appears the issue is with the DDP but as the disc description editor functionality has been removed from aoma I'm unable to change the PQ of the DDP in aoma. 

 

Aoma master Info Page 

!image-2025-06-18-15-26-38-350.png|width=1619,height=707!

DDP master 

!image-2025-06-18-15-27-00-514.png!

If urgent, we can add the legacy permission back. Let me know...

Thanks,

Keith;;;

column1: Dolby Atmos conversions for playback failing for files that exceed 4GB
column30:
The defining feature of failed Atmos Aoma player conversions vs successful ones appears to be filesize – the 8 failures from 

_RE: MLIB Dolby Atmos backfill report -  July 14th_

all have a file size greater than 4GB, while successful conversions are 4gb or less.

 

Dolby Atmos ADMBWF transition from RIFF WAV to RF64 when the filesize exceeds 4GB – could this be causing the conversion failures?
column244:
AOMA Support
Hours: Monday-Friday, 3:30 am-8:00 pm EST
Emergency After-Hours Support: Send an email to aoma.support@sonymusic.com with the JIRA ticket number and a brief description.

column445:

I'll test on my end, though it may be a memory issue on the server side.

 

Thanks.

-mac;;;

column452:
31/Jul/25 7:16 PM;mcarpent;OK. I think this is fixed.

Short story is that the python built-in method I used to check for channel counts semi-ironically falls over when it is passed a file of more than 4GB. The largest file I has tested previously was just over 2GB. Replaced the logic with ffprobe.

[~tang002] I've merged my change to master, here:

[https://github.com/SME-AOMA/atmos-downmix/tree/main]

Please have a check!

Thanks.

mac;;;

column1: Linking to a "Released" product warning message for products that have yet to be full published / delivered
column30:
Hi there team,

[~cede001] let me know that when she was committing a virtual master link to products G010005610730J and G0100056107287, the following message was displayed. 

!image-2025-07-24-18-27-00-210.png!

I think this must be popping up because both products have a release date of today, (7/24/2025), so the system is seeing them as "released," even though there are no assets linked or full publish yet. I advised that it was ok to "Commit Link" but we may want to refine the logic a bit here to avoid confusion. 

!image-2025-07-24-18-29-07-027.png!

Please let me know if you need any further information.

 

Thanks, 

Keith
column444: 25/Jul/25 3:38 PM;kori002;Hi there [~kmccar1]  The warning on the linking side is shown based on the GRPS first release date. If the date is in the past but not current or future date then this warning is displayed on the UI.;;;
column445: 02/Sep/25 3:03 AM;kori002;We have now included Full published status also to be considered to show this message in addition to GRPS release date. Ticket is attached and this is now fixed.;;;

column1: A3: System does not allow the Edit VSC function when a video has an empty VSC master
column30:
Hi team,

Please check products G010004952786E,G010004952854M, G0100049952855K. These videos were registered with empty VSC masters. The VSC masters threw errors during registration and the users were then unable to use the Edit VSC function.

"On 11/30/22 2:30 PM, Catandella, Michael, Sony Music wrote:

FYI, I was unable to edit VSC because there was an empty vsc master for G010004952786E master # 000023112752. I have unlinked the empty master from the product and I am now able to edit the VSC from the interface.

AOMA Support, Can you report that AOMA ‘edit VSC’ function should work whether or not that VSC master associated to the product is empty. It should effectively allow a new selection overwriting/swapping with the existing empty master."
column444:
30/Nov/22 4:33 PM;spag001;Hi all,

Looks like the files uploaded here did not match the video dimensions. You should be able to re-register these in UST after clicking X on the icon. Is the issue here that they want to be able to use AOMA3 interface to re-register instead?

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column445:
30/Nov/22 8:50 PM;kmccar1;Hey [~SPAG001] ,

I believe that's the idea - the error message leads the user to believe that they cannot edit the VSC via the AOMA3 details. 

*From:* "Haucke, Florian, Sony Music Germany" [<florian.haucke@sonymusic.com>|mailto:florian.haucke@sonymusic.com]
*Date:* Wednesday, November 30, 2022 at 8:16 AM
*To:* "Catandella, Michael, Sony Music" [ <michael.catandella@sonymusic.com>|mailto:michael.catandella@sonymusic.com], "Alcock, Tim, Sony Music" [ <tim.alcock@sonymusic.com>|mailto:tim.alcock@sonymusic.com], ["aoma.support@sonymusic.com"|mailto:aoma.support@sonymusic.com] [<aoma.support@sonymusic.com>|mailto:aoma.support@sonymusic.com], [ "UKmediaproduction@sonymusic.com"|mailto:UKmediaproduction@sonymusic.com] [ <UKmediaproduction@sonymusic.com>|mailto:UKmediaproduction@sonymusic.com], Global Media Production [ <mediaproduction@sonymusic.com>|mailto:mediaproduction@sonymusic.com], Fiona Burgess [ <fiona.burgess@asburymedia.com>|mailto:fiona.burgess@asburymedia.com]
*Subject:* Re: AOMA VSC ediit / G010004952786E

> The message is clear but we haven`t uploaded any image just tried to edit one via the AOMA VSC edit function.

[~mcatande],

I just went thru the thread - please let me know if I'm misunderstanding? 

Thanks,

Keith

 ;;;
column446:
30/Nov/22 9:22 PM;mcatande;My guess is that the user went through the following process: 
 # attempted to upload a VSC for UST - the VSC failed due to the dimensions not matching properly.
 # Instead of fixing the dimensions and resubmitting via UST, they went to the Product details interface to use the VSC select tool. When this occurred they received the failure due to the empty master from the previous attempt.  

I think we can expect a user to attempt something like this again though it may be an edge case. 

Suggested fix. Allow an empty master to be swapped/replaced via details interface (I think it didn't work in this case because AOMA is bridging two system types UST and traditional arvato). ;;;
column448:
30/Nov/22 10:05 PM;spag001;Hey all,

I think from the call we had earlier the long term fix is AOMA3 using the same registration flow as UST but I know there is some stuff that needs to be taken care of before then. Let me dicuss with the team for a temporary solution to this bridging issue. 

In the meanwhile let me see if we can clear out these old jobs so they can be resubmitted in AOMA3 as well.



Hi db team,

Can you manually update these assetregistration jobs from asset validation failed (45) to failed (5).

2168658, 2168652

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column449:
30/Nov/22 10:10 PM;sira001;Hi Matthew,

I have updated the jobs. Please check.

Regards,

Vinodhan;;;
column450:
30/Nov/22 10:33 PM;spag001;Looks good, thanks Vinodhan.

Hi all,

You should be able to register those VSC masters from AOMA 3 as well now. 

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column451:
05/Dec/22 12:40 PM;hauck03;Hi Team
We can`t full approve this product because the VSC isn`t registered still?
G010004952855K	Guardian Angel

HD
Flo;;;
column452: 05/Dec/22 12:52 PM;alcoc02;Ticket for G010004952855K rwgistration is  WPTS-336060;;;

column1: AOMA System errors and connection issues.
column30:
Hi team,

We are encountering a number of errors, blank screens/page timeouts on different UIs. Reference DPSA-31066 but this is happening for many users and a number of UIs

 !image-2025-06-03-12-23-51-064.png|thumbnail! 

Igor has checked and shared the following:
connection issues:
 Access Denied: I/O error on POST request for "https://rdx-federation.smecloudops.com/graphql": connect timed out; nested exception is java.net.SocketTimeoutException: connect timed out



Thanks,

Fiona
column444:
05/Jun/25 3:23 PM;kmccar1;Hi there team,

This caused some system created Pseudo Videos to not go through the correct processes upon registration. Could you please confirm the root cause? Are there checks in place to prevent in the future?

cc: [~mcatande] [~burg036] 

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column446:
05/Jun/25 3:49 PM;mcatande;Did the system think the auto-pseudo workflow completed successfully?  If yes, then I think it may be prudent to develop a stopgap to prevent these processes from thinking they are complete, when they are not.  Ideally, if there was an issue, there should have been a pause in the workflow, error noted, and resume and complete workflow when issue resolved?  

Some type of indicator at minimum. Having to rely on not being able to publish is not elegant. ;;;
column447: 05/Jun/25 5:26 PM;kori002;[~stef003] will work on this one. We will try to fix it by adding a event based communication which will prevent this from happening again.;;;
column448:
05/Jun/25 5:30 PM;spag001;Hi [~shar051],

Can you review this one?

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column449: 05/Jun/25 5:43 PM;kori002;yes [~stef003] will be checking this Matt and post the update here.;;;
column450:
05/Jun/25 5:45 PM;stef003;Hi,

We will implement a fix in the June build to prevent this issue from occurring in the future. 
https://jira.smedigitalapps.com/jira/browse/AOMA3-2788

Thank you.;;;
column451:
05/Jun/25 5:51 PM;shar051;Hi [~mcatande] 

The issue happened because the post-registration service (which does the auto QC and approval) was down due to some db connection pool system errors and the registration service could not connect to this service. 

We are working on making this post registration workflow event based so in case if the service is down, it can pick up any events from queue when it is back up and running. These changes will go out with the June build.

cc: [~stef003] 

Regards,

Himanshu;;;
column452: 02/Sep/25 2:52 AM;kori002;This now fixed. Ticket attached.;;;

column445:
25/Apr/25 10:14 AM;poty002;Hi [~kmccar1] 

Based on the existing logic, this is the correct flow.
A user can have only one of the following home pages: MediaEngineer, VideoEngineer, GraphicsEngineer, or AudioEngineer.
If you removed this setting and didn’t replace it with another, you’ll encounter the error message you saw.

Could you please share what you expected to see?

Thank you, 
Igor;;;

column1: AOMA3 Linking VSC master 'Empty' Duration causes a duration mismatch message
column30:
Hi team,

AOMA3 Linking shows a duration mismatch message during the linking of a VSC master to a product because it doesn’t note a duration for the VSC. 

Note, the Legacy linking option does not display any duration issues during the linking process. 

AOMA3 Linking - Example: we linked the VSC master: 000025506931 from G010005313022Y to G0100055197281 via the Full Master option. Message received: "Warning: Duration Mismatches - Duration mismatches exist at: Side 1: Track 1. Do you still want to commit link?"

 !image-2025-04-30-10-21-07-043.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2025-04-30-10-16-05-190.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2025-04-30-10-16-23-700.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2025-04-30-10-16-37-087.png|thumbnail! 
 
Thanks,
 
Fiona

column445: 02/Sep/25 2:42 AM;kori002;This is now fixed. Ticket is attached.;;;

column463:
28/Aug/25 7:46 PM;halv001;There's two options for this download option: Source or Proxy/Preview. The "source" downloads are correct. The "Proxy/previews" are not - they did not update with the new masters.

The "source" option exports the wav masters. The Proxy/Previews are the MP4 conversions.

As part of our 360RA QC, we check these MP4 conversions to confirm they are correct. Normally I would use the AOMA 2 export to create these MP4s, but currently is not available.

 ;;;
column464:

We manually retriggered the preview regen so they should now correctly reflect the new assets. Can you try once more to download the proxy assets? 

Thanks

Matthew;;;

Thanks

column444:
27/Aug/25 11:32 AM;burg036;*From:* Cosijn, Joran, Sony Music Belgium <joran.cosijn@sonymusic.com>
*Date:* Wednesday, 27 August 2025 at 09:58
*To:* Sony Music-US, AOMA Support <aoma.support@sonymusic.com>
*Cc:* Williams, Lucy, Sony Music <lucy.williams@sonymusic.com>, Bunckens, Nick, Sony Music Belgium <nick.bunckens@sonymusic.com>
*Subject:* Unusual Aoma Uploads for Review


Hi team,

 

Could someone please review the attached Aoma uploads? The registered users are members of my team, but none of them actually performed these uploads. They were submitted around 3AM, a time when no one on our team was working. We're trying to understand how these uploads occurred.

 

Thank you very much for checking!

 

Kind regards,

Joran

 

 ;;;
column446:
27/Aug/25 4:28 PM;spag001;Hi [~cosi001],

Last night we pushed a fix for a bug that was causing some emails to get stuck, so these emails finally got unstuck and sent out. Nothing was modified with these, this was just the system unclogging these.

For full contexts our email logic for multi tracks uploads in UST has grouping logic where it tries to wait for all active uploads to be in a complete status before sending out the email. The was a certain status (canceled) upload was being treated as in progress when it should have been complete. That has been fixed so now this email was sent out since the canceled upload is no longer blocking the upload.

Let me know if you have any questions or concerns.

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column447:
27/Aug/25 4:34 PM;cosi001;Hey Matthew,

Great! Thanks for explaining. 

kind regards,
Joran;;;
column448: 28/Aug/25 9:32 AM;burg036;Thanks [~spag001] ;;;

column1: Search for large volume of ISRCs in MBC returns error
column30:
Trying to search 2866 ISRCs in MBC. 
 # There is no loading mask so it's really hard to tell when the search is complete or if it's still running. 
 # The error isn't great... Screenshot 

!image-2025-01-31-15-52-07-445.png!
column444: 31/Jan/25 9:53 PM;mcatande;list of ISCRs is attached. I will do this in smaller chunks as a work around. ;;;
column445: 31/Jan/25 9:55 PM;mcatande;submitted a batch of 750 and that also failed, same error. ;;;
column446:
31/Jan/25 9:58 PM;mcatande;submitted a batch of 500 same failure 

submitted a batch of 250 had success. ;;;
column447:
31/Jan/25 10:02 PM;mcatande;Further problems: 

!image-2025-01-31-16-01-28-615.png! the success of the search references products says 151 of 250 products... Should be ISRCs with masters right? 

151 were found but when I go to look at the list of those missing I get this: 

!image-2025-01-31-16-02-27-117.png!  

Just one product listed. 

 

This does not appear to be working properly. ;;;
column448: 31/Jan/25 10:45 PM;mcatande;Note: I ran another batch of 250 and this time it failed with the same error noted below.  I'm giving up on this one and handing it to Jamie who knows how to use workarounds to get the job done.  ;;;
column449:
31/Jan/25 11:04 PM;kmccar1;[~mcatande],

I linked a ticket from November that touched upon the "Further Problems" section. Multiple ISRCs will be 'found' on the same product. That first number ends up being the total number of products utilized, and then the second number is the total ISRCs returned. 

I just put the first 100 ISRCs through and got "Showing 82 out of 99 products." 82 product utilized, 99 tracks found, one track missing. Definitely confusing.
 
*Product Number 88697998162*
*Description*
There are no supported master with ISRC USRC14904639.
USRC14904639 - Perry Como "Some Enchanted Evening" seems to be on many products in the system, and it's on the product noted there (side 1 / track 14), not sure why it's not being picked up. Something with the virtual master maybe? Also, why would it be coming from a Time Life compilation out of all the different available products either (Title: Lifetime of Romance: Some Enchanted Evening - and no, this one is not in my personal collection). 
 
Let me know if you need help gathering these up tonight, I mess around with the MBC all the time. The dev team can check into the Perry Como error next week. 
 
+[~HALE002] as an FYI...
 
Keith;;;

column1: Cover Art registration errors
column30:
Hello,

1. When a cover is CMYK the follow errors get listed:

Aspect Ratio - The Value for this attribute is not readable from the header data of the submitted file. It is recommended to resave the asset(s) in a recent version of Adobe Photoshop to apply the appropriate header data and try again. Alternatively you can proceed as-is with the possibility that the file could fail secondary validations.

Resolution/Dimensions - The Value for this attribute is not readable from the header data of the submitted file. It is recommended to resave the asset(s) in a recent version of Adobe Photoshop to apply the appropriate header data and try again. Alternatively you can proceed as-is with the possibility that the file could fail secondary validations.

The Colorspace of this asset does not meet compliance. The image must be RGB.

Bits per channel / Bit depth - The Value for this attribute is not readable from the header data of the submitted file. It is recommended to resave the asset(s) in a recent version of Adobe Photoshop to apply the appropriate header data and try again. Alternatively you can proceed as-is with the possibility that the file could fail secondary validations.

Why are all of them being flagged? Should just be the colorspace.

2. Registered another image with three errors, CMYK, not a square, and less than 3000px it only shows the CMYK error, not all issues.
column446:
29/Jul/25 9:34 PM;spag001;Hi all,

Based off the error messages I'm assuming pre-flights unable to read the data. We'll review the files with the team.

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column447: 13/Aug/25 6:10 PM;cabe004;I have tested a file I created that's CMYK in photoshop so it should have all the header information. Yet I'm still getting the same error with the aspect ratio, resolution and bits per channel. Is there's something with the CMYK that's causes those prompts to show up? I've attached my image to the ticket. Just strange this it occurring with only CMYK images. ;;;
column448:
19/Aug/25 5:06 PM;spag001;Hi all,

As discussed on the Monday call verified that the CYMK files is failing if pre-flight is skipped. (SONY CI upload) It just failed due to the colorspace being invalid so the other information was being picked up. So likely the issue with the CYMK file is the info isnt on the header info (so pre-flight has issues grabbing it). 

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column449:
19/Aug/25 5:16 PM;mcatande;[~spag001] the CMYK files Jackie created in Photoshop and should almost assuredly have the appropriate header information.  We think the check is bugging out when it's CMYK and erroring out on something unrelated because it's CMYK?  

I have attached the exif data which include both X and Y data for dpi file name "exif-data.txt" ;;;

Manu asked me if I knew why there were null ISRCs on this one - I asked around and it's really quite rare. Mostly it's when labels are trying to move quickly and are behind updating label copy. We definitely still need the ability to export regardless of ISRC status in cases like this.

column1: 19802886171 UST vinyl registration issue when trying to register using UST
column30:
When attempting to register a 16bit Vinyl master using Aspera on UST the following error is displayed. There is no mismatch the master wav is 16 bit and the UST bucket is also 16bit, As a result we cannot use Aspera to register. TusD seems to work fine though. 

this is an error {*}Bit Depth Mismatch{*}: The submitted file "/Volumes/PC and Mac/29_01_25/SLY & THE FAMILY STONE_SLY LIVES!_AKA THE BURDEN OF BLACK GENIUS_VINYL_19802886171/02_01_SLY & THE FAMILY STONE_SLY LIVES!_AKA THE BURDEN OF BLACK GENIUS_SIDE C.wav" has a detected bit depth of 16 which does not match the expected bit depth of 16 bit.

Compliance guidelines can be found here: [https://mediaguide.sonymusic.com/audio/audio-submission-guidelines]

Please upload an asset of bit depth 16 bit.

column1: CD text export issue (Approval not required to send text)
column30:
RCA has an issue where non-approved CD text was sent to plant with incorrect data. In checking, it seems there's a bug in CD text export where it is not being gated by label approval but rather CD text being saved. Screenshots below of the product that was sent with no block on export after the text was saved but not approved. Second product is shown where it is blocked if the text isn't saved...
The text is that CD text isn't saved / approved, but it seems saved is the only requirement.
column244:
AOMA Support
Hours: Monday-Friday, 3:30 am-8:00 pm EST
Emergency After-Hours Support: Send an email to aoma.support@sonymusic.com with the JIRA ticket number and a brief description.
column444:
01/Aug/25 6:21 PM;jdunca1;Adding pics in comments since they are not loading correctly in description.
Sends without approval:



!Screenshot 2025-08-01 at 11.57.06 AM.png|width=750,height=715!

!Screenshot 2025-08-01 at 11.58.14 AM.png|width=839,height=283!

Blocked without save:
!Screenshot 2025-08-01 at 12.05.21 PM.png|width=759,height=291!

!Screenshot 2025-08-01 at 12.06.28 PM.png|width=660,height=520!;;;
column445:
01/Aug/25 8:38 PM;kmccar1;I had thought that AOMA Generated CDText had to be saved and approved (status set to Proceed) in order to go out the door for all these years. Native CD Text did not require saving or approval.

Export to the plant should be blocked until the CD Text is approved by a label rep in the future. Seems like it's a holdover from the early days of AOMA...

Would you want an AMSE for this team, or should this be a fix ticket?

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column446:
04/Aug/25 4:41 PM;spag001;Hi [~poty002], 

Can you review this one?

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column447:
04/Aug/25 4:49 PM;mcatande;We are under the impression that AOMA generated CD text needs to be approved before export of said CD text is allowed.  In this case it was exported without approval.  The product Title was not correct in CD text and the disc was manufactured incorrectly ( a large run).  

If CD text was operating as we expected, it would have forced an approval and possibly caught the title error.  ;;;
column448:
06/Aug/25 10:44 AM;poty002;Hi [~mcatande] [~kmccar1] 
Based on our investigation, we’re currently only verifying that the CD Text was saved, not whether it was approved.
We’ve created a new task for this on our board and will prioritize it for the next release.

Thank you,
Igor;;;

column1: Video Batch Request - Proxy Error
column30:
Hi team,

I submitted the attached list of video products (videobatchconvert_one.xls) via the Video Batch Request UI, along with the below noted Conversion IDs (screenshot-1). 

10745, 10751, 10762, 10775, 10864, 10889, 10954, 20775, 11060, 11082, 11084, 20135, 20136, 20137

Once submitted, the UI responded successfully, with the "Please wait..." message (screenshot-2). After a few moments, I navigated to the General -> My AOMA Files -> offerings -> mcatande_request folder in another browser tab. While waiting for that to load, I went back to the Video Batch Request UI, which refreshed and displayed the attached Proxy Error (screenshot-3). I was then logged out of the system (2-Factor login).

It seems like the conversions are processing as expected so far - I'm expecting 196 files in total (14 products by 14 conversion IDs), but could you please check into this issue and let me know if A. I did anything incorrectly on my end B. why the proxy error was thrown and C. why I was immediately logged out of the system as a result. 

Let me know if you need any further information to investigate. 

Thanks,

Keith

10745, 10751, 10762, 10775, 10864, 10889, 10954, 20775

Keith;;;

Let me sync up with Rohit and get back to you.

Brittney

Brittney

SD/HD is a resolution standard like 2K and 4K 

These should be separate fields within the database and can be displayed in a similar fashion.
