column1: SME France Timing Issue (FRPIN1800170)
column30:
On 8/16/2018 12:27 PM, Chianese, Mathilde, Sony Music Entertainment FR wrote:
> We have found an issue on products registered in AOMA against this ISRC : FRPIN1800170
<
> G010003956044E : single product, audio is 4'25 (first audio registered in the system)
> G010003956043G, 19075874621, 19075874622 : longplay products audio is 6'08
>
> We need to understand why it was possible to register an audio against the same ISRC, with a big timing difference : Is there any warning message in such cases ? (we can recall if we had any..)

On 8/16/2018 1:24 PM, Sony Music AOMA Support wrote:
> FRPIN1800170 is set in LC as 6:08. Therefore, all four noted products would have expected this track to be around 6:08. You would have received a duration warning at the time of the registration of  master 12900061 under G010003956044E, as the track that was uploaded was only 4:25, compared to the 6:08 in label-copy. The only way that this wouldn't have happened is if the duration was entered in at a later time - I don't believe this happened here though, as I'm not seeing any metadata import duration overrides between the registration date of June 12, and the "Set Complete" date of June 25.
>
> Was this master possibly registered prior to the track duration having been entered? Was it possibly set to 4:25 originally, and then changed to 6:08?
>
> As far as a fix, you'll need to create a separate single version ISRC of the track for product G010003956044E in GRAS. We'll then need to un-publish, un-link, import metadata, update the ISRC on the master, re-link, and re-publish. 

On 8/17/2018 10:00 AM, Vogel, Nathalie, Sony Music Entertainment FR wrote:
> At first this title was created with a timing of 6:08  on June 11th I believe. The following day, this timing was changed to 4:25, and the digital single G010003956044E was published
>
> Then the timing for this same track was modified again by mistake in our system, back to 6:08 I believe on June 25th. This should never happen in the first place, unfortunately sometimes, some people make this kind of big mistakes...
>
> We wondered why there was not any "AOMA warning", while we tried to upload this new master, with this new timing, but with the same ISRC of the existing digital single which has a very different timing. Wouldn't it be possible to receive a warning from AOMA saying that there is an existing track with same ISRC but with timing with more than 10 sec difference ?
column444:
17/Aug/18 4:47 PM;kmccar1;Order of Events (to the best of my understanding):

1. 6/11 - FRPIN1800170 created in GRAS with a duration of 6:08.

2. 6/12 - FRPIN1800170 changed to 4:25. Master 12900061 registered successfully under G010003956044E. Actual track duration: 4:25. No warning would be received at this point. 
000012900061  (Info)	G010003956044E 
(Info)	1327351	Standard	/SDA/aoma-ifs-nas-prod-int-01/prod-aoma/master/audio/0029/DDP_000012900061_DDP	Registration Successful	Registration completed successfully.	chia021	Sony Music - Restricted, France	2018-06-12 08:45:57:0

(6/22 - 24-bit WAV vinyl master 12926992 registered under 19075874621. I don't believe this would be applicable for this issue, as side 1 includes the noted track. Duration is 6:08, but we have the single WAV file there, so no warning would be present anyhow.
000012926992  (Info)	19075874621 
(Info)	1330010	Standard	/SDA/aoma-ifs-nas-prod-int-01/prod-aoma/master/audio_vwav/0001/VWAV24B_000012926992	Registration Successful	Registration completed successfully.	sabo007	Sony Music - Restricted, France	2018-06-22 08:21:09:0)

3. 6/25 - FRPIN1800170 duration is mistakenly modified back to 6:08. Automatic metadata import for G010003956044E completed successfully 2018-06-25 05:15:00 EDT without any duration warning. Shouldn't the import have failed at this point, since the linked master 12900061 has a duration of 4:25, over a minute difference from the updated LC duration of 6:08?

4. 6/26 - Master 13045267 registered under 19075874622, and linked to digital equivalent G010003956043G. Track 3 on the master is 6:08, matching the current track label-copy. No warning messages at this point. Per Nathalie Vogel, there should be a warning if a track master exists in the system that has a duration discrepancy with another track master that is being uploaded under the same ISRC. 
000013045267  (Info)	19075874622 
(Info)	1341840	Standard	/SDA/aoma-ifs-nas-prod-int-01/prod-aoma/master/pkgf/0004/GFX_000013045267	Registration Successful	Registration completed successfully.	ddiadei1	Sony Music - Restricted, France	2018-08-10 05:24:49:0

;;;
column445:
17/Aug/18 4:52 PM;kmccar1;Hi teams,

Could you please review the above and let us know if this is the expected behavior? Please especially note point 3 above, concerning the successful metadata import.

Let me know if you need any further information. I've included [~chia021] Mathilde Chianese, SME France, here as well. 

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column446:
17/Aug/18 6:07 PM;bsahoo1;Hi [~sdonipu],

Please look into this.

Thanks,
Brajesh;;;
column448:
29/Aug/18 7:22 PM;sdonipu;Hi Keith,

The business logic involved in the present design and implementation needs to be reviewed by @aoma.core.businessanalysts@sonymusic.com.
I will assign to them for the next steps here.

Thanks,
Sharada;;;

column30:
Currently, the Export UI will display a list of track titles for selection. As most GCLS requests are based on ISRC codes, and some products will have multiple tracks with the same title but differing ISRC codes, could the ISRC be noted next to the tracks? 

Thanks,

Keith

column1: GCLS / Supply Chain Order Management - Comments From Fiona Cameron
column30:
On 10/4/2017 1:50 PM, Cameron, Fiona, Sony Music wrote:
> Until further notice please could you direct all those looking for SME UK tracks myself and Ben Tilley via email and not the AOMA Supply Chain Process.
>
> I would like to request that we do not encourage the GCLS users to request tracks via the AOMA Supply Chain Order process at the moment for a couple of reasons, using the below request to illustrate my concerns:
>
> 1.       Gloria is only looking for one track on this digital audio extended play and whilst she advises the GCLS request that she asked for it on we don't have access to that and as such wouldn't know which track she is looking for without an ISRC
>
> 2.       Although there are assets the 'Fulfill' option does not appear (screenshot 1)
>
> 3.       Even if the 'Fulfill' option appeared when you go to the export page at present the ISRCs are not visible and so on a product where there are multiple tracks with the same title it would be good to have the ISRC to be sure the one requested is the one sent (screenshot 2)
>
> 4.       Many GCLS requests are for multiple tracks and as such this would not be an efficient way in which to manage those requests
>
> Gloria obviously has access to AOMA, has found the product with the ISRC she wants and could place the order as such for single track requests this process could work if we looked at the following enhancements:
>
> a)      Finding a way for the requestee to tick the preferred track and for that selected track to remain selected throughout the whole export process for easy fulfilment by the rep owner
>
> Then of course we need to discuss how best to manage multiple track requests
column444:
05/Oct/17 3:17 PM;kmccar1;On 10/5/2017 8:43 AM, Cameron, Fiona, Sony Music wrote:
> Thanks for placing all your track requests in AOMA however from a UK perspective we do not wish to fulfil in this manner until the process is as efficient as the email request process.;;;
column445:
10/Oct/17 6:15 PM;kmccar1;Hi Brittney and team,

Keith;;;

column1: Possible Security Group Issue (master/product vs. account)
column30:
Hi team,
 
I came across this issue this morning while reviewing an export job for product 88985436482. Please review and let me know if you have any further questions.

The following 4 masters are linked to 88985436482. Please note the security group affiliation for each. 

000010393746 - Packaging Graphics Master (FR) - STICKER / Security Group: France
000010363506 - Packaging Graphics Master (US) / Security Groups: Columbia, Columbia Confidential
000010363527 - Cover Master / Security Groups: Columbia, Columbia Confidential
000010122239 - Audio Master DDP / Security Group: Columbia Confidential

Release date: 06/02/2017 (pre-release) 

AOMA account: amtest1 
Account is set with full access (pre- / post-release) to France. Account does not have the Export All Security Groups permission. 

1. Search for product 88985436482
Audio, Cover, and Graphics master icons appear in the Results (Screenshot-1)
a. Clicking on the audio master icon results in a blank screen (Screenshot-2 - this is correct, user should not have access to the audio master)
b. Clicking on the cover master icon allows the user to access the Graphic Details UI, select the cover for QuickConvert, Export, Add to collection, etc (Screenshot-3) This is incorrect - the user should not have access to this cover image as it is associated only with Columbia and Columbia Confidential. 
c. Clicking on the graphic master icon allows the user access to the Graphic Details UI for BOTH packaging graphics masters. (Screenshot-4) User should not have access to the US Territory master as it is NOT associated with France.  

2. From the Export UI, after selecting a destination (Direct Mail Delivery in this example), the amtest1 account is able to select the cover, and both packaging Graphics masters for export (Screenshot-5) I do not want to actually trigger the export, as this is a pre-release product for a major artist on Columbia.  

3. Please note in Screenshot-6 that all of the associated security groups are noted under "Security Groups," giving the appearance that all of the masters share the same groups.
column444:
29/Aug/17 10:39 PM;ssingh3;Brittney,

Please check with Rohit and add this to project plan.

Thanks,
Sandeep;;;

column445:
02/May/17 5:09 PM;mcatande;The behavior in Jira with the attached screenshot images may be more desirable in terms of how the images are displayed in AOMA. 

If you click Mathilde's screenshots above you can see Jira's image preview window adds a small white border and the X circle button (to close the pop-up) is not over or obstructing the actual image in any way. 
Also when the pop-up window is activated the background turns a translucent gray so one can still see what's behind the pop up window but it doesn't distract from the pop up.  

There is also an arrow selector that allows the user to move on to the next image to be previewed. Perhaps we should activate this in the VIC selection interface as well where a user doesn't have to close the pop-up window and it just cycles back and forth between the available images for selection?  
Could the pop-up window also include an option to select the new approved VIC within that window? ;;;

column1: AOMA3 - Internet Explorer Loading issue
column30:
Browser: Internet Explorer 11

When navigating between the various UIs in AOMA 3 via IE 11, the browser does not appear to "respond." After clicking on a link (it can be anything) the AOMA icon in the browser tab does not start "spinning" as it does in Firefox and Google Chrome. This gives the appearance that the link is not working. After a few seconds, the new page loads. 

This is especially troublesome for Direct / Simple Upload. After the Aspera upload completes, the browser window remains still. After a few moments (or minutes, depending upon the amount of files transferred), the UI will reload and provide the confirmation message.

column1: Package Printing Specifications - Character Limit
column30:
The "additional details" boxes on the Package Printing Specifications UI are limited to 256 characters. The UI currently allows a user to enter more than this into the fields - clicking "Save" results in an AOMA Error similar to the one attached here. 

There should be a note concerning this on the UI, and the user should not be able to enter more than the limit. This will help avoid these errors, and confusion for the 3rd Party graphic engineers.

column1: Batch Offerings / Direct Mail Delivery to My AOMA Files (Fiona Cameron)
column30:
Fiona Cameron suggested that the ability to send files via Direct Mail Delivery be added to the Batch Offerings UI, or the My AOMA Files UI. 

On 1/6/2016 11:42 AM, fiona.cameron@sonymusic.com wrote:
>
> Rather than sending track by track we would like to use the batch offering function in AOMA and we are going to use this more in 2016.
>
> However please note that there is still a part of this process where we feel there could be an improvement to streamline things a bit not only for ourselves but for other AOMA users who may send multiple tracks to a colleague or third party.
>
> Since whilst batch offering means we can download all the tracks to our desktop to then send in one go to the recipient via SFTS it would be great if we could just process the batch offering and send direct delivery to a recipient.
>
> One option could be at Assets to Process point to add the function beside process conversions of 'Process conversions and direct delivery' - see screenshot below of the section
>
(Screenshot 1) 
>
> Another option is to add the direct delivery option in the My AOMA Files section somewhere and I guess ideally it would be direct delivery with download via Aspera that would provide the best end user experience.
>
(Screenshot 2)

column1: Asset Submission Tool - Registration Failure
column30:
Hello, 

Whenever I upload poster art backfill into Digital Video Longplay using asset submission tool, there's always a PSD file that fails registration. I currently have one product that isn't urgent for you to review, product number G010003304503D. I backfill 6 to 7 files that include 2 PSD files and one of them always fails. I always expect to happen so I await confirmation of all files. For this product number the follow file failed (screenshot attached):

Incubus_AliveAtRedRocks_G010003304503D_2000x3000_RGB_Poster.psd

It's strange that it one file fails. I upload the folder with files into my migration folder then using the asset submission I registration them. 

Here's are some other product numbers that I've worked on recently to note that had the same failures but I've gone back to clear it out and register it again. G010003278404M, G010003283019E, G010003291551B, G010003266094O, G0100032854025, G010003289615Q. This issue always happens so I wanted to put in a ticket to address it. Please advise.

12/Aug/25 8:57 PM;kmccar1;Error
Status: Error occurred during metadata update!

Save to database failed : org.hibernate.exception.LockAcquisitionException: could not execute statement

!image-2025-08-12-14-58-01-418.png!;;;
column446:
12/Aug/25 9:07 PM;spag001;Hi [~prag008],

Can you review this one?

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column447:
13/Aug/25 5:55 PM;cabe004;The issue occurred again, with product G0100032936534. One of the psd files failure registration. Need to move forward with this product, I will remove and attempt to register again.

-Jackie;;;
column448:
13/Aug/25 6:13 PM;cabe004;Another one that had one of the two PSD files fail when registering G0100032935718. Please advise. Will need to move forward with this product as well.

-Jackie;;;
column450:
19/Aug/25 7:42 PM;cabe004;I have to move forward with the product registration. Any update [~prag008] ?

I continue to have the same issue with new products: G010003321550K, G010003313373M;;;
column451:
21/Aug/25 6:50 PM;prag008;Hi [~cabe004] ,

This issue stems from concurrent registration attempts, which can lead to a deadlock on the database side. It may occur across any asset type.

As a temporary workaround, if you encounter registration failures during multi-asset registration, please retry the failed assets individually. They should register successfully upon retry.

We are currently analyzing the root cause and will keep you updated on our findings.

Thanks,

Ganesh;;;

column1: Cover Master 27254202 Display Issue in Spotify.
column30:
Hi everyone,

 

We noticed that a cover was flipped by Spotify (or perhaps by our system).

The real one:                                                           

!image-2025-08-21-12-09-50-381.png!

The “spotify version”:

!image-2025-08-21-12-10-15-590.png!

In AOMA everything seemed fine, the cover has been uploaded correctly, specs ok.

The only clue we have is that when we download it from AOMA it is flipped on his side.

 

We decided to create a new master, reupload the cover and hot swap it. I think it resolves the issue as the cover is now good on the Catalog Spotify.

 

We have kept the problematic master to investigate more on this issue and understand what could have been the problem here.

Master 27254202

Product G010005604240N

 

Could you please have a deep look on it to prevent this issue from happening again ?

 

Thanks for your help

Jérémie
column444:
21/Aug/25 12:12 PM;burg036;Hi team,

Can you please check?

Here is cover master: 27254202 in AOMA (displayed correctl), and the downloaded file (displayed incorrectly). I have also attached the downloaded file here for reference.

!image-2025-08-21-12-11-19-199.png!

Thanks,

Fiona;;;
column445:
21/Aug/25 2:49 PM;mcatande;Hey All, 

I downloaded the source file from AOMA and don't have the same issue.  The image doesn't flip.  How was the flipped image downloaded from AOMA?  I clicked download source file and downloaded a copy with shortname.  See attached ;;;
column446:
21/Aug/25 2:53 PM;mcatande;The source file I downloaded from AOMA is different than the file Fiona downloaded from AOMA.  The difference is: 
||File||Orientation||
|*exif-data (1).txt*|*Not present*|
|*exif-data (2).txt*|*Rotate 270 CW* (corresponds to value {{{}6{}}})|
 
This means:
 * The image in {{exif-data (2).txt}} is intended to be displayed *rotated 270° clockwise* (i.e., portrait orientation).
 * The image in {{exif-data (1).txt}} has {*}no orientation tag{*}, so it will be displayed as-is, which may not be correct if the image was taken in a rotated position.;;;
column448: 21/Aug/25 2:57 PM;mcatande;Did EOM get the update message and send the revised master to Spotify?  Looks like the original did contain the metadata to flip the image while the revised does not and should be as expected.  ;;;
column449:
21/Aug/25 3:00 PM;burg036;Hi [~mcatande] I downloaded the source file and tried both Short Name and Long Name options with the same results. FYI, I am on Mac OS Sequoia 15.6 - Chrome Version 139.0.7258.139 (Official Build) (arm64).

!image-2025-08-21-14-58-50-075.png|width=494,height=380!;;;
column450:
21/Aug/25 3:05 PM;mcatande;[~burg036] What's the master ID you are downloading?  

Master ID currently associated with the product is: 000027374324 

Product: G010005604240N 

!image-2025-08-21-09-05-20-607.png|width=1707,height=835!;;;
column451: 21/Aug/25 3:15 PM;burg036;Hi [~mcatande] I downloaded cover master ID: 27254202. Which is the one that caused the issue at Spotify and that SME France removed during the hotswap. ;;;
column452:
21/Aug/25 3:15 PM;dure05;Hello,
Very strange, we did not know it was even possible to add such message in a square cover. The new cover worked perfectly and it is ok now on Spotify.
We inform the label of the issue

Thanks a lot for taking a look appreciated
Stéphanie;;;
column453:
21/Aug/25 3:21 PM;mcatande;[~dure05] - Yes. in an image file there is the ability to add header data (exif) data which instructs a computer to display the image in a certain orientation.  I believe this is rooted in taking images with a camera when it is flipped on its side and then changing the orientation to make that image upright. 

We could look into a validation for this to prevent it from happening but it's very rare, this may be the 3rd or 4th time I've seen this happen ever in our supply chain.  ;;;
column454: 21/Aug/25 3:23 PM;mcatande;If everyone is satisfied it looks like the asset swap solved the issue, so this can probably be closed.  I will create a super low priority AMSE to validate the 'orientation' exif data. ;;;
column455: 21/Aug/25 3:26 PM;dure05;perfect thanks ;;;

column1: Blu-Ray Master (CES) export displays as Successful, but not received at CES
column30:
*From:* Fehn, Constanze, Century Media <{+}[Constanze.Fehn@centurymedia.de|mailto:Constanze.Fehn@centurymedia.de]{+}>
*Date:* Wednesday, 20 August 2025 at 11:29
*To:* Sony Music-US, AOMA Support <{+}[aoma.support@sonymusic.com|mailto:aoma.support@sonymusic.com]{+}>
*Subject:* Mixed product error - export to CES

Hello all,

 

I want to bring an error to your attention that we experience +every single time+ when we export masters of mixed products (e.g. product# 19802927792: 2x audio DDPs + 1x BDCMF) to destination: {_}Manufacturing - Central European Services (CES){_}.

The error is: only one master category (either Audio DDP *OR* BDCMF) is showing up as “available” in European Services CMG as party entry.

 

We do use a workaround since years where I do export one master category, CES sends these masters to the pressing plant and then I export the other master category and those masters then are forwarded to the pressing plant, too.

This is not ideal, but I don’t know how complex it would be to get this error fixed and if it’s an AOMA or a CMG bug.

 

 

This is an sample export that I did this morning:

 

As you can see in the CMG screenshot: although I did successfully export all 3 masters at the same time, only the 2 audio DDPs are available: - the BDCMF is not available

 

*Additional note:*  If I would exporting the BDCMF master now to Manufacturing - Central European Services (CES), then the 2 audio DDPs will disappear.

 

Thanks for looking into this for me.

 

Best,

C*

 

*Constanze Fehn (she / her)*
Senior Label & Project Manager

 ** 

*Century Media Records / InsideOutMusic*

*a division of Sony Music Entertainment*

Sony Music Entertainment Germany GmbH

Bülowstraße 80

10783 Berlin

NEW number: Tel. [+49 (0) 173 3647473|tel:+491733647473]

E-Mail: +[constanze.fehn@centurymedia.de|mailto:constanze.fehn@centurymedia.de]+

Web: +[www.centurymedia.com|https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.centurymedia.com%2F&data=05%7C02%7Cfiona.burgess.ext%40sonymusic.com%7Ce5f26d3a3e614fb2bc6c08dddfd67bac%7Cf0aff3b791a54aaeaf71c63e1dda2049%7C0%7C0%7C638912834525685060%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=qCE8tvBn9%2FEyUTpM1tkebhfwOTwJX2ZirLMWglXyREM%3D&reserved=0]+ / +[www.sonymusic.de|https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=http%3A%2F%2Fwww.sonymusic.de%2F&data=05%7C02%7Cfiona.burgess.ext%40sonymusic.com%7Ce5f26d3a3e614fb2bc6c08dddfd67bac%7Cf0aff3b791a54aaeaf71c63e1dda2049%7C0%7C0%7C638912834525711107%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=cdfonaJnnsC45Mfts2vhHW5ivZ4qoESBSw1%2FH35rjg8%3D&reserved=0]+

column446:
20/Aug/25 3:31 PM;burg036;Hi team,

This issue here is, if both masters on a product, with a mix of virtually linked DDPs and Bly-Ray masters, are exported to CES during the same export attempt, only the audio master gets delivered to CES, even though AOMA shows that both the audio and Blu-Ray were successfully delivered.

!image-2025-08-20-15-16-39-890.png!

 

!image-2025-08-20-15-29-42-679.png!

!image-2025-08-20-15-38-35-152.png!

!image-2025-08-20-15-38-53-393.png!

 

 

Note, Constanze's CES contact is Spatharis, Monika, European Services <monika.spatharis.external@sonymusic.com>. We've reached to Monika for further information. She can confirm this happens for any (DDP+Blu-Ray) product exported to CES under Constanze's account. She is checking if this happens for other users.

_From Monika (Teams): "The only thing I can say is that we do have issues every time Constanze transfers CD AND BluRay masters at the same time. In the past we therefore helped ourselves by first transferring the CD masters, which we then forwarded to the manufacturer, and after that  the BluRay masters were uploaded and transferred. However, this cannot be a permanent solution, can it?"_

Thanks,

Fiona;;;

column1: 19439935162 BluRay / Audio Export To CES Issue
column30:
19439935162

On 11/30/2021 9:10 AM, Fehn, Constanze, Century Media wrote:
> Please find attached (screenshot-1) the export messages for the two exports of CD audio DDPs and a Blu-ray master to CES. 
>
> I exported those yesterday & today. (the 2nd export today was done as I got the message from CES that the BD master is not available for them)
>
> My customer service manager Moni told me twice that "the Blu-ray master is not available in CMG" (see screenshot)
>
> Can it be that the audio DDPs "overwrite the BD entry"? Well, it's just me wild guessing, so please help. Thanks!
column444:
30/Nov/21 3:40 PM;kmccar1;Hi team,

From the Export UI (screenshot-2), it appears that the virtually linked BluRay and DDP masters are "Sharing" a master ID. Is it possible that this is causing the overwriting of the BluRay component in the CES system? 

Please note that the Package Graphics were delivered as expected to Optimal, but no secondary export triggered for the audio or BluRay.

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column446:
30/Nov/21 4:42 PM;spag001;Hi all,

Looking into this.

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column447:
30/Nov/21 5:46 PM;spag001;Hi all,

The exports from our side seem fine and in theory it should be going to two different locations but you might be right about the single master getting overwritten as I am not sure how the CES side handles this. Would it be possible to trigger the CES export for the ddp, then we resubmit the blueray export and see if it shows up then?

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column448:
30/Nov/21 10:19 PM;kmccar1;Thanks Matthew - Yes, will give that a try as well. I sent directly to the server in the meantime. I vaguely recall a similar issue from probably way back. Trying to track down the JIRA ...

Keith;;;
column449:
04/Jul/22 5:14 PM;kmccar1;On 7/4/2022 10:46 AM, [~fehn001], Century Media wrote:
> I’m back again with the identical topic. 😊

This time for this release:
|Steve Hackett|Genesis Revisited Live: Seconds Out & More|Ltd. Edition 2CD+Blu-ray Digipak in Slipcase|19439947702|194399477021|

1. My colleague Johanna created a virtual component to combine 2x CD audio DDPs with a Blu-ray BDCMF master (000022198877).

She exported all the masters manually to CES.

CES let her know that the “Blu-ray master is not available anymore”

!image-2022-07-04-11-13-46-488.png!

 2. My colleague exported manually just the BD master to CES then.

Result: the 2x CD audio DDPs were “not available anymore”, but the new export of the BD master was instead.

CES asked of getting the audio DDPs exported again.

!image-2022-07-04-11-13-55-091.png!

 3. My colleague exported the 2x audio CD DDP manually to CES again

Result: the Blu-ray master was “not available anymore”

CES now decided to export the 2x audio DDP CDs to Sonopress first & once they are at the manufacturer my colleague will manually export the BD master to CES again…
!image-2022-07-04-11-14-05-149.png!

So the issue that we had back in December (see mail thread below) still exists.

BTW: I think I have another idea what might create this issue (in the back-end).
Usually you have two buttons available for simple upload when you have a combo product (Audio CD + BD)After my colleague initially uploaded the audio DDPs via simple upload the simple upload button for uploading a BD master was gone.
That’s the reason why she had to create a virtual component (after she created both masters for audio & BD manually via “master create”)
>

 ;;;
column450:
04/Jul/22 5:15 PM;kmccar1;Hi team,

Century Media are reporting this issue again. Could you please re-review? 

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column451:
05/Jul/22 5:31 PM;spag001;Hi all,

Looking into this.

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column452:
05/Jul/22 8:52 PM;spag001;Hey Keith,



Found the issue on this, the filter logic for revoking keys on the for this package on the AOMA side  needs some modifications due to the shared master id. Linked a fix ticket for the issue but for now as the user's suggested the workaround would be to export one at a time, and fully process that one before moving to the next one.

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column454:
06/Jul/22 10:52 AM;fehn001;Lovely - thank you, [~SPAG001] , to figuring out what the issue is. Please keep me posted once the bug is fixed.

For the time being we proceed with the workaround. No problem :);;;

column444:

This is a very old catalogue album, let me check with our Catalogue team if they have an artwork file that they can share with us.

Feedback to follow.

 

Regards
Claire;;;
column446: 05/Aug/25 2:34 PM;mcatande;Just adding, we suspect a layered Tiff file was originally supplied which either corrupted at some point or errored out... the reason we suspect this is that AOMA was successfully able to generate a preview from the asset at one time and that preview does not contain the physical references we can clearly see in the corrupted source file.  ;;;
column447:
19/Aug/25 5:08 PM;mcatande;[~hugo04] - I found an image for this product online attached "G0100030512597_revised.jpeg" 

Please let me know if we should proceed with registering this updated image. ;;;
column448:
20/Aug/25 9:25 AM;hugo04;HI Michael

Please proceed to register the updated image.

 

Kind regards
Claire;;;
column449: 20/Aug/25 2:40 PM;mcatande;Cover is now successfully swapped. ;;;

column446:
20/Aug/25 4:47 PM;kmccar1;And now for something completely different...

Each one of these products has between 70 and 80 separate registration submissions with a pending status of "Archive In Progress." It looks like the system was swapping out masters all night long here. Could you please take a look, team?

Thanks,

Keith;;;

column449:
20/Aug/25 5:04 PM;spag001;Hi all,

Checking this out.

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column450: 20/Aug/25 5:10 PM;chin023;These were prepped as "dummy videos" as placeholders. Now noticing they are solid black, which is likely tripping out the black/curtain detect features. Let us know if that is the case, and we can create and submit something else.;;;
column451:
20/Aug/25 5:15 PM;spag001;Hi all,

So UST has a workflow to automatically trigger auto-correct if the only issue is Front or Back black tail detection. Auto-correct will then add the missing data and then proceed as normal via the registration. It looks in this case however auto-correction is failing to add the data and it keeps looping because of it. As of now I'm going to fail the in-progress job.

Hi [~gmp],

Can we manually add the black front to this file? I'll need to review with the team why the auto correct CT failed to add it.

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column453: 20/Aug/25 5:19 PM;mcatande;[~spag001] - See Jon's comment. These video's are black without any audio.  Definitely being confused.  ;;;
column454:
20/Aug/25 5:22 PM;chin023;You can pull here for testing:

[https://app.cimediacloud.com/r/9Ub5n6dm5xzU] | Password:  HUDNXM4%BM0G;;;
column455: 20/Aug/25 5:30 PM;chin023;Please confirm when the current assets are failed/cleared so we can resubmit ASAP. Thanks;;;
column456:
20/Aug/25 5:38 PM;spag001;Hi [~chin023],

Everything has been failed out and all SFV masters have been unlinked so you should be good to proceed.

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column457: 20/Aug/25 6:21 PM;chin023;Revised videos have been submitted, thanks. We will let you know if we need anything else for this set.;;;

column1: G0100051495946 - DSD Master ID: 24506158 - Track 4 Issue
column30:
Hi all,

 

Do you happen to know why the track No. 4 for is greyed out in AOMA?

We seem to have some issues with delivery to Qobuz.

 

Thanks so much!

Klara

*Subject:* Qobuz - Import Failure - G0100051495946

 

Hi all,

 

Qobuz cannot process this product as Track 4 seems to be having some issues.

 

G0100051495946 / 196871477130

 

Can you please review and see if the asset is set up correctly?

 

Thanks!

Cindy

Arne

column1: One Off Report request - AOMA Registered Shortform Video
column30:
Can you please provide a report with the following criteria: 

Digital Video Track Products Registered to AOMA 

Fields to include: 
 * Artist
 * Title
 * Product Number 
 * Product Configuration
 * ISRC 
 * Master ID 
 * Label
 * Registration date/Time
 * Registered BY (user)
 * File format (ProRes or MPEG2) 
 * Video Dimensions
 * Aspect Ratio
 * Frame Rate 
 * Crop Top 
 * Crop Bottom
 * Crop Left
 * Crop Right
 * Audio Bit Depth 
 * Audio Sample Rate
 * VSC Approved (Y/N) 
 * QC Notes Entered (Y/N) 
 * QC Notes Locked (Y/N) 
 * Security Groups
 * Maintenance Owner

Need a total list of what's in AOMA. No date ranges.  if we need break it up into parts please do.  

This was requested previously in DPSA-29247 need "aspect ratio" data on this round.
column244:
AOMA Support
Hours: Monday-Friday, 3:30 am-8:00 pm EST
Emergency After-Hours Support: Send an email to aoma.support@sonymusic.com with the JIRA ticket number and a brief description.

 * Maintenance Owner

column1: TAIWAN BULK UST PROJECT - VSC Extract Errors - G010005576449F
column30:
Getting strange errors when trying to extract VSC for 720x480 Letterboxed MSA (Ex- G010005576449F )

Error1- "The Video Screen Capture's dimensions of 640x384 do not match the linked Short Form Video's cropped dimensions 698x372."

Error2- "DPI value is less then 72 or is null. The Current Resolution is: 8.00"

Please advise.

Thanks

Matthew;;;

column1: G010005425076Q - 24bit master 27299854 not showing as ADM in UST if updated after registration
column30:
**Please note, do to the urgency of the registration, I un-registered the master 27299854 and re-registered to a new master ID as an ADM. **

24bit master 27299854 was registered as normal 24bit, however, I tried to update it to be MFiT, but UST does not update and still shows the master as non-MFiT. The product details page correctly shows the master as ADM. (see attached screenshots)

I tried unlinking the master and re-linking, but the UST bucket did not update.

Can it checked why UST will not update a 24bit master if it was changed to an MFiT master?
column444:
30/Jul/25 11:48 PM;kmccar1;I'm going to guess it was a cache issue - please try a hard browser refresh next time, [~halv001] (Ctrl + F5). 

Do you see anything going on with master 27299854  team?

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column445:
31/Jul/25 4:28 PM;jdunca1;In running a test in Stage to see if I could work around this, I registered a 24/48 master to the normal bucket. I then updated as MFiT, broke the associated master ID. I then registered an "HD" master to the 48 k bucket. Next, I went to AOMA3 linking and did a full master association to the 48k MFiT master ID that I'd unlinked. On the details page it appears correct, but you can no longer load the UST page.

Stage product is G010004830382Z.

Error is: (my guess it that it is attempting to link both master ID's to the normal 24/48 bucket and not mapping to the MFiT bucket)

!Screenshot 2025-07-31 at 10.23.12 AM.png|width=673,height=357!;;;
column446:
31/Jul/25 5:04 PM;spag001;Hi all,

Checking this out.

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column447:
31/Jul/25 5:57 PM;spag001;Hi [~halv001],

For clarification which UI did you use to update the master to mfit?

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column449:
31/Jul/25 7:05 PM;spag001;Gotcha, thanks [~halv001].

Looks the way UST is expecting these converted mfits to behave is not what legacy/A3 is doing. I'll need to have a discussion with the team and then I'll create a fix ticket.

Thanks

Matthew;;;
column450:
07/Aug/25 9:36 PM;spag001;Hi all,

The issue will be fixed in the linked fix tickets.

Thanks

Matthew;;;

column1: UST - Full Master/full master side upload display issue
column30:
When uploading audio via "Full Master" or "Full Master Side" there's a display issue in the registration window where the text notes "File for upload" and displays a single file from the selected folder.

We would ideally like to see all files listed, but understand that a large product with lots of tracks could be an issue for display.

If that is too much, could it possibly display "Folder for upload" and then show the folder. (Would be really nice if that folder could have a carat to display the contents of the folder.)
column444:
08/Jan/25 8:23 PM;kmccar1;Hi [~VENU001] [~HALE002],

Could you please take a look at what Jamie's asking for here?

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column445:
13/Jun/25 5:50 PM;hale002;The file name currently displays the folder name but the text still indicates "Files for uploads" not sure if we can update that based on the select file or full side master, Will have an internal call and plan it accordingly.

!image-2025-06-13-11-48-32-024.png!;;;
column446: 13/Jun/25 6:23 PM;mcatande;Per discussion: instead of folder or file for upload, change the language to "Selected for upload" ;;;

column1: MBC - Certain special characters are turned into underscores
column30: Noticing and issue with MBC where special characters like : and ? are getting turned into _ on the exported file. If these need to be removed, could they just be omitted? The reason is to maintain the file naming convention. If using the underscore as a delimiter to breakup the values (Artist, Title, Prod, ISRC, comp#, track#) either for coding or to load into an excel, the unexpected underscore throws everything off.

column1: Media Batch Converter
column30:
Hi All - 

Weve been trying to use MBC for Mobile Tone exports since Batch Export via Mobile Audio Manager is going / gone. 

Having some issues getting all of the products to export, previously there was a known issue with virtually linked masters.

I attempted this batch this afternoon and only received a few of the products.

Would someone be able to take a look and confirm, or perhaps were not selecting the correct options in the MBC interface.

Thank you!

Can you review this one with the team?

column453:
01/Jul/25 12:09 PM;stef003;Hi [~tobi017],

Apologies for the delayed response regarding the root cause of the issue.

Could you please confirm whether the following tracks (02, 07, 10, 13, 15, 17, 20, 22) had ISRCs assigned at the time of export? We have identified a bug in the A3 export process where tracks *without assigned ISRCs* are delivered under the same name. This leads us to suspect that the ISRCs for these tracks may have been empty.

Additionally, we noticed that some tracks, such as track 26, 28 and 36, had dummy ISRCs (isrc26, Isrc28, isrc36). This might be related to how the master was created.

_Please note: This issue only occurs on the master details page. Productized exports are not affected._

We are working on a fix. _C.C._ [~venu001]

Thank you,
Vitalii;;;
column454: 01/Jul/25 4:12 PM;mcatande;[~stef003] - Good catch on the missing ISRC issue. If we're looking for a fix. I suggest when an ISRC is not assigned we use the AOMA Track Master ID in place of the ISRC in the file name.  ;;;
column455:
23/Jul/25 4:00 AM;venu001;Fix pushed in build

[~tobi017] can you give this a try again and see if the issue persists? Should be good now;;;

column30:

In the UST interface, there's no sign of registration in progress, the file never shows up or shows the green progress bar.

Note: TusD was working earlier, but now seems to be not working. 

Let me know if this issue can be fixed

column1: Som Livre tracks only on 24bits
column30:
We need to get a report of all Som Livre products that don't have 16 bit assets registered if a 24 bit asset is. This report will need to let us know where only a 24 bit master exists and there's no 16 bit at all (i.e. there isn't even a master ID, but also if a if a 16 bit master has been created  but there is an empty 16 bit track and the product has a 24 bit track that can be used to create it. Here's the note from Ibrahim.

 

Hi Media Production team,

[~cout002] and [~romc001] from Som Livre noticed that a couple of their tracks that came from The Orchard were only registered as 24bits. Can you us by:
 # generating a report with all the Som Livre tracks that are registered in AOMA only as 24bits
 # Once we have the list of tracks (1) convert these tracks to 16bits

Thanks!

Ibrahim

 

Note to [~aomadatadevs]  - As a part of this report please include partially registered products as well (ie) if a product has 5 tracks and only 3 were registered please include that as well in this report. (This was requested by Jamie from GMP as a part of the audio call on 7/25)
column444:
28/Jul/25 6:42 PM;poth003;Hi [~jdunca1],

I have attached the data you have requested to the Jira. All the tracks listed do not have a 16 bit asset for the same product + ISRC combination but have a 24 bit asset. Please check it and let me know if you have any questions.

Thanks,

Phani;;;

column447:
27/May/25 3:19 PM;kmccar1;Hey Rick,

Could you please advise for Johan?

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column448:
28/May/25 8:36 PM;rhayloc;The AOMA preview was able to push past the corrupt frames, but other encoders usually do not- they crash and fail the render. If by chance they do finish the file, it often has a green or red solid frame where the processing fails on the corrupt frames- a corrupt "hit". Either way, this product has not been able to deliver in this state despite attempts to fix/ re-encode the master. I just tried again with Adobe ME and it crashed- screen grabs attached. I see the bad frames at around 20 seconds in on the master when the close up of the guitarist's hand- see attached.

We have had this specific video flagged several times over the years and should replace it or remove it- each time we get a report on the failure we have several team members from delivery, ops, and media production take a lot of time to look into it and try to resolve. I just happened to recall the last times I worked on this and realize it is still unresolved and failing.

Adding- it's out of my wheelhouse a bit but.. I think it may also be possible to put this on a blocking table so it does not deliver again, if purging it is not desirable. May need Account Management to advise on that.

 ;;;
column449: 06/Jun/25 6:18 PM;mcatande;[~anem002] - Can you please advise per Rick's comment below? ;;;
column451:
17/Jun/25 9:07 PM;kmccar1;*Product replacement and / or deletion* 

_Miller, Craig, Object Lab commented on DPSO-67389_ 

1) AOMA - Link Assets to the replacement Products in AOMA 

2) GRPS, EOM - Publish, Order and Deliver the replacement Products 

3) GRPS - Cancel and Scrap the old products (This will change the Publish Status to Pending Scrapped and begin revoking the Products from Partners) 

4) GRPS - Once Revokes are processed, the Product will move from Pending Scrapped to Scrapped (automatically) 

5) AOMA - Once Scrapped, you will be able to unlink the assets in AOMA (and you will probably not want to relink them) ;;;
column453:
17/Jun/25 9:46 PM;mcatande;Hey All, 

There's 'deleting the asset' and then there is revoking the product.

Note that this is an active product, live at select outlets, {+}generating revenue{+}, but.. it's non-maintainable. The asset is corrupt and this product cannot be subsequently delivered to any other partners or updated. 

Revoking the product will make it unavailable anywhere ever again and it will no longer be available where it currently is and will no longer generate any revenue.  

In the past, we've discussed this same issue as these corrupt assets come back in tickets to haunt us regularly.  The decision in the past has been to keep the product live and not revoke. We created [https://jira.smedigitalapps.com/jira/browse/AMSE-917] to create an indicator for Supply Chain users to know this product is non-maintainable due to file corruption. 

Before this is revoked, wanted to put this out there.  ;;;
column454: 23/Jun/25 4:47 PM;anem002;If everyone is ok with the solution Mike suggest I'm happy with doing that.;;;
column455:
06/Aug/25 4:43 PM;rhayloc;I am fine with Mike's solution above... Not sure who else needs to sign off on that, or who then actions the next steps here, but please let's try to wrap this one this week.

Thanks;;;
column456: 06/Aug/25 4:47 PM;mcatande;I think we can probably close this out as there is nothing to do.  Until we have AMSE-917 these will keep rearing their heads.  ;;;
column457:
06/Aug/25 8:08 PM;kmccar1;Thanks Mike, will close this out then.

Keith;;;

A registration of a 24 Bit WAV asset swap with the downconvert to 16 Bit WAV option checked caused some confusion today due to the validation error: "The bit depth specified in the file name does not match the bit depth of the master type. Bit depth 16 value expected, but was 24 instead."

Can you please review Job ID: 2706980, on G010005603362J from today? Was the validation error a temporary glitch during the downconvert process? FYI, the registration completed successfully.

Note, the file was named "Master - Jeg Lovar (Main) [16 bit] V3_pre2 (1).wav" and was a 24 Bit WAV file despite having '...[16 bit] in the name.

column1: DMDS export with no Closed Captions / empty CC track - G010005569473W
column30:
There are some issues with exporting deliverables to DMDS- see this WPTS ticket below for details.

[~tang002] We will want to pull the logs for the export IDs for G010005569473W. We will need to reg the video and SCC file in Stage to a dummy product, order a DMDS to a test folder, check the MXF output and compare the logs. This is somewhat I priority to resolve, though the delivery for this was already completed manually.

https://jira.smedigitalapps.com/jira/browse/WPTS-449190
column244:
AOMA Support
Hours: Monday-Friday, 3:30 am-8:00 pm EST
Emergency After-Hours Support: Send an email to aoma.support@sonymusic.com with the JIRA ticket number and a brief description.
column444:
31/Jul/25 8:19 PM;woom001;Hi [~tang002] 

for background:

DMDS export for G010005569473W (4K video with SCC registration) arrives at the partner with an empty CC track; no closed captions despite there being a 608 track created.

other recent DMDS exports have CC track, and G0100055621370 which contains the same/similar SCC (but different video) was exported as a test to DMDS and has CC.

this doesn't look like DPSA-30190, there have been no recent vantage upgrades and other products are being delivered with CC.

we thought it could have been the SCC file itself was bad, but a hot-swap with a new SCC file resulted in the same at the partner, a video with CC track but no CC's.

guessing it could be the combination of this video (4K) with this SCC in conversion, but can't really tell. hoping the vantage logs might shed some light on what's going here.

thanks.;;;
column445: 31/Jul/25 10:22 PM;tang002;Hi AOMA team, can you help to retreat the request ID of this faulty registration? ;;;
column446:
01/Aug/25 3:58 PM;kori002;Hi [~venu001]  

Please check this out as soon as possible.;;;
column448:
01/Aug/25 5:16 PM;tang002;Hi [~rhayloc], [~woom001],
Unlike FFMPEG, Vantage workflow doesn't provide an all-in-one log for the job. Instead, it's progress bar and session metadata for each tile. And to save disk space, we delete the job once it is completed successfully from Vantage. 
Let me pull those sources to Stage and trigger a conversion, once it's done I'll save the job history and see if I can get anything out of it.
Thanks!;;;
column449:
04/Aug/25 10:03 PM;tang002;Hi [~rhayloc], [~woom001] ,

I manually executed the job in Stage Vantage. As I mentioned earlier, Vantage doesn't have the type of all-in-one log output, but I've saved the job history there and feel free to log in to the Vantage server and check any action tiles or job info there (video output location on the server: E:\VantageLocalTest\CAV392500034_G010005569473W.mxf). column447:
09/May/25 8:22 PM;kmccar1;Just to recap a bit on this issue, as discussed today. Long term fix would be to make sure that the entries in the "Notifications" tab remain as they were after an unexpected log-out. That way, the prior upload job can either be resumed, or at least the upload status provided.

In the meantime, I think it's best that Tim signs out and back into the system prior to starting a new upload after any period of inactivity. Hopefully this will ensure that there are no log outs during the upload process. Let's see how it goes on your end next week, [~mart036]. Feel free to update this ticket or reach out via Teams.

Thanks,

Keith;;;
column448: 12/May/25 1:21 PM;mart036;thanks Keith, I'll do that;;;

column1: Failed to sent change info about ... from channel pub: publish_mass_upd
column30:
Dear [~hotline_grps] , We are getting errors in Pub channel (publish_mass_upd) since  2025-07-22T15:43:53.060+00:00 on PROD. In the response the following error message can be read: {noformat} 503 Service Unavailable

Service Unavailable

The server is temporarily unable to service your request due to maintenance downtime or capacity problems. Please try again later.

{noformat} The url is: [https://aoma-api-prod-int.smcdp-de.net/raas.export/webService/priorityBatchRequest] Could you please check it with the AOMA team? Thanks, Sandor
column444:
23/Jul/25 3:26 PM;zeki001;Hello [~hotline_grps], 

The GRAS Export is currently down in production. We are in the "scream test" phase before its final decommissioning.

Publish status updates are now handled by the RDX CDC process. It appears that GRPS is still calling the GRAS EXPORT web service concurrently with RDX CDC, although it should no longer be doing so.

If you notice any missing publish status updates, please let us know so we can investigate.

Thanks,
Alem;;;
column446:
23/Jul/25 6:05 PM;kiss015;Hello [~zeki001] / [~vleung1]
Under RDX-640 most of the publish related messaging was migrated to the new RDX channel and in the past months they were sent out both on the old and new interface. Now for those the parallel testing phase is done as I see so we can decomission the old service.
I'd like to just clarify one point: on RDX-640 not all of the messages were moved over, the ones implemented in RPS-7993 are not included in the new channnel (though some parts may be covered as I am checking).
Are you OK with completely stopping the old service and only continue sending via RDX?
thanks,
Adam;;;
column447: 23/Jul/25 6:16 PM;vleung1;[~kiss015] , please check and let us know.  We did the CDC comparison between GRAS Export and RDX, which included these priority imports and everything looks the same.  Can you also give us a few products to double check on our end as well?;;;
column448:
23/Jul/25 7:51 PM;mohr002;[~kiss015], [~rmayer1] , [~vleung1] - in our discussion today, Vivien indicated GRPS no longer needs to send these mass publishes as they have been confirmed to be covered by the RDX CDC Filters.

Please confirm as you mentioned there may be gaps.;;;
column449:
24/Jul/25 10:06 AM;bugy001;hi,

the old publish channel is disabled.

regards,

Sandor;;;
column450:
24/Jul/25 8:52 PM;kiss015;Hello [~zeki001] / [~vleung1] (cc [~mohr002] / [~rmayer1]).
I investigated the RDX channel service configurations and we are good. They cover the old "publish_auto" without gaps (in fact they send change info about more changes).
I also checked our database for the last ~ 1.5 months and no discrepancies.

I executed the following selects:
-- all successful notifications on the old "pub" channel with type "publish_auto" (implementation of RPS-7993)
select * from vgra030 a where channel_id = 22 and notification_type = 'publish_auto' and mod_stamp > '20250601' and a.response_code = '200'
9815 rows

-- all successful notifications on the "pub" channel with type "publish_auto" and no corresponding RDX notification for the same subject (product #) + transaction (transaction is checked to ensure that the same save triggered it)
select * from vgra030 a where channel_id = 22 and notification_type = 'publish_auto' and mod_stamp > '20250601' and a.response_code = '200'
and not exists (select * from vgra030 b where b.channel_id = 54 and a.subject_id = b.subject_id and a.orig_revision_notif_id = b.orig_revision_notif_id)
0 rows

-- report of the "publish_auto" - RDX notification pairs
select * from vgra030 a, vgra030 b where a.channel_id = 22 and a.notification_type = 'publish_auto' and a.mod_stamp > '20250601'
and b.channel_id = 54 and a.subject_id = b.subject_id and a.orig_revision_notif_id = b.orig_revision_notif_id
9815 rows (just like the first select)

The attached [DPSA-31237.xlsx] file contains the paired notifications, the old channel with white background, the new with green.
They are connected via columns F to AE and O to AN. It can be used for spot checking notifications if needed.


;;;
column451: 02/Aug/25 2:44 AM;mohr002;[~kiss015] - that's good news.  So we can proceed with disabling this in GRPS correct.  Is there anything I need to do?;;;
column452: 03/Aug/25 9:21 PM;kiss015;hello [~mohr002] nothing to do on your end.;;;

column1: UST incorrectly showing only Immersive Audio option for G0100055971967 (normal digital longplay)
column30:
Hi team,

Laura Lever has set up this product: G0100055971967 as a normal digital longplay product but the Immersive Audio option is only showing up in UST. Can you please check and advise? 

 

!image-2025-07-31-11-48-25-315.png!

 

DX

!image-2025-07-31-11-50-24-281.png!

The metadata has been reimported.

!image-2025-07-31-11-32-31-146.png!

 

!image-2025-07-31-11-52-22-013.png!

Please let us know if we are missing something on our end.

Thanks,

Fiona
column444:
31/Jul/25 4:31 PM;kuma011;Hi [~burg036],

Looking into this issue.

Regards,
Kiran.;;;
column445:
01/Aug/25 1:46 AM;kuma011;Hi [~burg036],

Here is my findings:

Comment: ISRC Mapping Inconsistency for "The Feeling"

Track: The Feeling
Primary ISRC: *GBARL2401535*
Primary Product: *G0100055971967*
 * Expected Dolby Atmos Mapping:
*GBARL2401535* is currently linked as a Related Dolby Atmos ISRC. It points to Dolby product {*}G010005389965N{*}, which correctly contains the Dolby ISRC: {*}GBARL2401541{*}. This product is confirmed to be a Dolby Atmos release with a registered Dolby master.

 * Inconsistency Identified:
A separate stereo product, {*}G010005391907W{*}, has a registered WAV 16-bit master with ISRC GBARL2401560.
However, this stereo product is also referencing *GBARL2401535 *as a Related Dolby Atmos ISRC.
Additionally, G010005391907W lists a related product link back to {*}G0100055971967{*}(the original stereo product).

 * Problem Summary:
{*}GBARL2401535{*}, which is a stereo ISRC, is incorrectly being used as a Related Dolby Atmos ISRC in another stereo product. This creates a conflict, as *GBARL2401535* is: The primary stereo ISRC for *G0100055971967,* Also being treated as a Dolby Atmos ISRC in *G010005391907W.* The correct Dolby ISRC is *GBARL2401541* and should be the only one used for Atmos linkage.

 * Recommendation:
Please review the performance_rel_audio_isrc_map entries and correct the mapping to:
Ensure GBARL2401535 is used only as a stereo ISRC and Replace any incorrect Atmos references with the valid Dolby ISRC: GBARL2401541

Attaching the screen shots. 
!Image 1.png|thumbnail! !Image 2.png|thumbnail! !Image 3.png|thumbnail! !Image 4.png|thumbnail! 
Let me know if further clarification is needed.

Regards,
Kiran.;;;
column446:
01/Aug/25 2:24 AM;kmccar1;This makes sense to me. I must say again, amazing detective work on this one, Kiran. 

[~leve004] could you please check in on the label-copy side of this one? We're thinking the stereo audio buckets should be available once corrected. 

Thanks,
Keith;;;
column447:
01/Aug/25 9:40 AM;burg036;[~kuma011]. Thanks so much for that information. Great findings!

[~leve004] can you please review Kiran's comments?

Thanks!

Fiona;;;
column448:
01/Aug/25 10:40 AM;leve004;Thanks so much [~kuma011] never would have figured this out without you! I've removed the incorrectly flagged 'Dolby' ISRC and this now lets me upload the audio! 

Thanks team x ;;;

United Kingdom

column1: UST Video Upload Autocorrect Cropping Issue - VVXY01790200Z
column30:
Hi Mizuki,

It shouldn’t happen again. The video engineers should be checking the dimensions of the VSC against the registered video’s resolution before locking the QC notes. 

 

@Sony Music-US, AOMA Support would you mind looking into why cropping metadata was added during the UST autocorrected registration, as the video contains full frame active pixels as well as pillar bars (inactive pixels) 

 

In the meantime, I’ll send a message to the video engineers to ensure they double check this during QC.

 

Please let me know if you have any further questions.

 

Regards,

*Leon Dufficy* *| Manager - Global Media Production (ARO)*

Sony Music Entertainment Ltd

100 Harris St | Pyrmont NSW | 2009

 

 

 

*From:* Fukui, Mizuki <[mizuki.fukui@sonymusic.co.jp|mailto:mizuki.fukui@sonymusic.co.jp]>
*Date:* Tuesday, 29 July 2025 at 15:04
*To:* Dufficy, Leon <[leon.dufficy@sonymusic.com|mailto:leon.dufficy@sonymusic.com]>, Alcock, Tim, Sony Music <[tim.alcock@sonymusic.com|mailto:tim.alcock@sonymusic.com]>, Burgess, Fiona , EXT <[fiona.burgess.ext@sonymusic.com|mailto:fiona.burgess.ext@sonymusic.com]>, Sony Music-US, AOMA Support <[aoma.support@sonymusic.com|mailto:aoma.support@sonymusic.com]>, Haleem, Mohammed, Reyk Tech <[mohammed.haleem.reyktech@sonymusic.com|mailto:mohammed.haleem.reyktech@sonymusic.com]>, Sony Music US - GMP Video <[gmpvideo@sonymusic.com|mailto:gmpvideo@sonymusic.com]>, UK Media Production <[UKmediaproduction@sonymusic.com|mailto:UKmediaproduction@sonymusic.com]>

{*}件名{*}{*}:{*} Re: UST Video Upload Issue

 

Morning all, 

 

I wanted to add to this conversation about VVXY01790200Z ({+}[WPTS-447885|https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fjira.smedigitalapps.com%2Fjira%2Fbrowse%2FWPTS-447885&data=05%7C02%7Cfiona.burgess.ext%40sonymusic.com%7C3678945f3f1d4e03f1cd08ddce61f2f5%7Cf0aff3b791a54aaeaf71c63e1dda2049%7C0%7C0%7C638893642456355098%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=QUk5ZDJmoyVbuUraTgjTziqmShLIZQEZuUvZxQKtswI%3D&reserved=0]{+}). This video has both full frame (16:9) and pillar bars (4:3) throughout. The majority of the video has pillar bars, which is why I think the UST autocorrect added cropping metadata. Due to the full frame sections the engineer deleted the autocorrected cropping metadata but forgot to update the VSC. The VSC has been fixed and registered as full frame (16:9) as intended. 

 

 

Regards,

*Leon Dufficy* *| Manager - Global Media Production (ARO)*

Sony Music Entertainment Ltd

100 Harris St | Pyrmont NSW | 2009

column445:
29/Jul/25 2:56 PM;burg036;From Michael C.
Hey All, 
 
UST for SFV has crop detection built in. It automatically adds crop data and the engineer is currently expected to validate that crop info and confirm both the video and VSC are as intended. 
As we are aware of the risk with the auto-crop logic, we have an enhancement open to modify this auto-crop logic to suggest crop data settings instead of automatically fill out the crop data settings.  
Ticket here: [https://jira.smedigitalapps.com/jira/browse/AMSE-1174|https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fjira.smedigitalapps.com%2Fjira%2Fbrowse%2FAMSE-1174&data=05%7C02%7Cfiona.burgess.ext%40sonymusic.com%7C12afe85ccf1a4f6a6f9a08ddce9e8569%7Cf0aff3b791a54aaeaf71c63e1dda2049%7C0%7C0%7C638893902657484631%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=oVl65itShM8y5WcuXREwwnvl%2Bq0tXFgH1gEM%2BYJjDRQ%3D&reserved=0] 
 
I’ll see if we can expedite this enhancement in light of this recent issue. 
 
Please let me know if you have any questions. 
 
Thanks, ;;;
column446: 29/Jul/25 3:43 PM;burg036;Closing this per Michael's comment referencing [AMSE-1174|https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fjira.smedigitalapps.com%2Fjira%2Fbrowse%2FAMSE-1174&data=05%7C02%7Cfiona.burgess.ext%40sonymusic.com%7C12afe85ccf1a4f6a6f9a08ddce9e8569%7Cf0aff3b791a54aaeaf71c63e1dda2049%7C0%7C0%7C638893902657484631%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJFbXB0eU1hcGkiOnRydWUsIlYiOiIwLjAuMDAwMCIsIlAiOiJXaW4zMiIsIkFOIjoiTWFpbCIsIldUIjoyfQ%3D%3D%7C0%7C%7C%7C&sdata=oVl65itShM8y5WcuXREwwnvl%2Bq0tXFgH1gEM%2BYJjDRQ%3D&reserved=0];;;

column1: After delivery to DSP WiMP Digital Audio Track Preview Clips play back as white noise (jan.henrik.ohme@sonymusic.com)
column30:
Hi, Sandeep

Jan Henrik Ohme of Sony Music Norway (username, ohme01) reported to us the following. Please note that AOMA Support was able to successfully play both the 30 second clip as well as the full length ones. 

Jan's message is below, as is our initial reply to him. Please advise if there are any other considerations to be made regarding the issue he is experiencing.

Thank you
Erik Wood
AOMA Support




****************************************

Hi There,

The DSP WiMP says the 30 sec previews on 2 of our releases are only "white noise"!
Do you know how this could have happened, and how do we correct/QC/redeliver as soon as possible?
The previews seems fine in AOMA to me?

The products in question are
G010003119067Z
And
G010003113090O


**************************

Hello, Jan

We tested the 30 second previews and the full length clips for the tracks on each product and they played without any issue. 

Please check to make sure that you have the latest version of your internet browser installed (How do I update my browser?: http://www.computerhope.com/issues/ch001388.htm), as well as the latest version of Adobe Flash (http://get.adobe.com/flashplayer/). 
Once this is verified, please clear your internet browser cache and history, then completely close all your browser windows to ensure the program is shut down. Then open a fresh browser window, log in, and try previewing the clips again.
column244:
AOMA Support
Hours: Monday-Friday, 3:30 am-8:00 pm EST
Emergency After-Hours Support: Send an email to aoma.support@sonymusic.com with the JIRA ticket number and a brief description.
column444:
19/Feb/14 12:48 PM;ewood01;Jan responded to my troubleshooting recommendations:

Hi Erik,

 

The preview clips play fine in AOMA. J

It’s after delivery to DSP WiMP that they appear as white noise only.

This is my worry, not the master in AOMA, which plays flawlessly. J

 

Thanks,

Jan;;;

column1: VCA / UST - VCA asset must be 72dpi, the header data of the submitted file is missing this data.
column30:
_VCA asset must be 72dpi, the header data of the submitted file is missing this data._

_EX:_ 

G010005557068J - Alexandre Pires, Ana Castela

 
{color:#000000}*From:* Catandella, Michael, Sony Music <michael.catandella@sonymusic.com>
*Sent:* Friday, July 18, 2025 10:53
*To:* McCarthy, Keith, EXT <keith.mccarthy.ext@sonymusic.com>; Oliveira, Veronica, Sony Music Brazil <veronica.oliveira.first@sonymusic.com>; Sony Music - US, Media Production <GDL20007685@sonymusic.com>
*Cc:* Sony Music-US, AOMA Support <aoma.support@sonymusic.com>; Cabello, Jaklyn, Sony Music <jaklyn.cabello@sonymusic.com>; Encizo, Jeanine, Sony Music <jeanine.encizo@sonymusic.com>
*Subject:* Re: Issue - Upload VCA{color}
 

Appears we have the same old issue we have with cover art.  Our analysis tools fail to pick up the Dpi metadata.  Both photoshop and Apple Preview App are showing them dpi as 72. 

My only thought is the software assumes 72dpi when the header data is not there. 

A 'save as' in photoshop worked and also an 'export as' also worked and I was able to register both.

I have attached the original file for Alexandre Pires - G010005557068J as well as a 'save as' and an 'export as' version of the image including txt output of the metadata using exifreader

We have the enhancement open for fixing the 'invalid units' issue and this appears to be the same.
column444:
18/Jul/25 7:06 PM;kmccar1;HI team,

This is the thing Mike was just discussing at the end of the video call. The attached zip has the files as noted in his email message. Please let me know if you need anything else.

Thanks,

Keith;;;

Attached is a user guideline for uploading archives using TUSD. Please note that if you have both TUSD and ASPERA upload permissions, the system will default to using TUSD when you *drag and drop* folders.
However, if you use the *“Select Folders”* option, you will be able to choose whether to upload using TUSD or ASPERA. Thanks!

[^DA TusD User Guidelines.docx]

column1: Report of all archive masters registered under archive SG India <santosh.keshari@sonymusic.com>
column30:
Hi DB Team,

 

Please pull the below report as requested for all archive masters registered under archive SG India.

 

Please include asset type, package types, folder names and folder sizes registered to each archive master in addition to the below info. Please include Parent Rep Owner, Rep Owner and Maintenance Owner info as well.

Please indicate storage level, e.g. Glacier, Glacier Deep etc.

 

Thanks,
Manuela

 
||Archive Master Number||Archive Master Category||Artist||Archive Master Title||Archive Master Type||Created By||Created/date of registration||Notes||Status|| ||
{quote}It would be helpful if you could share a consolidated report of the total archived content (Stems, Minus, 5.1, and IT tracks) in past four months, along with the overall file size. This will help us determine the total cost incurred for the content archived in AOMA and provide a reference for estimating costs related to future archival content.

 

Regards

Santosh
{quote}
column444:
18/Jul/25 12:55 AM;poth003;Hi [~mbrice1],

The data of all archive masters with the requested information has been attached to the JIRA. The report was run for the last 4 months. Please review the data and let me know if there are any questions.

Thanks,

Phani;;;
column445: 18/Jul/25 2:37 PM;mbrice1;Thank you.;;;

column1: Legacy Search "Video" checkbox filtering out recent video results
column30:
Hey team,

If I Legacy Search G010005520613G with the Video checkbox selected, I get no results.

!image-2025-05-30-16-48-15-259.png!

If I deselect the Video checkbox, I get a result.

!image-2025-05-30-16-50-10-230.png!

If I search the artist Sacha with the Video checkbox selected, I see video results, but not "Woman In The Mirror," G010005520613G.

!image-2025-05-30-16-53-04-415.png!

If I deselect the Video checkbox, I see "Woman In The Mirror," G010005520613G.

!image-2025-05-30-16-55-13-468.png!

Random bug, but could you please check it out when you have a chance? 

Please let me know if you need any futher information.

column1: Physical Side Linked Virtual Masters / AOMA3
column30:
Team,

We need to be able to "View Link" for these side-linked virtual masters in AOMA3. There's too many errors when bouncing back and forth between A2 and A3 - I need to be able to advise users of their workflows in the system with certainty - this does not help and just causes more unnecessary confusion for the users and support "team."

!image-2025-07-16-09-22-49-643.png!

Thanks,

Keith

AOMA Support
Hours: Monday-Friday, 3:30 am-8:00 pm EST
Emergency After-Hours Support: Send an email to aoma.support@sonymusic.com with the JIRA ticket number and a brief description.

column445: 16/Jul/25 5:04 PM;kori002;hey [~kmccar1] This is more of an enhancement. I will check with Rohit and Mike if we can get an AMSE for this to plan it out ;;;
column446: 16/Jul/25 7:43 PM;kori002;[~roraj01]  or [~mcatande]  Please advise;;;
column447: 17/Jul/25 2:35 PM;mcatande;Would this really be a new AMSE?  Seems like an additional step in open link support.  Effectively there should be an AMSE to support all linking in A3 replacing A2 linking and then Development tickets as subtasks/linked laying out all the phases in complete implementation.  This is just part of the whole in transitioning all linking functionality to A3, not really a separate enhancement request no? ;;;

column1: unlinked tracks showing on "associated masters" page
column30:
Hello all, hope you're well.

On product G010005101199O, Aoma 3 product page shows tracks 2 and 4 only linked to the product as 24/44.1, Aoma 2 product linking shows the same, as does Aoma 3 linking, however I can see and play all 4 tracks on the product at 44.1kHz from the associated masters page. 

Could you please advise? We need to link a new master for track 3 @ 96kHz but would like to be sure this issue won't affect delivery of the mixed sample rate product before proceeding.

Thank you!
deb
______________

ticket WPTS-447922

pn G010005101199O

Kiran

 ;;;
column448:
22/Jul/25 9:12 PM;kmccar1;Hi [~verr002],

This has been confirmed as a display issue - tracks 1 and 3 are not linked under the 44.1 virtual. master. Please proceed with linking the track 3 under the 96k virtual master, and then please double check on the product details page for each virtual master that previews are correct. 

Please let us know if you have any trouble at that point.

Thanks,

Keith;;;

Thank you for your help, we successfully linked the master to the product

Thanks!

column1: G010005259865A - Linking issue with virutal master 24879280
column30:
The product is showing that only track 2 is associated view AOMA2 linking and the view link popup in AOMA3 detail, and on the product tab. But if you toggle to the Virtual master 24879280, the full length version of track 2 is incorrectly associated and playing back as track 1.

 

!Screenshot 2024-03-15 at 4.38.56 PM.png|width=721,height=292!

!Screenshot 2024-03-15 at 4.34.44 PM.png|width=694,height=266!

!Screenshot 2024-03-15 at 4.34.08 PM.png|width=770,height=344!

 

!Screenshot 2024-03-15 at 4.41.27 PM.png|width=754,height=200!
column444:
15/Mar/24 10:32 PM;venu001;This is a known display issue that will be fixed with the overall linking rearchitecture effort that our AMEBA team is working.

Master 24879280 is linked to another product, G010005230225J. If you check the display of this other product, you can see that there are 2 tracks on its Product tab. This master was originally created for this other product; so when its linked to the product listed in this DPSA, its just re-using that same master data (and why its showing twice on G010005259865A).

!image-2024-03-15-17-30-38-463.png|width=664,height=199!

There should be no partner delivery issue here, but I would check the preview in the Product tab for G010005259865A just to make sure that the right preview is playing for each track.;;;

column1: Continuing CES Exports with Label Copy PDF Issues
column30:
Dear Support Team,
We are still experiencing issues with the label copy generated from AOMA during our export processes. I’ve attached an example below for your reference.
The manufacturer (in this case, Sonopress) has now raised concerns, as the label copy is incorrect with *every* export. The manual processes (such as retrieving label copy from DX) are causing additional manual effort across the board.
Could you please investigate this issue in more detail and let me know when a fix can be expected?
Thanks,
Kai

column1: Products Full Published in GRPS without cover masters linked in AOMA (SME UK)
column30:
Hi there team,

Shanaj from the GRPS team pointed out linked ticket GRPSS-5065 today. The UK team had two products that had audio (16bit WAV and Dolby Atmos Full Master) linked, but no cover masters. The user(s) had inadvertently gone into GRPS and Full Published, later realizing that the products had no cover assets.

The first product is currently in it's original state - Full Published without a cover master linked. The second product had the cover master added around 5 of 10 this morning EST but had been Full Published without it prior to that time. 

G010005484177N / G010005602324A 

!image-2025-07-17-12-04-51-403.png!

!image-2025-07-17-12-08-54-602.png!

GRPSS-5065:

!image-2025-07-17-12-07-56-492.png!

Could you please check this out on the AOMA side? Please let me know if you need any further information.

Thanks,

Keith
column444: 17/Jul/25 6:15 PM;kmccar1;Shanaj set up a product in STAGE as well, {*}G010004982655M{*}. We linked two audio tracks here - the product is appearing as Full Publish Ready in GRPS Integration.;;;

17/Jul/25 6:49 PM;dewi013;Hi Keith,

I have also created a Jira directly for the GRPS devs as this looks like a failure on our side but will reach out here if we need AOMA support.

Thanks

column1: Attempting track swap on A2 linking interface, interface doesn't show the link data
column30:
Product: G0100056044095 

Virtual master: 27250193 

master Type: 24bit/48K wav 

Currently this virtual master has 19 of 20 tracks linked, tracks 1 through 18 and 20. We need to link the final track to the product Track 19.  Master ID 27250738 side 1 track 1 

We use the A2 linking interface to do this as A3 does not yet support editing/adding tracks to virtual masters for stereo wav. 

When we go into the A2 interface the current linked data is not present: 

!image-2025-07-17-16-12-15-957.png|width=1334,height=623!

No master or track data is present. Normally we'd just add the data for track 19 and commit the link to add the new track. 

This is what the 16 bit virtual master on the same product looks like, note the data included: 

!image-2025-07-17-16-09-23-223.png|width=1322,height=647!

I worked with AOMA support to fill in all the missing data from the 24bit and resubmit via A2 and nothing happened.  

We're currently asking to linnk on the back end as a work-around. We need to investigate the issue here and work toward a fix.
column244:
AOMA Support
Hours: Monday-Friday, 3:30 am-8:00 pm EST
Emergency After-Hours Support: Send an email to aoma.support@sonymusic.com with the JIRA ticket number and a brief description.
column444:
17/Jul/25 10:24 PM;sira001;[~kmccar1] ,

Track 19 has been added for the wav24 master from the backend. Please verify.

Regards,

Vinodhan;;;
column445:

column1: Display issue on vinyl product 19802956091
column30:
Hey all, hope you’re well!

 

I am experiencing a display issue on a vinyl product.

I have registered a 2 component vinyl through Direct Upload; the upload was successful and the 4 audio files are registered in the correct order in Aoma, but on the master detail page I see the titles and ISRC of side A on all 4 sides of the vinyl. If I check the product detail page instead, the titles are correct for all components but there are ISRC mismatches on side B, C and D.

 

Would you be able to look into that please?

Thanks!

 

________________________

Jira ticket WPTS-446638

Product number 19802956091

Master ID 27229233

Thanks,

Keith;;;

column1: Video Custom Art (VCA) - Bulk account updates
column30:
Hi there db team,

This request is two parts. 
 # Any users that have either the *View & Execute Released* or *View & Execute Pre-Release and Released* Permission level for the *Video Screen Capture* Master Type for any available Security Groups, should have that same Permission level added for the *Video Custom Art* Master Type. (ex: the kmccar1 account has View & Execute Pre-Release and Released for Video Screen Capture under the Columbia and Legacy security groups. The account should be updated with View & Execute Pre-Release and Released for Video Custom Art under Columbia and Legacy). 
 # Any users that have the REGISTER VSC permission should be updated with the TEMP UST VIEW VCA.

Please let me know if you have any questions on this one.

Thanks,

Keith

column1: UST: Validation Errors Incorrectly thrown on 24 Bit MFIT Master - G0100055972042
column30:
Hi team,

Please check on this failed registration, job ID: 2704004. FYI, the user selected 24 Bit WAV MFiT master with a sample rate 96kHrz. She added the files to each track individually via Select File, and used the TusD uploader. Note, the user did not select the downconvert option. The 16 Bit WAV master was registered separately.
|[27218098|https://aoma.smcdp-de.net/master/27218098]|[G0100055972042|https://aoma.smcdp-de.net/product/G0100055972042?masterId=27218098]| |2704004|WAV 24| |Failed|kory002|Masterworks|07/09/2025 05:55:56|

 

The registration failed with the validation error: "The bit depth specified in the file name does not match the bit depth of the master type. Bit depth 24 value expected, but was 16 instead. "

!image-2025-07-09-13-23-36-843.png!

!image-2025-07-09-13-23-52-626.png!

The files appear to be the correct sample rate and following the same steps, we were able to register the master without error.
|[27218345|https://aoma.smcdp-de.net/master/27218345]|[G0100055972042|https://aoma.smcdp-de.net/product/G0100055972042?masterId=27218345]| |2704053|WAV 24|01_AlexisFfrench_PaperHearts_9624.wav 02_AlexisFfrench_LastTripAroundTheSun_9624.wav 03_AlexisFfrench_CloserToForever_9624.wav
 |Registration Successful|burg036|Masterworks Confidential|07/09/2025 06:41:05|07/09/2025 06:42:37
Duration: 00:01:32| |

The files are available via the link below.

[https://sonymusic.cimediacloud.com/r/m3dNn4VXThFA]

Thanks,

Fiona

column446:
09/Jul/25 2:48 PM;kuma039;Hi [~read008] /[~burg036] ,

I have reviewed this further and found that both of upload got stuck and not proceeding further

1). WestLife_MyLove_ProRes_Rushes_35mm folder I can see that it is 3TB size and almost all file got stuck in there. 

2). For folder WestLife_MyLove_ProRes_Rushes_35mm_NewUpload, Westlife_MyLove_31A33A_20443_2115320_Recapture.mov(218 GB) and Westlife MyLove_1B5B_20430_2115318.mov(227 GB) got completed but third file Westlife_MyLove_1A5A_35MM_20445_Recapture.mov(out of 318 GB only 66 GB completed and it stuck due to network issue as it is expecting more bytes to transfer but have not received)

I am assigning this ticket to our DB team to mark the status as failed for both asset uploads. Once it is done, you can try re upload above using Aspera.

Regards,

Deepak;;;
column449:
09/Jul/25 4:30 PM;read008;Thanks Team!

I'll try uploading again tonight with Aspera. Hopefully, there won't be a further issues. 

Thanks for all your help again! 

Cristen

column1: DPSA for tracking Atmos previews that aren't generating properly
column30: Creating a DPSA to track products with tracks that aren't creating the Atmos preview properly. This is a known issue and only a ticket for updating when we find previews that aren't correct.
column444:
06/Jun/25 6:14 PM;kuma011;Hi [~venu001],

could you please take a look on it.

Regards,
Kiran;;;
column445:
06/Jun/25 6:34 PM;venu001;This is just a tracking DPSA that will be fixed with Matt C's/MC's changes. One for adjusting the CLI (it was being called instead of Matt's API), and the other for adjusting tracks > 64 channels.

This will be closed after changes are pushed to PROD;;;
column446: 16/Jun/25 1:24 PM;jone009;Flagging this Atmos preview, G010005569990R. Only drums, bass and vocal are in the preview for the first minute and then for the majority of the song.;;;
column447:
16/Jun/25 10:56 PM;venu001;[~jone009]

MC just pushed a fix in this afternoon. If the product below is < 64 channels, the preview should now be coming correctly. Can you try it again? (I guess you'd have to regenerate the preview to see how its sounding now? Or maybe re-register it?)

[~jdunca1] 

Assigning the DPSA back to you post MC's fix today. We still have the > 64 channel issue that needs to be fixed, but can you check on the < 64 channel ones? You can assign back to me once your check is done...I'll keep this open till the >64 channel fix is in on the 24th;;;
column448: 07/Jul/25 3:11 PM;venu001;Posting an update here: spot check for CLI call and 64 channel was conducted and passed internally and with GMP. This DPSA can now be closed I think;;;

column1: AOMA 2 Linking Error: Link failed due to the following unexpected error: org.hibernate.exception.GenericJDBCException: could not prepare statement
column30:
Hi team,

Getting this AOMA2 linking error for cover links in Prod and Stage: "Link failed due to the following unexpected error: org.hibernate.exception.GenericJDBCException: could not prepare statement". This error might be connected with the open AOMA 2 Hot Swap lining issue ticket (DPSA-31136).

*G010005590521U link attempt to cover master: 26961380*

*!image-2025-06-30-12-41-33-494.png!*

Fiona

column445:
30/Jun/25 3:34 PM;stef003;Hi,

should be the bug in legacy system, when it does an update for legacy search tables it fails due to some data duplication within transaction (there is already another entity with same public SearchForProductPK made by another master)
!image-2025-06-30-16-26-46-094.png|width=951,height=317!

we can use AOMA3 system to do the same linking.

(probably we should create bug ticket and try to fix that in legacy system);;;
